original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: and so on, up to:

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa de kun gyis //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa de kun gyis //
translated: All of those vajra holders

original: khyod la rtag tu srung bar byed //
analyzed: khyod la rtag tu srung bar byed //
translated: will always protect you.

original: ces pa'i bar du slob ma rnams dbang bskur ba'i skabs 'chad de //
analyzed: ces pa'i bar du slob ma rnams dbang bskur ba'i skabs 'chad de //
translated: This is explained in the context of the empowerment conferral for the disciples.

original: de la mngon par dbang bskur zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid mi zad pa'i rgyan rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor gyi byin gyis brlabs su 'gyur ba'i spyan sngar mngon sum du rin po che la sogs pa'i bum par chu🔽blugs ba ste /
analyzed: de la mngon par dbang bskur zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs mnyam pa nyid mi zad pa'i rgyan rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor gyi byin gyis brlabs su 'gyur ba'i spyan sngar mngon sum du rin po che la sogs pa'i bum par chu blugs ba ste /
translated: Here, empowerment means that in the presence of the mandala of the nature of the inseparable body, speech, and mind of the Bhagavat, the inexhaustible ornament, the empowerment is conferred with water from a vase made of jewels, and so on.

original: mngon par blugs zhes pa ni tshig gi don to //
analyzed: mngon par blugs zhes pa ni tshig gi don to //
translated: The word empowerment is the meaning of the word.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum du brtag par bya ba ni dbang bskur ba'i ming ji ltab dang / su la dbang bskur ba dang / ci'i phyir dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum du brtag par bya ba ni dbang bskur ba'i ming ji ltab dang / su la dbang bskur ba dang / ci'i phyir dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be analyzed in three ways: the name of the empowerment, the one to whom the empowerment is conferred, and the reason for the empowerment.

original: da la dbang bskur ba'i ming ji lta ba zhes pa ni spyir dbang bskur ba'i rnam pa mang ste /🔽spyir @150a * //
analyzed: da la dbang bskur ba'i ming ji lta ba zhes pa ni spyir dbang bskur ba'i rnam pa mang ste /🔽spyir @150a * //
translated: Here, the name of the empowerment is as follows: In general, there are many types of empowerment conferral.

original: sngags par bya ba'i phyir rig pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sngags par bya ba'i phyir rig pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: The knowledge-granting empowerment is for the sake of the mantra practitioner.

original: las kyi dbang bskur ba ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang mngon par spyod pa'i las bya ba dang gdon bsal ba la sogs pa bya bar dbang bskur ba ste /
analyzed: las kyi dbang bskur ba ni zhi ba dang rgyas pa dang mngon par spyod pa'i las bya ba dang gdon bsal ba la sogs pa bya bar dbang bskur ba ste /
translated: The activity empowerment is the empowerment to perform pacifying, increasing, and engaging activities, to remove spirits, and so on.

original: de la skabs 'dir ni slob dpon du dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba ste de ni ming ngo //
analyzed: de la skabs 'dir ni slob dpon du dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba ste de ni ming ngo //
translated: In this context, it is called the master empowerment, and that is the name.

original: su la dbang bskur bar bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: su la dbang bskur bar bya zhes pa ni /
translated: To whom should the empowerment be conferred?

original: slob ma phal thams cad la dbang bskur bar bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: slob ma phal thams cad la dbang bskur bar bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The empowerment should not be conferred on all ordinary disciples.

original: khyad par can gyi slob ma dam tshig lnga'i skabs nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi slob ma dam tshig lnga'i skabs nas gsungs pa /
translated: It should be conferred on special disciples who are taught the five pledges and

original: sngags dang phyag rgya yang bstan zhing /
analyzed: sngags dang phyag rgya yang bstan zhing /
translated: are also taught the mantra and mudra.

original: las dang bya ba la yang rab tu sbyar bar bya zhes pa ste sngags kyi rgyud rnams thos shing /
analyzed: las dang bya ba la yang rab tu sbyar bar bya zhes pa ste sngags kyi rgyud rnams thos shing /
translated: They should be fully trained in the activities and should listen to the mantra tantras and

original: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bri nus pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i slob ma rnams la dbang bskur te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bri nus pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i slob ma rnams la dbang bskur te /
translated: be able to draw the mandala and so on.

original: su la dbang bskur zhes pa ni de rnams la dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: su la dbang bskur zhes pa ni de rnams la dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: To whom is the consecration conferred? It is conferred on those.

original: ci'i phyir dbang bskur zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbang bskur zhes pa ni /
translated: Why is the consecration conferred?

original: chos kyi mig mi 'tshub par bya ba'i phyir te /🔽'jig rten na yang 'jig rten gyi gtsug lag lung bstan pa dang rtog pa dang sman la sogs pa rnams kyang slob mas rdzogs par lobs nas /
analyzed: chos kyi mig mi 'tshub par bya ba'i phyir te / 'jig rten na yang 'jig rten gyi gtsug lag lung bstan pa dang rtog pa dang sman la sogs pa rnams kyang slob mas rdzogs par lobs nas /
translated: It is conferred in order that the eye of the Dharma not be disturbed.

original: slob dpon gyis dbang bskur ba'i cho ga 'jig rten pa rnams la ji ltar srid par byas nas bshad pa la sogs pa bya bar slob ma la lung sbyin pa srid do //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis dbang bskur ba'i cho ga 'jig rten pa rnams la ji ltar srid par byas nas bshad pa la sogs pa bya bar slob ma la lung sbyin pa srid do //
translated: Even in the world, when a disciple has completely mastered the scriptures, logic, medicine, etc., the master performs the consecration ritual as much as possible, and then gives the disciple permission to teach, etc.

original: de dag kyang so so'i gtsug lag rdzogs par mi shes shing dbang ma bskur bar bshad pa la sogs pa byas na /
analyzed: de dag kyang so so'i gtsug lag rdzogs par mi shes shing dbang ma bskur bar bshad pa la sogs pa byas na /
translated: If they do not know the scriptures completely and are not consecrated, and then teach, etc.,

original: gtsug lag de dag ji lta ba bzhin du bshad mi nus pas de dag gis mig mi 'tshub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtsug lag de dag ji lta ba bzhin du bshad mi nus pas de dag gis mig mi 'tshub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: they will not be able to explain the scriptures as they are, and their eyes will be disturbed.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang slob ma rnams rgyud la sogs pa rdzogs par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang slob ma rnams rgyud la sogs pa rdzogs par shes par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, here also, the disciples should be made to understand the tantra completely.

original: de dag nyid slob dpon gyis mngon sum du bskor nas rgyud bshad pa dang / dkyil 'khor bri ba la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par slob dpon nyid kyis yid ches te /
analyzed: de dag nyid slob dpon gyis mngon sum du bskor nas rgyud bshad pa dang / dkyil 'khor bri ba la sogs pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par slob dpon nyid kyis yid ches te /
translated: The master himself should have confidence in the explanation of the tantra and in the drawing of the mandala, etc., by having directly seen them.

original: sems can gyi don byed nus par gyur pa rnams la dbang bskur na chos kyi mig mi 'tshub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed nus par gyur pa rnams la dbang bskur na chos kyi mig mi 'tshub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If he confers initiation on those who are able to work for the sake of sentient beings, the eye of the Dharma will not be disturbed.

original: gnyis su na de ltar mngon par 'dus pa'i slob ma des slob dpon du gyur na /
analyzed: gnyis su na de ltar mngon par 'dus pa'i slob ma des slob dpon du gyur na /
translated: On the other hand, if the disciple who has been initiated in this way becomes a master,

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyang khungs de lta bu las byung ba'i slob dpon de la yid ches shing btsun par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyang khungs de lta bu las byung ba'i slob dpon de la yid ches shing btsun par byed do //
translated: even worldly people will have confidence in that master and will revere him.

original: rim pa 'di lta bur dbang ma bskur ba rgyud la sogs pa mi shes par thug thub tu sngags kyi rgyud la sogs pa 'chad cing /
analyzed: rim pa 'di lta bur dbang ma bskur ba rgyud la sogs pa mi shes par thug thub tu sngags kyi rgyud la sogs pa 'chad cing /
translated: Those who have not been initiated in this way, who do not understand the tantra, etc., but who are self-important, explain the tantra, etc., of the mantra.

original: dkyil 'khor @150b 'dri na ji lta ba nyid du mi shes pas don log par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor @150b 'dri na ji lta ba nyid du mi shes pas don log par 'gyur na /
translated: If one does not know how to draw the mandala just as it is, the meaning will be distorted.

original: sngags kyi lha la sogs pas kyang byin gyis mi rlob pas ci bsams pa'i don mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi lha la sogs pas kyang byin gyis mi rlob pas ci bsams pa'i don mi 'grub ste /
translated: If the mantra deities and so forth do not bless it, the intended meaning will not be accomplished.

original: gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnams yid mi ches shing mi phyogs pas chos kyi mig 'tshubs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnams yid mi ches shing mi phyogs pas chos kyi mig 'tshubs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the disciples will not have confidence and will not be inclined, the eye of the Dharma will be obscured.

original: ci'i phyir dbang bskur zhes pa ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbang bskur zhes pa ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it called empowerment? It is for that reason.

original: de la dbang bskur ba yang /
analyzed: de la dbang bskur ba yang /
translated: Moreover, the empowerment

original: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi rgyal po dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi bka' khrims ston pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten gyi rgyal po dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi bka' khrims ston pa /
translated: is like the king of the world who teaches the law of the path of the ten virtues,

original: mngon par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu sbyin par byed pa de ji ltar rgyal thabs su bsgyur bar bya ba de bzhin du bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu sbyin par byed pa de ji ltar rgyal thabs su bsgyur bar bya ba de bzhin du bya ste /
translated: and grants the result of renunciation. Just as he is consecrated as the king,

original: 'di yang mngon par 'byung ba dang / ma lus pa'i bde ba'i 'bras bu sbyin par byed pa'i chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di yang mngon par 'byung ba dang / ma lus pa'i bde ba'i 'bras bu sbyin par byed pa'i chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba'i phyir te /
translated: so it is here, because the result of the fruit of complete bliss is granted by the Dharma king who is consecrated.

original: de yang rim pa 'di ltar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rim pa 'di ltar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, this should be done in the following stages.

original: thog mar rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi mdun du bar khru dos bcad de /
analyzed: thog mar rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi mdun du bar khru dos bcad de /
translated: First, in front of the root maṇḍala, measure out a distance of one cubit.

original: de dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor rim pa gcig pa sgo gcig pa bris la /
analyzed: de dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor rim pa gcig pa sgo gcig pa bris la /
translated: Draw the empowerment maṇḍala with one tier and one door.

original: de'i nang padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris te /
analyzed: de'i nang padma 'dab ma brgyad pa bris te /
translated: Draw an eight-petaled lotus inside that.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi grva bzhir rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhi bri /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi grva bzhir rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhi bri /
translated: Draw four vajra holders in the four corners of the maṇḍala.

original: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa yang byang chub sems dpa' bzhi dang / ci bgyi zhes pa bzhi ste brgyad bri /
analyzed: padma 'dab ma brgyad pa yang byang chub sems dpa' bzhi dang / ci bgyi zhes pa bzhi ste brgyad bri /
translated: Draw four bodhisattvas and four “what is to be done” in the eight petals of the lotus.

original: padmo'i dbus su chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge ram bris la der slob ma bzhag ste /
analyzed: padmo'i dbus su chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge ram bris la der slob ma bzhag ste /
translated: Draw the letter raṃ of the dharmadhātu in the center of the lotus. Place the disciple there.

original: dri dang me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa dang bkra shis pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / gleng gzhi rgya chen po snyan pa rnams kyis bsgrags shing /
analyzed: dri dang me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa dang bkra shis pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / gleng gzhi rgya chen po snyan pa rnams kyis bsgrags shing /
translated: Make offerings of incense, flowers, and so on, and recite auspicious verses and the extensive nidāna.

original: kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rin po che bzhi'i bum pa dkyil 'khor chen po lan re bskor nas slob ma de'i spyi bo nas blugs so //
analyzed: kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i rin po che bzhi'i bum pa dkyil 'khor chen po lan re bskor nas slob ma de'i spyi bo nas blugs so //
translated: The bodhisattvas Samantabhadra and so forth bless the disciple with the vase of the four precious substances, pouring it on the disciple's head while circumambulating the great mandala once.

original: de'i 'og tu 'dir dngos kyis ma smos kyang //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'dir dngos kyis ma smos kyang //
translated: After that, although not mentioned here,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor dang / spyan dang / lce dang / go cha rnams kyi phyag rgya dang / sngags kyis kyang slob med ma de la padmo'i steng na 'dug pa nyid na rim pa bzhin du byin gyis brlab par bya'o//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gtsug tor dang / spyan dang / lce dang / go cha rnams kyi phyag rgya dang / sngags kyis kyang slob med ma de la padmo'i steng na 'dug pa nyid na rim pa bzhin du byin gyis brlab par bya'o//
translated: the mudras and mantras of the uṣṇīṣa, eye, tongue, and armor of the tathāgatas should also bless that disciple, who is seated on the lotus, in order.

original: de nas gnas de nas bslangs te /
analyzed: de nas gnas de nas bslangs te /
translated: Then, having been lifted from that place,

original: dkyil 'khor de'i nye 'khor du khri bzang po gcig gzhag ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de'i nye 'khor du khri bzang po gcig gzhag ste /
translated: a fine throne should be placed in the vicinity of that mandala.

original: gos gsher ba brjes nas gsar pa phrugs gcig gon nas khri steng du gzhag ste dri dang me tog la sogs pas mchod nas /
analyzed: gos gsher ba brjes nas gsar pa phrugs gcig gon nas khri steng du gzhag ste dri dang me tog la sogs pas mchod nas /
translated: Having changed into wet clothes, wearing a new set of clothes, seated on the throne, worship with fragrance, flowers, and so forth.

original: slob dpon nyid mig phye ba'i thur ma thogs nas mdun du 'dug ste /
analyzed: slob dpon nyid mig phye ba'i thur ma thogs nas mdun du 'dug ste /
translated: The master himself, holding a spoon for opening the eyes, sits in front.

original: @151a * // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bu khyod mi shes pa'i rab rib rnams bsal to zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig brjod do //
analyzed: @151a * // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis bu khyod mi shes pa'i rab rib rnams bsal to zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig brjod do //
translated: The Tathāgatas say, Son, the cataracts of your ignorance are removed. And so on.

original: de nas me long blangs la chos rnams gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de nas me long blangs la chos rnams gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ste /
translated: Then, taking the mirror, [the master] says, All phenomena are like reflections.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i stong pa nyid kyi tshul du sgoms shig ces pa'i tshig brjod do //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i stong pa nyid kyi tshul du sgoms shig ces pa'i tshig brjod do //
translated: Meditate on them as empty, devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: de nas de ltar bdag gi don yongs su rdzogs nas pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i phyir rkang pa'i 'og tu gser gyi 'khor lo bzhag ste /
analyzed: de nas de ltar bdag gi don yongs su rdzogs nas pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs par bya ba'i phyir rkang pa'i 'og tu gser gyi 'khor lo bzhag ste /
translated: Then, having thus perfected one's own aim, in order to perfect the aim of others, a golden wheel is placed under the feet.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor cig ces bsgrags so //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor cig ces bsgrags so //
translated: Proclaim, Turn the wheel of Dharma!

original: de nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba de yang sangs rgyas gsung mchog 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du khyab par grags pa bskor bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba de yang sangs rgyas gsung mchog 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du khyab par grags pa bskor bar bya ste /
translated: Then, that turning of the wheel of Dharma should be turned by the supreme speech of the Buddha, resounding in all world systems.

original: gsung mchog de'i phyag rgyar gyur pa dung bzang po cig lag pa g-yon par byin la /
analyzed: gsung mchog de'i phyag rgyar gyur pa dung bzang po cig lag pa g-yon par byin la /
translated: Give a good conch shell to the left hand as the seal of that supreme speech.🔽

original: chos kyi dung khyod kyis byin cig ces brjod do //
analyzed: chos kyi dung khyod kyis byin cig ces brjod do //
translated: Then, having given the conch shell, which is the seal of that supreme speech, into the left hand, one should say, You should blow the conch of Dharma!

original: de ltar sems can gyi don byas nas sangs rgyas rnams la byas pa shes pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig de'i 'og tu brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar sems can gyi don byas nas sangs rgyas rnams la byas pa shes pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshig de'i 'og tu brjod par bya ste /
translated: In that way, having benefited sentient beings, one should say the words, I am grateful to the Buddhas, and so forth.

original: de rnams ni las su bya ba'i rim pa bsdus te bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni las su bya ba'i rim pa bsdus te bshad pa'o //
translated: Those are the steps of the rite, summarized and explained.

original: yan lag gi don so sor bshad pa ni /🔽sems dpa' chen po mngon par dbang //
analyzed: yan lag gi don so sor bshad pa ni / sems dpa' chen po mngon par dbang //
translated: The explanation of the individual parts of the rite:🔽The great being should be consecrated

original: bskur ba rgyas pa ru ni bya //
analyzed: bskur ba rgyas pa ru ni bya //
translated: in an extensive way.

original: yang dag yid gcig gis la nyon //🔽zhes pa ni mngon par dbang bskur ba zhes pa ni tshig gi don gong du bshad zin to //🔽rgyas pa ru ni bshad par bya //
analyzed: yang dag yid gcig gis la nyon // zhes pa ni mngon par dbang bskur ba zhes pa ni tshig gi don gong du bshad zin to // rgyas pa ru ni bshad par bya //
translated: Listen with a one-pointed mind!🔽The consecration is explained in the above words.

original: zhes ba ni dbang bskur ba'i cho ga 'og nas 'byung ba rnams dang ldan par bshad do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes ba ni dbang bskur ba'i cho ga 'og nas 'byung ba rnams dang ldan par bshad do zhes pa'o //
translated: In an extensive way means that it is explained in accordance with the rites of consecration that will come below.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis bshad pa'i zhes pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa nyid pas bya ba gcig tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams kyis bshad pa'i zhes pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam pa nyid pas bya ba gcig tu bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase explained by the buddhas of the past indicates that all buddhas teach a single activity.

original: de nas gsang ba'i bdag po nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi mdun du phyi rol gyi khru ngo bor la dkyil 'khor bri ba ni /🔽gru bzhi pa la sgo gcig ste //
analyzed: de nas gsang ba'i bdag po nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi mdun du phyi rol gyi khru ngo bor la dkyil 'khor bri ba ni / gru bzhi pa la sgo gcig ste //
translated: Then, in front of the inner maṇḍala, the outer maṇḍala is drawn in a square with four sides of equal measure.

original: zhes pa'i don gzhan ni sngar bshad zin te /
analyzed: zhes pa'i don gzhan ni sngar bshad zin te /
translated: The meaning of the line with one door has already been explained.

original: 'dir dngos su ma smos kyang spyi'i mtshan nyid ltar byas na /
analyzed: 'dir dngos su ma smos kyang spyi'i mtshan nyid ltar byas na /
translated: Although not explicitly mentioned here, according to the general characteristics,

original: nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi sa shar phyogs su gzhol na dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor byang phyogs su bri bar bya /
analyzed: nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi sa shar phyogs su gzhol na dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor byang phyogs su bri bar bya /
translated: if the ground of the inner maṇḍala slopes to the east, the empowerment maṇḍala should be drawn to the north.

original: nang gi dkyil 'khor byang phyogs su gzhol na /
analyzed: nang gi dkyil 'khor byang phyogs su gzhol na /
translated: If the inner maṇḍala slopes to the north,

original: dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor nub phyogs su bri bar bya ste /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor nub phyogs su bri bar bya ste /
translated: the empowerment maṇḍala should be drawn to the west.

original: 'dir ni nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi mdun du dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor bri bar 'chad par gsungs pas /
analyzed: 'dir ni nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi mdun du dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor bri bar 'chad par gsungs pas /
translated: Here, it is explained that the empowerment maṇḍala is drawn in front of the inner maṇḍala.

original: dbang bskur @151b ba'i chus nang gi dkyil 'khor la chu mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang bskur @151b ba'i chus nang gi dkyil 'khor la chu mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to prevent the water of the consecration from flowing into the inner mandala,

original: nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi sa byang phyogs su gzhol bar bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi sa byang phyogs su gzhol bar bya'o //
translated: the ground of the inner mandala should slope to the north.

original: 'on te shar phyogs su gzhol na yang bar sa rgal gyis gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te shar phyogs su gzhol na yang bar sa rgal gyis gcad par bya'o //
translated: If it slopes to the east, it should be cut level with a hoe.🔽Four Vajradharas should be placed in the four corners.

original: grva bzhir rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhi gzhag par bya ste zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa de rnams dang / 'og nas byang chub sems dpa' bzhi dang / ci bgyi zhes pa bzhi 'byung ba rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan las gyur pa ste /
analyzed: grva bzhir rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhi gzhag par bya ste zhes pa ni rdo rje 'dzin pa de rnams dang / 'og nas byang chub sems dpa' bzhi dang / ci bgyi zhes pa bzhi 'byung ba rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan las gyur pa ste /
translated: The four Vajradharas, the four Bodhisattvas mentioned below, and the four “What is to be done?”s are all born from the qualities of the Tathagata.

original: 'phro ba med par spyod pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'phro ba med par spyod pa zhes pa'o //
translated: They are called “those who act without emission.”

original: nam mkha' dri med ces pa ni stong pa nyid kyi spyod yul nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ste shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i dri ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dri med ces pa ni stong pa nyid kyi spyod yul nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ste shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i dri ma spangs pa'o //
translated: “Stainless space” is the sphere of emptiness, which is like space, and is free from the stains of the knowable and the afflictions.

original: dri ma med pa'i mig dang zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i mig dang zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'am /
translated: “Stainless eyes” means free from the apprehended and the apprehender, or free from the two obscurations.

original: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i shes rab can zhes pa'o //
analyzed: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i shes rab can zhes pa'o //
translated: The one who is endowed with the wisdom that abandons the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictions.

original: sna tshogs gos 'chang ba zhes pa ni gos g-yogs par byed pa bas ngo tsha ba ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs gos 'chang ba zhes pa ni gos g-yogs par byed pa bas ngo tsha ba ste /
translated: The one who is clothed in various garments is ashamed of being naked.

original: gang ngo tsha ba yod pa mi bya ba rnams mi byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa rnams byed pa dang / dam pa rnams kyis bsngags pa ste de lta bu ni ngo tsha ba dang ldan pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang ngo tsha ba yod pa mi bya ba rnams mi byed pa dang / bya ba'i rigs pa rnams byed pa dang / dam pa rnams kyis bsngags pa ste de lta bu ni ngo tsha ba dang ldan pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The one who is endowed with shame is the one who does not do what should not be done, does what should be done, and is praised by the holy ones.

original: dbus padma chen po 'dab ma brgyad la /
analyzed: dbus padma chen po 'dab ma brgyad la /
translated: In the center, draw an eight-petaled great lotus with a stamen.

original: ge sar bcas par gyis la zhes pa ni ye shes brgyad kyi phyag rgyar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ge sar bcas par gyis la zhes pa ni ye shes brgyad kyi phyag rgyar gyur pa'o //
translated: The one who is the seal of the eight wisdoms is the one who has become the seal of the eight wisdoms.

original: ge sar ni yon tan rnams so //
analyzed: ge sar ni yon tan rnams so //
translated: The stamen is the qualities.🔽On the four petals, draw the four bodhisattvas who are friends endowed with the power of aspiration.

original: 'dab ma bzhi la byang chub sems dpa' grogs su gyur pa smon lam gyi mthu dang ldan pa bzhi bri ste zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de rnams de bzhin nyid kyi yon tan las gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'dab ma bzhi la byang chub sems dpa' grogs su gyur pa smon lam gyi mthu dang ldan pa bzhi bri ste zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de rnams de bzhin nyid kyi yon tan las gyur pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas who have arisen from the qualities of suchness are the bodhisattvas who have arisen from the qualities of suchness.

original: gnyis su ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa gnyis ni pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gnyis su ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa gnyis ni pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The second pair is the nature of the perfection of one's own aim:

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba de'i padmo'i gdan gyi gnas su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur ba de'i padmo'i gdan gyi gnas su gyur pa ste /
translated: the consecration of the king of the Dharma by the power of his vow, and the seat of the lotus throne.

original: de la gzungs dbang rgyal po zhes pa gzungs ni shes rab kyi rgyal por gyur pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la gzungs dbang rgyal po zhes pa gzungs ni shes rab kyi rgyal por gyur pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The king of the dhāraṇīs is the king of wisdom.

original: dran pa yang dag ces pa ni shes rab de nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin sems can rnams la rgyun mi 'chad do //
analyzed: dran pa yang dag ces pa ni shes rab de nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin sems can rnams la rgyun mi 'chad do //
translated: The perfect mindfulness is the uninterrupted stream of that wisdom in sentient beings, by its nature non-abiding nirvāṇa.

original: phan pa lhag par sems pa zhes pa ni sems can rnams la phan par sems pa'o //
analyzed: phan pa lhag par sems pa zhes pa ni sems can rnams la phan par sems pa'o //
translated: The one who thinks of benefit is the one who thinks of benefit for sentient beings.

original: snying rje can zhes pa ni snying rje'i dbang gis sems can rnams la phan par sems pa ste /🔽de gnyis ni pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: snying rje can zhes pa ni snying rje'i dbang gis sems can rnams la phan par sems pa ste / de gnyis ni pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The compassionate one is the one who thinks of benefit for sentient beings by the power of compassion.🔽These two are the nature of the perfection of others' aims.

original: gong ma gnyis ni rang gi don phun @152a * //
analyzed: gong ma gnyis ni rang gi don phun @152a * //
translated: The two above are the nature of the perfection of one's own aim:

original: sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sum tshogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the three perfections.

original: lo ma bzhi po gzhan la ni //
analyzed: lo ma bzhi po gzhan la ni //
translated: On the other four petals

original: ci bgyi zhes pa bzhi bri ste //
analyzed: ci bgyi zhes pa bzhi bri ste //
translated: one should write the four: “What is to be done?”

original: zhes pa yang de bzhin nyid kyi yon tan du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa yang de bzhin nyid kyi yon tan du shes par bya ste /
translated: One should know that these are the qualities of thusness.

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis gyur pa ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis gyur pa ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: The transformation by the power of vow is as above.

original: sems gzhan la spyod pa zhes pa ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i rang bzhin no ;🔽/'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya //
analyzed: sems gzhan la spyod pa zhes pa ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i rang bzhin no ; /'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya //
translated: “The mind is engaged in other” means the nature of the knowledge of the minds of others.

original: zhes pa ni sems can rnams kyi re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems can rnams kyi re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes pa'o //
translated: “One should fulfill all wishes” means one should fulfill the hopes of sentient beings.

original: ma chags pa dang rnam par grol ba zhes pa ni 'bras bu'i yon tan de stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin chags pa med pas na grol ba'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa dang rnam par grol ba zhes pa ni 'bras bu'i yon tan de stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin chags pa med pas na grol ba'o //
translated: “Nonattachment and liberation” means the quality of the result. Since it is the nature of emptiness, it is without attachment and therefore liberated.

original: gong ma gnyis ni rgyu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gong ma gnyis ni rgyu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The above two are the nature of the cause.

original: dbus su ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi gzugs so zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dbus su ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi gzugs so zhes pa ni /
translated: “In the center, the form of the inconceivable dharmadhatu” means

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge kha dog dkar po padmo'i snying po la gzhag go //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge kha dog dkar po padmo'i snying po la gzhag go //
translated: The syllable of the dharmadhatu is white in color and is placed in the heart of the lotus.

original: rin po che'i bum pa bzhi zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rin po che'i bum pa bzhi zhes pa ni /
translated: Four jeweled vases means

original: gser dang dngul dang / padma r'a ga dang / margatta'i bum pa gser dang dngul de dag gis brgyan pa'i bum pa bya'o //
analyzed: gser dang dngul dang / padma r'a ga dang / margatta'i bum pa gser dang dngul de dag gis brgyan pa'i bum pa bya'o //
translated: that the vases are made of gold, silver, ruby, and emerald.

original: de ltar yang ma 'byor na de rnams kyi kha dog dang mthun pa'i sa'i bum pa bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma 'byor na de rnams kyi kha dog dang mthun pa'i sa'i bum pa bya ste /
translated: If one cannot obtain these, then one should make vases of clay the color of those.

original: de dag la sogs pa'i yo byad rnams 'byor pa las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin du ma sbyar na 'jungs pa'i sems dang ldan te /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa'i yo byad rnams 'byor pa las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin du ma sbyar na 'jungs pa'i sems dang ldan te /
translated: If one does not gather the articles as they are described, one will have a stingy mind.

original: sems ma dag pas lha rnams kyang byin gyis mi rlob ces gzhung las 'byung ngo ;
analyzed: sems ma dag pas lha rnams kyang byin gyis mi rlob ces gzhung las 'byung ngo ;
translated: Since the mind is impure, the gods will not grant their blessings.

original: / snying nas med pa mi 'byor du mi rung na snyam nas mi spobs te /
analyzed: / snying nas med pa mi 'byor du mi rung na snyam nas mi spobs te /
translated: If one thinks, “I do not have the heart to be without the articles that are necessary,” one will not be confident.

original: mi byed dam 'tsho ba'i yo byad dang / nad gsos kyi sman zong yang mi 'jog par byed na /
analyzed: mi byed dam 'tsho ba'i yo byad dang / nad gsos kyi sman zong yang mi 'jog par byed na /
translated: If one does not prepare the articles for livelihood and the medicine for curing illness,

original: yang dgongs pa'am cho ga mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: yang dgongs pa'am cho ga mi shes pa ste /
translated: Moreover, if one does not know the ritual or the rite,

original: 'tsho ba'i yo byad dang nad rkyen gyi sman zong du snyad btags nas lhag par yod la gtong mi phod na gong du smos pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i yo byad dang nad rkyen gyi sman zong du snyad btags nas lhag par yod la gtong mi phod na gong du smos pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: and if one is not willing to give away what is in excess, pretending that it is a necessary article for livelihood or a medicine for illness, then it is as stated above.

original: mdor na sems la sgyu med pa gtsang sbrar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor na sems la sgyu med pa gtsang sbrar shes par bya'o //
translated: In brief, one should understand that purity is the absence of deceit in the mind.

original: kun du bzang po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yang /
analyzed: kun du bzang po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yang /
translated: Moreover, the consecration by the bodhisattvas Samantabhadra and so forth

original: slob ma de ngan song spong bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob ma de ngan song spong bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is taught in order to show that the disciple will abandon the evil destinies.

original: thog ma nyid du ngan song thams cad sbyang ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pas blugs so //
analyzed: thog ma nyid du ngan song thams cad sbyang ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pas blugs so //
translated: First, he is sprinkled with the vase water consecrated by the mantra of the bodhisattva Sarva-shuddha-dhāva-pra-bhava-śrī-vajra, in order to purify all evil destinies.

original: ngan song spangs nas shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral bar gyur cig pa'i don du /
analyzed: ngan song spangs nas shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral bar gyur cig pa'i don du /
translated: Then, in order to become free from the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictions,

original: de nas sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'i sngags kyis btab pas blugs so //
analyzed: de nas sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'i sngags kyis btab pas blugs so //
translated: he is sprinkled with the water consecrated by the mantra of the bodhisattva Sarva-apāyajaha-jñānālok-candana-dhvaja-rāja.

original: de nas kun du bzang po'i sa thob par gyur cig @152b pa'i don du kun du bzang po'i sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pas blugs so //
analyzed: de nas kun du bzang po'i sa thob par gyur cig @152b pa'i don du kun du bzang po'i sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pas blugs so //
translated: Then, for the sake of attaining the stage of Samantabhadra, one should pour water from the vase empowered by the mantra of Samantabhadra.

original: de nas chos kyi rgyal tshab tu gyur cig pa'i don du byams pa'i sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pas blugs par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas chos kyi rgyal tshab tu gyur cig pa'i don du byams pa'i sngags kyis btab pa'i bum pas blugs par bya'o //
translated: Then, for the sake of becoming the regent of the Dharma, one should pour water from the vase empowered by the mantra of Maitreya.

original: sngags pas padma dam pa de la ni rang gis bzhag nas su zhes pa nas /
analyzed: sngags pas padma dam pa de la ni rang gis bzhag nas su zhes pa nas /
translated: The mantra practitioner, having placed that excellent lotus, and so on,

original: de nas yang de mchod pa ni ;
analyzed: de nas yang de mchod pa ni ;
translated: Then, one should make offerings to that,

original: / me tog spos la sogs pas so //
analyzed: / me tog spos la sogs pas so //
translated: with flowers, incense, and so forth.

original: zhes pa'i bar du don gzhan ni gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du don gzhan ni gong du bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the rest is as explained above.

original: slob ma des dbang bskur bar bya ba'i tshe 'dir dngos su ma gsungs kyang /
analyzed: slob ma des dbang bskur bar bya ba'i tshe 'dir dngos su ma gsungs kyang /
translated: When that disciple is to be initiated, although it is not actually stated here,

original: dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i tshe na /
translated: at the time of entering the mandala,

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i skur bsgyur te /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i skur bsgyur te /
translated: one should transform into the body of Vajrasattva,

original: de las gzhan pa'i skur bsgyur bar ma gsungs pas rdo rje sems dpa'i skur bsgyur te dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i skur bsgyur bar ma gsungs pas rdo rje sems dpa'i skur bsgyur te dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: and since it is not stated that one should transform into any other body, one should be initiated while transformed into the body of Vajrasattva.

original: dbang bskur ba'i tshe padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa yang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'dug thabs su bzhag ste /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i tshe padma'i gdan la bzhugs pa yang 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i 'dug thabs su bzhag ste /
translated: When conferring empowerment, the one seated on the lotus seat is also placed in the posture of a universal monarch.

original: rkang pa g-yon pa khri'i steng du gzhag la g-yas pa sa la bzhag ste /
analyzed: rkang pa g-yon pa khri'i steng du gzhag la g-yas pa sa la bzhag ste /
translated: The left foot is placed on the throne, and the right foot on the ground.

original: lag pa g-yon pa khri la bsten la ;🔽g-yas pa pus mo la bzhag / gdong yang mi mtho mi dma' bar drang por blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa khri la bsten la ; g-yas pa pus mo la bzhag / gdong yang mi mtho mi dma' bar drang por blta bar bya'o //
translated: The left hand rests on the throne,

original: thur ma blang ba gser gyi ste //🔽zhes pa nas /
analyzed: thur ma blang ba gser gyi ste // zhes pa nas /
translated: and the right hand rests on the knee. The face should also be looked at straight, neither too high nor too low.🔽The golden spoon

original: thur ma'i sman pa rgyal po yis //
analyzed: thur ma'i sman pa rgyal po yis //
translated: is the king of physicians.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten rnams la sngon gyi'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten rnams la sngon gyi'o //
translated: Just as in the world before,

original: zhes pa'i bar du rim pa bzhin du gong du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du rim pa bzhin du gong du bshad pa'o //
translated: the above is explained in order, from the golden spoon up to🔽the king of physicians.

original: ma rig pas bsgribs pas /
analyzed: ma rig pas bsgribs pas /
translated: Since one is obscured by ignorance,🔽the Victor, your father, has removed that for you.

original: bu khyod kyi rgyal bas khyod kyi de bsal ba ni zhes pa sngon mnyam pa dang / bsam pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu la sogs pa mi shes pa /
analyzed: bu khyod kyi rgyal bas khyod kyi de bsal ba ni zhes pa sngon mnyam pa dang / bsam pa'i shes rab kyi rgyu la sogs pa mi shes pa /
translated: Previously, the cause of wisdom of intention and so on was not understood.

original: rgyal ba'i lung slob dpon gyis bshad pa mi shes pa bsal to zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i lung slob dpon gyis bshad pa mi shes pa bsal to zhes pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the scriptures of the Victor by the master was not understood.

original: thur ma'i sman pa rgyal po yis //
analyzed: thur ma'i sman pa rgyal po yis //
translated: The king of eye doctors

original: ji ltar 'jig rten rnams la sngon gyi'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten rnams la sngon gyi'o //
translated: removes the world’s cataracts.

original: zhes pa ni dpe ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dpe ste /
translated: This is the example.

original: ji ltar mig gi sman pa'i rgyal pos 'jig rten pa rnams kyi mig gi rab rib bsal te /
analyzed: ji ltar mig gi sman pa'i rgyal pos 'jig rten pa rnams kyi mig gi rab rib bsal te /
translated: Just as the king of eye doctors removes the world’s cataracts,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'dug pa mi mthong ba las mthong bar byas pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang gi dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'dug pa mi mthong ba las mthong bar byas pa bzhin du /
translated: and then they see forms and so forth just as they are,

original: rgyal ba rnams kyis kyang bu khyod kyi ma rig pas chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin 'dug pa mi shes pa las shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyis kyang bu khyod kyi ma rig pas chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji lta ba bzhin 'dug pa mi shes pa las shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: in the same way, the victors say to you, “You do not know the characteristics of phenomena just as they are because of ignorance.🔽Now you will know them.”

original: me long la 'di ltar yang chos kyi mtshan nyid de smros shig / chos rnams gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ste zhes pa ni /
analyzed: me long la 'di ltar yang chos kyi mtshan nyid de smros shig / chos rnams gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ste zhes pa ni /
translated: “Phenomena are like reflections,”

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams gzugs @153a * //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams gzugs @153a * //
translated: means that phenomena such as the aggregates, constituents, and sense spheres are like reflections.

original: brnyan dang 'dra ste bltar yang snang la /
analyzed: brnyan dang 'dra ste bltar yang snang la /
translated: They appear to the sight,🔽but they are not real.

original: yang dag par ni brtags na dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par ni brtags na dngos po yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: When examined properly, things do not exist.

original: phra zhes pa ni 'di ltar phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams phung po'i rang bzhin du dmigs su med pas phra ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phra zhes pa ni 'di ltar phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams phung po'i rang bzhin du dmigs su med pas phra ba zhes pa'o //
translated: “ Subtle” means that the phenomena of the aggregates and so forth are subtle because they cannot be observed as the nature of the aggregates.

original: dge ba zhes pa ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba zhes pa ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba zhes pa'o //
translated: “ Virtuous” means being free from the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictions.

original: rtog pa med pa zhes pa ni sgrib pa dang de dag gi bag chags kyang med ces pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa zhes pa ni sgrib pa dang de dag gi bag chags kyang med ces pa'o //
translated: “ Nonconceptual” means that the obscurations and their habitual tendencies are also absent.

original: mi gzung ba brjod du med pa zhes pa de lta bu'i stong pa'i rang bzhin la rnam par shes pa drug gis gzung du med cing /
analyzed: mi gzung ba brjod du med pa zhes pa de lta bu'i stong pa'i rang bzhin la rnam par shes pa drug gis gzung du med cing /
translated: “ Ungraspable” and “inexpressible” means that the nature of such emptiness cannot be grasped by the six consciousnesses,

original: tshig gis brjod du med pa de las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gis brjod du med pa de las 'das pa'o //
translated: and that it is beyond words and expressions.

original: rgyu dang las las byung ba'o zhes pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams ye nas yod pa'i rang bzhin ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu dang las las byung ba'o zhes pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams ye nas yod pa'i rang bzhin ma yin gyi /
translated: “ Arising from causes and actions” means that the phenomena of the aggregates and so forth are not primordially existent natures,

original: rgyu dang las las byung bas na gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang las las byung bas na gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ste /
translated: but arise from causes and actions, and are therefore like reflections.

original: yod pa ma yin pas brjod du med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gong ma de rnams dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pas brjod du med pa la sogs pa'i tshig gong ma de rnams dang sbyar ro //
translated: Since it does not exist, it is applied to the above words such as “inexpressible.”

original: de bzhin chos 'di shes par gyis //
analyzed: de bzhin chos 'di shes par gyis //
translated: Thus, you should understand this Dharma.

original: rang bzhin med cing gnas med pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin med cing gnas med pa //
translated: It has no intrinsic nature and no location.

original: zhes pa ni gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bas rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzugs brnyan dang 'dra bas rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: Since it is like a reflection, it has no intrinsic nature.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung bas skad cig ma'i cha mi gnas par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung bas skad cig ma'i cha mi gnas par shes pa ste /
translated: Since it arises from causes and conditions, it is momentary and does not remain.

original: de rnams chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji ltar shes nas de lta bu'i tshul du bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis sgoms shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ji ltar shes nas de lta bu'i tshul du bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis sgoms shig ces pa'o //
translated: Having understood the characteristics of phenomena in that way, you should meditate on them with the wisdom that meditates in that manner.

original: tshad med sems can don byos shig / ces pa nas bla na med pa chos kyi dung sgra bsgrag go zhes pa'i bar du ste de ltar bdag gi don phun sum tshogs nas /
analyzed: tshad med sems can don byos shig / ces pa nas bla na med pa chos kyi dung sgra bsgrag go zhes pa'i bar du ste de ltar bdag gi don phun sum tshogs nas /
translated: You should benefit limitless sentient beings, up to you should blow the unsurpassable conch of the Dharma.

original: pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs par byos shig ces pa ste gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs par byos shig ces pa ste gong du bshad zin to //
translated: Having perfected your own aim in that way, you should perfect the aims of others.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi bur skyes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi bur skyes so //
translated: You have been born as the son of the buddhas.

original: zhes pa ni khyod de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes las skyes so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni khyod de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes las skyes so zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that you are born from the gnosis of the Tathagata.

original: the tshom blo ngan dogs pa med pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: the tshom blo ngan dogs pa med pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: With a mind free from doubts, bad thoughts, and fears.

original: zhes pa ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zhing sems can gyi don bya ba de ltar yin nam ma yin snyam pa'i the tshom med pa dang / mi bya'o snyam pa'i blo ngan pa mi skye ba dang 'khor rnams la bag tsha ba med par 'jig rten pa rnams la sngags spyad pa'i tshul gyis chos rab tu sgrogs shig ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zhing sems can gyi don bya ba de ltar yin nam ma yin snyam pa'i the tshom med pa dang / mi bya'o snyam pa'i blo ngan pa mi skye ba dang 'khor rnams la bag tsha ba med par 'jig rten pa rnams la sngags spyad pa'i tshul gyis chos rab tu sgrogs shig ces pa'o //
translated: This means that you should turn the wheel of the Dharma and work for the welfare of sentient beings without doubts such as whether it is so or not, and without generating bad thoughts such as that you should not do it, and without being nervous about the retinue, you should proclaim the Dharma to the worldly ones by means of the practice of mantra.

original: de ltar byas pa shes pa /
analyzed: de ltar byas pa shes pa /
translated: Knowing that it is done in this way,

original: sangs rgyas de nas phan 'dogs pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas de nas phan 'dogs pa //
translated: the Buddhas will then benefit you.

original: zhes brjod pa ni de ltar sems can gyi don byas na /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa ni de ltar sems can gyi don byas na /
translated: This statement means that if you work for the welfare of sentient beings in this way,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi bya ba byas pas dran zhing sangs rgyas la lan ldon par bshad pa zhes @153b pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi bya ba byas pas dran zhing sangs rgyas la lan ldon par bshad pa zhes @153b pa'o //
translated: since you have done the work of the Buddhas, you should remember them and repay the Buddha's kindness.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa de kun kyang //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa de kun kyang //
translated: All of those Vajra-holders

original: khyod la rtag tu srung bar byed //
analyzed: khyod la rtag tu srung bar byed //
translated: will always protect you.

original: ces pa ni dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi grva bzhir rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhi gzhag pa dang / padma'i 'dab ma la bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang las byas pa'i don yod do snyam nas srung bar byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni dbang bskur ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi grva bzhir rdo rje 'dzin pa bzhi gzhag pa dang / padma'i 'dab ma la bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyang las byas pa'i don yod do snyam nas srung bar byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: This means that the four Vajradharas are placed in the four corners of the mandala of consecration, and those Bodhisattvas who are seated on the lotus petals think that they are protecting the meaning of the rite that is being performed.

original: de nas slob ma de bslangs la /
analyzed: de nas slob ma de bslangs la /
translated: Then, having raised up the disciple,

original: snying rjer song ba'i yid kyis su //
analyzed: snying rjer song ba'i yid kyis su //
translated: with a mind gone to compassion,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: de nas su ni khas blang ba //
analyzed: de nas su ni khas blang ba //
translated: then, who is accepted?

original: nang gi bdag nyid nges pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid nges pa'o //
translated: The inner nature is ascertained.

original: zhes pa'i bar du slob ma la dam tshig bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du slob ma la dam tshig bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching of the commitments to the disciple.

original: de yang sngon dam tshig mnos pa dang ma mnos pa gnyis ka la bstan te /
analyzed: de yang sngon dam tshig mnos pa dang ma mnos pa gnyis ka la bstan te /
translated: Moreover, it is taught to both those who have previously taken the commitments and those who have not.

original: de la slob ma dam tshig bzhi dang lnga dag tu ldan la /
analyzed: de la slob ma dam tshig bzhi dang lnga dag tu ldan la /
translated: There, the disciple is endowed with the four and five commitments.

original: las dang bya ba dag la sbyar ba rgyud la sogs pa dang / dam tshig shes shing mnos zin pa la bstan ci dgos she na /
analyzed: las dang bya ba dag la sbyar ba rgyud la sogs pa dang / dam tshig shes shing mnos zin pa la bstan ci dgos she na /
translated: What is the use of teaching the commitments to one who knows the tantras and so forth, and who has taken the commitments, in regard to the rites and actions?

original: 'jig rten na rgyal po rnams kyang rgyal chos su bya ba rnams snga na yang shes shing srung mod kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten na rgyal po rnams kyang rgyal chos su bya ba rnams snga na yang shes shing srung mod kyi /
translated: In the world, even though kings know and protect the royal duties from before,

original: nam rgyal por dbang bskur ba'i tshe yang slob dpon la sogs pas bstan cing gos par byed do //
analyzed: nam rgyal por dbang bskur ba'i tshe yang slob dpon la sogs pas bstan cing gos par byed do //
translated: when they are consecrated as kings, they are taught and reminded by the master and so forth.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang snga nas yang dam tshig 'di rnams srung mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang snga nas yang dam tshig 'di rnams srung mod kyi /
translated: In the same way, here also, even though one has previously protected these commitments,

original: chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur na chos kyis bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur na chos kyis bstan par bya'o //
translated: when one is consecrated as a Dharma king, one should be taught by the Dharma.

original: gsum du na yang dang yang du bstan na brtan par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum du na yang dang yang du bstan na brtan par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, if one is taught again and again, one will be firm.

original: de nas slob ma de bslang la //
analyzed: de nas slob ma de bslang la //
translated: Then, the disciple should be raised up,

original: snying rjer song ba'i yid kyis ni //
analyzed: snying rjer song ba'i yid kyis ni //
translated: and with a mind full of compassion,

original: sngags pas nang du bcug nas su //
analyzed: sngags pas nang du bcug nas su //
translated: the mantrin should cause him to enter inside

original: de la dam tshig bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dam tshig bstan par bya'o //
translated: and teach him the commitments.

original: zhes pa ni me long dang 'khor lo la sogs pa bstan pa'i gnas de nas slob ma de bslang ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni me long dang 'khor lo la sogs pa bstan pa'i gnas de nas slob ma de bslang ste /
translated: This means that the disciple should be raised up from the place where the mirror, wheel, and so forth are displayed.

original: slob dpon gyis slob ma'i gdugs bzung nas /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis slob ma'i gdugs bzung nas /
translated: The master should hold the disciple's parasol.

original: dkyil 'khor dang po'i sgo khyud kyi nang du khrid la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang po'i sgo khyud kyi nang du khrid la /
translated: Lead him inside the enclosure of the first mandala.

original: sgo khyud kyi nang der gzhag ste 'og nas 'byung ba'i dam tshig rnams bstan par bya zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sgo khyud kyi nang der gzhag ste 'og nas 'byung ba'i dam tshig rnams bstan par bya zhes pa'o //
translated: Place him inside the enclosure and teach him the commitments that will be explained below.

original: bu khyod deng phan chad /
analyzed: bu khyod deng phan chad /
translated: Son, from now on,

original: srog gi yang ni phyi ru yang //
analyzed: srog gi yang ni phyi ru yang //
translated: even at the cost of your life,

original: dam pa'i chos ni yongs btang ba //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ni yongs btang ba //
translated: do not abandon the holy Dharma.

original: zhes pa ni dam pa'i chos de btang ba la yang rnam pa gsum ste ;
analyzed: zhes pa ni dam pa'i chos de btang ba la yang rnam pa gsum ste ;
translated: Abandoning the holy Dharma is of three types:

original: theg pa chen por bltas pa las log par bltas pa dang / chos smra ba la bltas par dbang bza' zhing skur pa 'debs pa de nyin re zhing dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / sgom pa dang / 'dri ba dang /
analyzed: theg pa chen por bltas pa las log par bltas pa dang / chos smra ba la bltas par dbang bza' zhing skur pa 'debs pa de nyin re zhing dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / sgom pa dang / 'dri ba dang /
translated: (1) abandoning it by looking at the Mahayana and turning away from it, (2) abandoning it by eating the offerings and disparaging the Dharma teacher, and (3) abandoning it by not doing any of the following every day: listening to the holy Dharma, reflecting on it, meditating on it, asking questions about it,

original: klog pa dang mchod pa la sogs pa byas pa las gang yang rung ba cig ma @154a * //
analyzed: klog pa dang mchod pa la sogs pa byas pa las gang yang rung ba cig ma @154a * //
translated: reading it, making offerings to it, and so forth.

original: byas na dam pa'i chos btang ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: byas na dam pa'i chos btang ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Abandoning any of these is called “abandoning the holy Dharma.”

original: de rnams khyod kyis srog gi phyir yang mi gtang ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams khyod kyis srog gi phyir yang mi gtang ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: You should not abandon any of them even at the cost of your life.

original: de nas gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa ni mi gtang zhes par sbyar te /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa ni mi gtang zhes par sbyar te /
translated: Furthermore, the bodhisattva should not abandon the four kinds of bodhicitta.

original: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa bzhi las smon lam gyi sems dang 'jug pa'i sems dag mi gtang ba la bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems rnam pa bzhi las smon lam gyi sems dang 'jug pa'i sems dag mi gtang ba la bya ste /
translated: The two kinds of bodhicitta that should not be abandoned are the aspirational and engaged bodhicittas.

original: sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir bdag sangs rgyas su gyur cig ces pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bsgom pa rtag tu bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir bdag sangs rgyas su gyur cig ces pa dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bsgom pa rtag tu bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: The aspirational bodhicitta is the thought “May I become a buddha for the benefit of all sentient beings,” and the engaged bodhicitta is the thought “I will always meditate on the emptiness of all phenomena.”

original: ser sna khyod kyis yongs mi bya //
analyzed: ser sna khyod kyis yongs mi bya //
translated: You should not be stingy.

original: zhes pa ni chos dang nor bdag la yod pa las gzhan la sbyin par rigs pa las mi sbyin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos dang nor bdag la yod pa las gzhan la sbyin par rigs pa las mi sbyin par mi bya'o //
translated: This means that it is right to give to others what you have in terms of Dharma and wealth, and you should not be stingy.

original: sems can la yang gang gnod pa //
analyzed: sems can la yang gang gnod pa //
translated: Do not harm sentient beings.

original: zhes pa ni mi bya zhes pa dang 'brel te lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas sems can rnams la 'phral gyi gnod pa dang yun gyi gnod pa mi bya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mi bya zhes pa dang 'brel te lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas sems can rnams la 'phral gyi gnod pa dang yun gyi gnod pa mi bya zhes bya'o //
translated: This is connected to the phrase “you should not.” It means that you should not harm sentient beings in any way, through body, speech, or mind, either immediately or in the long run.

original: bla ma slob mas phyag bya ba //
analyzed: bla ma slob mas phyag bya ba //
translated: The guru should be worshipped by the disciple.

original: gus par nan tan rkang pa la'o //
analyzed: gus par nan tan rkang pa la'o //
translated: The pledge of the body is to bow to the guru with faith and respect, with the feet.

original: de nas thams cad khas blang ba //
analyzed: de nas thams cad khas blang ba //
translated: Then, all are accepted,

original: nang gi bdag nyid nges pas so //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid nges pas so //
translated: by the ascertainment of the inner nature.

original: zhes pa ni gong du slob dpon gyis dam tshig sgom pa de rnams lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas 'gyur ba med par khas blang ngo zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong du slob dpon gyis dam tshig sgom pa de rnams lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas 'gyur ba med par khas blang ngo zhes pa ste /
translated: This means that the master's pledges of meditation are to be accepted by the disciple with the body, speech, and mind, without wavering.

original: lus kyis bla ma la slob mas phyag bya ba dad cing gus pas rkang pa la'o zhes pa'o //🔽ngag gis zhes pa nas thams cad khas blang pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyis bla ma la slob mas phyag bya ba dad cing gus pas rkang pa la'o zhes pa'o // ngag gis zhes pa nas thams cad khas blang pa zhes pa ste /
translated: The pledge of the body is to bow to the guru with the body, with the feet, with faith and respect.

original: bka' stsal pa bzhin du bgyi'o zhes smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa bzhin du bgyi'o zhes smra bar bya'o //
translated: The pledge of speech is to say, I will do all that the master commands, and so forth.

original: sems kyis ni nang gi bdag nyid nges pas so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyis ni nang gi bdag nyid nges pas so zhes pa ste /
translated: The pledge of the mind is to accept all the pledges by the ascertainment of the inner nature.

original: slob dpon gyi ngo tsam du khas blang ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: slob dpon gyi ngo tsam du khas blang ba ma yin gyi /
translated: This means that the pledges are not accepted merely in the presence of the master.

original: sems thag ma nas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems thag ma nas zhes pa'o //
translated: The mind is to be from the depths, it is said.

original: de yan chad du snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga rnams rdzogs so /
analyzed: de yan chad du snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga rnams rdzogs so /
translated: Up to this point, the mandala ritual for the origin of great compassion is complete.

original: // / da ni snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor der zhugs pa rnams kyis rjes su bsngags pa bshad de /
analyzed: // / da ni snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor der zhugs pa rnams kyis rjes su bsngags pa bshad de /
translated: Now, the praise of those who have entered that maṇḍala of the arising of great compassion is explained.

original: de yang de nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rje gsang ba'i bdag pos 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu pho dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag rnams ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhin du blta'o zhes pa'i bar du ste /🔽bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i dam tshig la zhugs nas de'i bsod nams ji snyed @154b cig mngon par 'dus par rig par bgyi zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor du zhugs shing dam tshig mnos
analyzed: de yang de nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rje gsang ba'i bdag pos 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu pho dang / rigs kyi bu mo de dag rnams ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhin du blta'o zhes pa'i bar du ste / bcom ldan 'das rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po'i dam tshig la zhugs nas de'i bsod nams ji snyed @154b cig mngon par 'dus par rig par bgyi zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor du zhugs shing dam tshig mnos
translated: Then, Vajrapāṇi, the Lord of Secrets, said this to the Blessed One: “Blessed One, those sons of good family and daughters of good family should be seen like the Blessed Buddhas.”

original: pa tsam 'ba' zhig la mi bya'o //
analyzed: pa tsam 'ba' zhig la mi bya'o //
translated: “Blessed One, how much merit should be known to have been accumulated by those sons of good family or daughters of good family who have entered the commitment of the great maṇḍala of the arising of great compassion?” This should not be done merely by entering the maṇḍala and receiving the commitments.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la sogs pa mnyam pa nyid mi zad pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan de dag gi byin gyis brlabs su gyur pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la sogs pa mnyam pa nyid mi zad pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan de dag gi byin gyis brlabs su gyur pa /
translated: Those blessings of the Tathagata's body, etc., are the inexhaustible vajra ornaments of the equality of the Tathagatas.

original: snying rje chen po'i dkyil 'khor dang ; yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi mtshan mar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i dkyil 'khor dang ; yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor dang / gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi mtshan mar gyur pa ste /
translated: The mandala of great compassion, the mandala of the wheel of letters, and the secret mandala are the signs of the body, speech, and mind of the Tathagatas.

original: de dag nyid dam tshig gsum zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid dam tshig gsum zhes pa'o //
translated: Those are the three commitments.

original: dam tshig de zhugs pa zhes pa ni de'i rgyu'i rang bzhin 'bras bu la sbyor bar shes pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dam tshig de zhugs pa zhes pa ni de'i rgyu'i rang bzhin 'bras bu la sbyor bar shes pa zhes pa ste /
translated: The entrance into the commitments is the knowledge of the nature of the cause as applied to the result.

original: de dag shes pa yang rgyu shes pa ni sku mi zad pa la sogs pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan gyi rgyu byang chub kyi snying po yin par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag shes pa yang rgyu shes pa ni sku mi zad pa la sogs pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan gyi rgyu byang chub kyi snying po yin par shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the cause is the knowledge that the cause of the inexhaustible body, etc., the vajra ornaments, is the essence of enlightenment.

original: rang bzhin gyi sku mi zad pa la sogs pa nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi sku mi zad pa la sogs pa nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the nature is the knowledge that the inexhaustible body, etc., are the very nature.

original: 'bras bu la sbyor ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'bras bu la sbyor ba ni bla na med pa'i byang chub tu 'gyur ram /
translated: The application to the result is the knowledge that I will become unsurpassed enlightenment or I am unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: ji ltar bsams pa 'grub pa la sogs pa 'thob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar bsams pa 'grub pa la sogs pa 'thob pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to attain the accomplishment of what is thought, etc.

original: sngags kyi spyod pa rnams shes nas //
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa rnams shes nas //
translated: Having understood the practices of the mantra,🔽one should practice them.

original: de la sbyor ba ste de lta bur zhugs na bsod nams ji tsam mngon par 'dus byas pa zhes zhus pa'o //🔽ji snyed sems thog ma bskyed pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'i bsod nams mngon par 'dus byas pa de snyed du rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams mngon par 'dus byas par rig par bya'o zhes pa ni sa dang po'i sems bskyed pa
analyzed: de la sbyor ba ste de lta bur zhugs na bsod nams ji tsam mngon par 'dus byas pa zhes zhus pa'o // ji snyed sems thog ma bskyed pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'i bsod nams mngon par 'dus byas pa de snyed du rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo de'i bsod nams mngon par 'dus byas par rig par bya'o zhes pa ni sa dang po'i sems bskyed pa
translated: How much merit is produced by engaging in them in that way?🔽One should understand that the merit produced by the son or daughter of good lineage is equal to the merit produced from the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the appearance of the Tathagata.

original: nas sa bcu gcig tu 'gyur ba'i bsod nams mngon par 'dus byas pa dang mnyam mo zhes pa ste /
analyzed: nas sa bcu gcig tu 'gyur ba'i bsod nams mngon par 'dus byas pa dang mnyam mo zhes pa ste /
translated: This means that the merit produced is equal to that produced from the first production of the thought of enlightenment up to the eleventh stage.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dam tshig de lta bu la zhugs pa ni mos pa spyod pa nas zhugs na mtha' de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam tshig de lta bu la zhugs pa ni mos pa spyod pa nas zhugs na mtha' de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who has entered such a commitment, having entered from the stage of action in faith, will become a Tathagata.

original: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ji ltar zhal dang lhums nas skyes pa'i sras po zhes pa zhal nas skyes pa ni /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag ji ltar zhal dang lhums nas skyes pa'i sras po zhes pa zhal nas skyes pa ni /
translated: Those sons and daughters of good lineage are called “sons born from the face and womb” because they are born from the face and womb.

original: 'jug pa'i sgo nas skyes pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgo nas skyes pa zhes pa ste /
translated: “Born from the face” means born from the door.

original: de bzhin gshegs par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs par 'jug pa'o //
translated: They enter into the tathagatas.

original: sgo ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa ste de dag mos pa spyod pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgo ni mos pa spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa ste de dag mos pa spyod pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The door is the stage of action in faith and so on, because they enter into the stage of action in faith.

original: lhums su skyes pa'i sras po zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa dang mthun par spyod pa'i phyir ro //🔽rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag phyogs gang na 'khod pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pas chen po bya mi dgos so zhes pa ni de @155a * //
analyzed: lhums su skyes pa'i sras po zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa dang mthun par spyod pa'i phyir ro // rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo de dag phyogs gang na 'khod pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pas chen po bya mi dgos so zhes pa ni de @155a * //
translated: “Sons born from the womb” means they practice in accordance with the tathagatas’ practice.🔽The tathagatas do not need to perform great deeds in the direction in which those sons and daughters of good lineage dwell.

original: dag gang na 'khod pa na sems can gyi don spyad pa ste sa phyogs der de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gyi don spyad pa chen po mi dgos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dag gang na 'khod pa na sems can gyi don spyad pa ste sa phyogs der de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gyi don spyad pa chen po mi dgos zhes pa'o //
translated: Wherever they dwell, they practice for the welfare of sentient beings. The tathagatas do not need to perform great deeds for the welfare of sentient beings in that direction.

original: mgrin gcig tu zhes pa ni dus gcig tu smras pa dang / smra ba'i tshig gcig pa dang / smra bar bya ba'i don gcig pa dang / sgra gcig tu 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: mgrin gcig tu zhes pa ni dus gcig tu smras pa dang / smra ba'i tshig gcig pa dang / smra bar bya ba'i don gcig pa dang / sgra gcig tu 'byin pa'o //
translated: The phrase in a single voice means that they spoke at the same time, with a single word of speech, with a single meaning to be spoken, and with a single sound.

original: da ni dkyil 'khor la sogs pa srung ba la sogs pa rnams 'chad de /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor la sogs pa srung ba la sogs pa rnams 'chad de /
translated: Now, the protection of the maṇḍala and so forth is explained.

original: sngags de rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi 'khor los khams gsum du khyab pa'i byin gyis brlabs su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: sngags de rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi 'khor los khams gsum du khyab pa'i byin gyis brlabs su gyur pa ste /
translated: Those mantras are also the blessing of the wheel of speech of the tathāgatas pervading the three realms.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis 'khor de dag thams cad la gzigs nas zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis 'khor de dag thams cad la gzigs nas zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, the bhagavān Vairocana, having looked at the entire retinue, up to

original: dus gsum du ma chags pa'i stobs kyi sngags kyi tshig ces bya ba yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: dus gsum du ma chags pa'i stobs kyi sngags kyi tshig ces bya ba yod do zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: the mantra words of the power of nonattachment in the three times exist.

original: khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pa'i sngags yod kyis bshad do zhes pa'i tshig kho nas dbyung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pa'i sngags yod kyis bshad do zhes pa'i tshig kho nas dbyung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the mantra with such a special quality exists, by the words alone, I will explain.

original: mtha' yas par 'phro zhing lus rgya chen po zhes pa ni sems can gyi khams thams cad du khyab par 'jug pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas par 'phro zhing lus rgya chen po zhes pa ni sems can gyi khams thams cad du khyab par 'jug pa zhes pa'o //
translated: “It radiates infinitely and is a great body” means that it pervades the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: sna tshogs kyi gzugs kyi nor bu dang 'dra zhes pa ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu de gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs su yang snang la sems can ci 'dod pa thob par bya ba sna tshogs byed de /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi gzugs kyi nor bu dang 'dra zhes pa ni yid bzhin gyi nor bu de gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs su yang snang la sems can ci 'dod pa thob par bya ba sna tshogs byed de /
translated: “It is like a jewel of various forms” means that wish-fulfilling jewel appears in various forms and performs various functions to obtain whatever sentient beings desire.

original: de bzhin du rig pa'i rgyal mo 'di yang sems can rnams kyi don du gzugs sna tshogs ston cing bya ba sna tshogs byed pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rig pa'i rgyal mo 'di yang sems can rnams kyi don du gzugs sna tshogs ston cing bya ba sna tshogs byed pa zhes pa'o //
translated: In the same way, this queen of knowledge-mantras displays various forms and performs various functions for the sake of sentient beings.

original: tshad med pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung de tshad med pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung de tshad med pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs bsags pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is the accumulation of immeasurable merit” means that the speech of the Tathāgata arises from the accumulation of immeasurable merit.

original: thogs pa med par gnas pa zhes pa ni sems can gyi khams thams cad du ye shes kyis sgrib pa med par mkhyen pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med par gnas pa zhes pa ni sems can gyi khams thams cad du ye shes kyis sgrib pa med par mkhyen pa zhes pa ste /
translated: The phrase “abiding without obstruction” means that wisdom knows without obstruction the realms of all sentient beings.

original: de bas na dus gsum du ma chags pa'i stobs kyi gnas kyi tshig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na dus gsum du ma chags pa'i stobs kyi gnas kyi tshig ces gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is called the “phrase of the abode of the power of non-attachment in the three times.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes pa nas ting nge 'dzin la kun du mthun par zhugs so zhes pa'i bar du rig pa'i rgyal mo de yongs su bsgrags pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes pa nas ting nge 'dzin la kun du mthun par zhugs so zhes pa'i bar du rig pa'i rgyal mo de yongs su bsgrags pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa
translated: Then, the Blessed One, in order to proclaim that knowledge queen, entered into a samādhi called “Fulfilling All Wishes” up to “entering into a samādhi that is in harmony with all.”

original: ste / de ltar ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa yang bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de lta bu zhig la zhugs kyis ngo mtshar zhig 'byung ngo snyam nas /
analyzed: ste / de ltar ting nge 'dzin du zhugs pa yang bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de lta bu zhig la zhugs kyis ngo mtshar zhig 'byung ngo snyam nas /
translated: Thus, when he entered samādhi, thinking “A wonder will occur from the Blessed One entering such a samādhi,”

original: sems can rnams de ltar blta pa @155b dang nyan par gzung par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams de ltar blta pa @155b dang nyan par gzung par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to make sentient beings see and hear that, he entered samādhi.

original: re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa lce'i dbang pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhing thams cad du khyab par byas nas zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin der 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa lce'i dbang pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhing thams cad du khyab par byas nas zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin der 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: The tongue faculty, which fulfills all hopes, pervades all the buddhafields of the Bhagavat Buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bskal pa du mar bden pa'i tshig bsams pa las gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan lce rgya che ba srab pa kha dog zangs 'dra ba des khyab par byas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bskal pa du mar bden pa'i tshig bsams pa las gyur pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i skyes bu chen po'i mtshan lce rgya che ba srab pa kha dog zangs 'dra ba des khyab par byas zhes pa'o //
translated: The tongue faculty of the Tathagata, which is the result of the words of truth thought of by the Tathagata for many eons, is vast, thin, and copper-colored.

original: rgya chen po zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin de'i khyad par te khams gsum thams cad du khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya chen po zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin de'i khyad par te khams gsum thams cad du khyab par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vast is a particularity of that samadhi, because it pervades the entire triple world.

original: rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa med pa'o //
translated: Pure means free from the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictions.

original: chos kyi rgyal mtshan zhes pa ni chos ston pa rgyal mtshan ltar gzhan las 'phags par ston pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal mtshan zhes pa ni chos ston pa rgyal mtshan ltar gzhan las 'phags par ston pa'o //
translated: The Dharma banner means that the teaching of the Dharma is like a banner, showing superiority over others.

original: mtshan zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin de nyid sngags kyi tshig ston pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin de nyid sngags kyi tshig ston pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The name is the definition of the mantra that teaches that very samādhi.

original: rtse mo kun du blta ba zhes pa ni khams gsum thams cad du gzigs pas na rtse mo ltar mtho ba ste de dag ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: rtse mo kun du blta ba zhes pa ni khams gsum thams cad du gzigs pas na rtse mo ltar mtho ba ste de dag ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par ro //
translated: The peak that looks everywhere is the high peak because it sees everywhere in the three realms. Those are the special features of samādhi.
