original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings khyab par zhes pa ni khams gsum thams cad khyab pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings khyab par zhes pa ni khams gsum thams cad khyab pa zhes pa ste /
translated: The pervasion of the dharmadhātu of all tathāgatas is the pervasion of the entire three realms.

original: de bas na sems can gyi khams yongs su skyong ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na sems can gyi khams yongs su skyong ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the protector of the realm of sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das de lta bu'i sgra 'byin cing rig pa'i rgyal mo gsungs so zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de lta bu'i sgra 'byin cing rig pa'i rgyal mo gsungs so zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: The Blessed One spoke that sound and spoke the queen of knowledge mantras.

original: de skad gsungs ma thag tu zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de skad gsungs ma thag tu zhes pa nas /
translated: As soon as that was said,🔽the power of that queen of knowledge mantras was praised, up to:

original: stobs chen gsang sngags 'di dran pas so zhes pa'i bar du rig pa'i rgyal mo de'i mthu rjes su bsngags pa ste /
analyzed: stobs chen gsang sngags 'di dran pas so zhes pa'i bar du rig pa'i rgyal mo de'i mthu rjes su bsngags pa ste /
translated: By remembering this powerful mantra,

original: bsrung zhing bsgrib pa dang bskyab pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bsrung zhing bsgrib pa dang bskyab pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni /
translated: In order to protect, conceal, and guard them.

original: bsrung ba ni gnod pa chung du las bsrung ba'o /
analyzed: bsrung ba ni gnod pa chung du las bsrung ba'o /
translated: Protection is guarding from minor harm.

original: bsgrib pa ni gnod pa 'bring po las bsgrib pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrib pa ni gnod pa 'bring po las bsgrib pa'o //
translated: Concealment is concealing from middling harm.

original: skyob pa ni gnod pa chen po las sems can rnams sbed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: skyob pa ni gnod pa chen po las sems can rnams sbed par byed pa'o //
translated: Guarding is concealing sentient beings from great harm.

original: de dag la ni 'jigs pa chen po gang dag bsrung ba snying la gnas pa zhes pa ni sems can gang rig pa'i rgyal mo 'di snying la dran na 'jigs pa med do zhes pa'o //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings rgya chen po byin gyis brlab pa zhes pa nas /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i lce'i zhes pa'i bar du dkyil 'khor dgod pa'i sngags rnams bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de dag la ni 'jigs pa chen po gang dag bsrung ba snying la gnas pa zhes pa ni sems can gang rig pa'i rgyal mo 'di snying la dran na 'jigs pa med do zhes pa'o // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings rgya chen po byin gyis brlab pa zhes pa nas / de bzhin gshegs pa'i lce'i zhes pa'i bar du dkyil 'khor dgod pa'i sngags rnams bshad pa ste /
translated: Those who have great fear, who keep this in their hearts, means that if any sentient being keeps this Queen of Awareness in their hearts, they will have no fear.🔽Then the Blessed One explained the mantras for arranging the maṇḍala, from Blessing the vast realm of phenomena up to The Tathāgata's tongue.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings rgya chen po byin gyis brlab pa zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings la @156a * //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi dbyings rgya chen po byin gyis brlab pa zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings la @156a * //
translated: Then the Blessed One, with the mantra Blessing the vast realm of phenomena, blesses the realm of phenomena,

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te zab pa dang rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te zab pa dang rgya che ba'o //
translated: There are also two aspects: profound and vast.

original: de la zab pa ni byang chub kyi snying po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de la zab pa ni byang chub kyi snying po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Of those, the profound is the nature of the essence of enlightenment.🔽The vast is the wheel of the adornment of the inexhaustible body, etc., vajra.

original: rgya che ba ni sku la sogs pa mi zad pa'i rdo rje rgyan gyi 'khor lo ste sku la sogs pa mi zad pa'i 'khor lo de nyid byin gyis brlabs nas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni sku la sogs pa mi zad pa'i rdo rje rgyan gyi 'khor lo ste sku la sogs pa mi zad pa'i 'khor lo de nyid byin gyis brlabs nas zhes pa'o //
translated: That very wheel of the inexhaustible body, etc., is empowered.🔽At that time, he entered into the concentration called the essence of the treasure of the realm of phenomena.

original: de'i tshe chos kyi dbyings mdzod kyi snying po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin de'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe chos kyi dbyings mdzod kyi snying po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin de'i bye brag ste /
translated: This is a particular of that concentration.

original: chos kyi dbyings mdzod ces pa ni dam tshig gi sngags la sogs pa de las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings mdzod ces pa ni dam tshig gi sngags la sogs pa de las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The treasure of the realm of phenomena is the mantra of the commitment, etc., because it arises from that.

original: snying po zhes pa ni 'byung ba'i gnas te sngags de rnams 'byung ba'i gnas de yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: snying po zhes pa ni 'byung ba'i gnas te sngags de rnams 'byung ba'i gnas de yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: The essence is the abode of the arising, because that is the abode of the arising of those mantras.

original: dam tshig las byung ba'i rig pa gsungs so zhes pa ni //
analyzed: dam tshig las byung ba'i rig pa gsungs so zhes pa ni //
translated: The knowledge that arises from the commitment is spoken.

original: dam tshig ces pa ni kun 'gro ba'am chud pa ste /
analyzed: dam tshig ces pa ni kun 'gro ba'am chud pa ste /
translated: The commitment is the all-pervading or the pervading.

original: de yang sku la sogs pa mi zad pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan te de chud par 'jug pa ni rig pa 'di ste 'jug pa yang ma thob par 'jug pa dang thob nas zhig ste 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sku la sogs pa mi zad pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan te de chud par 'jug pa ni rig pa 'di ste 'jug pa yang ma thob par 'jug pa dang thob nas zhig ste 'jug pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the inexhaustible vajra ornaments of the body and so forth are the entrance to this knowledge, which is the entrance to the attainment of the mandala, and the entrance to the attainment of the mandala after it has been destroyed.

original: de la ma thob par 'jug pa ni dkyil 'khor ma mthong ba dang por rig pa 'di blangs te 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma thob par 'jug pa ni dkyil 'khor ma mthong ba dang por rig pa 'di blangs te 'jug pa'o //
translated: Among them, the entrance to the attainment of the mandala is the taking up of this knowledge for the first time by one who has not seen the mandala.

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po la sogs pa rnams kyang rig pa de brjod pa tsam gyis rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor de mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po la sogs pa rnams kyang rig pa de brjod pa tsam gyis rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor de mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even the bodhisattvas Samantabhadra and so forth see that natural mandala by the mere utterance of that knowledge.

original: thob nas zhig ste 'jug pa ni dkyil 'khor ma mthong ba dang / bar gzhan gyis chod nas dam tshig gi sngags 'don pa'o //
analyzed: thob nas zhig ste 'jug pa ni dkyil 'khor ma mthong ba dang / bar gzhan gyis chod nas dam tshig gi sngags 'don pa'o //
translated: The entrance to the attainment of the mandala after it has been destroyed is the recitation of the pledge mantra by one who has not seen the mandala, or by one who has seen it but has been separated from it by another.

original: sngags de 'don pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs gsum gyi 'khor lo'i yon tan brjod pa de thos pa'o //
analyzed: sngags de 'don pa yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs gsum gyi 'khor lo'i yon tan brjod pa de thos pa'o //
translated: The recitation of that mantra is the hearing of the expression of the qualities of the wheel of the body, speech, and mind of the tathāgatas.

original: de nas de ma thag tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor 'dus pa thams cad du dam tshig la 'jug pa'i rig pa'i sgra 'byung ngo zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad ces pa ni 'dul ba'i 'gro ba phal rnams la'o //
analyzed: de nas de ma thag tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor 'dus pa thams cad du dam tshig la 'jug pa'i rig pa'i sgra 'byung ngo zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad ces pa ni 'dul ba'i 'gro ba phal rnams la'o //
translated: All the buddha-fields refers to the majority of the trainees.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor 'dus pa thams cad du zhes pa ni kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i 'khor rnams la'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'khor 'dus pa thams cad du zhes pa ni kun du bzang po la sogs pa'i 'khor rnams la'o //
translated: All the assemblies of the retinue of the bodhisattvas refers to the retinue of Samantabhadra and so on.

original: gang thos nas ni chos kun la mi 'da' ba ni mkhas pa'o zhes pa ni dam tshig ni mkhas pa rnams kyis thos nas lung gi chos dang thob pa'i chos gnyis las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: gang thos nas ni chos kun la mi 'da' ba ni mkhas pa'o zhes pa ni dam tshig ni mkhas pa rnams kyis thos nas lung gi chos dang thob pa'i chos gnyis las mi 'da' ste /
translated: Having heard which, one does not transgress the Dharma, is the expertise. Having heard the commitments, the experts do not transgress the Dharma of transmission and the Dharma of attainment.

original: lung gi chos las mi 'da' ba ni dam pa'i chos yongs su mi gtong ba la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams mi 'dral ba'o //
analyzed: lung gi chos las mi 'da' ba ni dam pa'i chos yongs su mi gtong ba la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams mi 'dral ba'o //
translated: Not transgressing the Dharma of transmission is not violating the commitments such as not abandoning the true Dharma.

original: thob pa'i chos las mi 'da' @156b ba ni rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor de yid la byed pa de mi gtong ba'o //
analyzed: thob pa'i chos las mi 'da' @156b ba ni rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor de yid la byed pa de mi gtong ba'o //
translated: Not transgressing the Dharma that has been obtained is not forsaking the mental activity of that natural maṇḍala.

original: chos kyi dbyings su 'byung ba'i sngags ni 'jug pa ste slob ma'am bdag kyang rung ste stong pa nyid du bsgyur ba'o //🔽rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags ni gnas pa ste ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings su 'byung ba'i sngags ni 'jug pa ste slob ma'am bdag kyang rung ste stong pa nyid du bsgyur ba'o // rdo rje sems dpar byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags ni gnas pa ste ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin nam /
translated: The mantra of the arising of the realm of phenomena is the entry, either of the disciple or of oneself, into emptiness.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi skur gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' nyid kyi skur gnas pa'o //
translated: The mantra of the consecration of Vajrasattva is the abiding, either in the nature of the five gnoses or in the body of Vajrasattva himself.

original: rdo rje go cha'i sngags ni ldang ba ste sems can thams cad bde ba dang ldan pa'i byams pa chen po'i go cha bgos pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje go cha'i sngags ni ldang ba ste sems can thams cad bde ba dang ldan pa'i byams pa chen po'i go cha bgos pa'o //
translated: The mantra of the vajra armor is the rising, the donning of the armor of great love, which is the happiness of all sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan gyi sngags ni slob ma mig g-yogs bkrol te dkyil 'khor bltar gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan gyi sngags ni slob ma mig g-yogs bkrol te dkyil 'khor bltar gzhug pa'o //
translated: The mantra of the eye of the tathāgatas is the removal of the blindfold of the disciple and the entry into the maṇḍala.

original: dri'i sngags ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i yon tan las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dri'i sngags ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i yon tan las gyur pa'o //
translated: The mantra of the perfume is the quality that arises from the pure morality of the tathāgatas.

original: me tog gi sngags ni byams pa chen po'i yon tan las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: me tog gi sngags ni byams pa chen po'i yon tan las gyur pa'o //
translated: The flower mantra is born from the quality of great love.

original: bdug pa'i sngags ni chos kyi dbyings dang rjes su mthun pa'i ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa la sogs pa sreg pa'i yon tan las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bdug pa'i sngags ni chos kyi dbyings dang rjes su mthun pa'i ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa la sogs pa sreg pa'i yon tan las gyur pa'o //
translated: The incense mantra is born from the quality of burning afflictions and so forth with the wisdom that is in accord with the dharmadhatu.

original: me mar gyi sngags ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi 'od 'bar ba nam mkha' bzhin du rgya che bar snang ba las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: me mar gyi sngags ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi 'od 'bar ba nam mkha' bzhin du rgya che bar snang ba las gyur pa'o //
translated: The lamp mantra is born from the blazing light of the Tathagata's wisdom appearing in the sky.

original: aargha'i sngags ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa nam mkha' dang mnyam pa dang mnyam pa med pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: aargha'i sngags ni chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa nam mkha' dang mnyam pa dang mnyam pa med pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The argha mantra is born from the equality of the pure dharmadhatu with space.

original: gtsug tor gyi sngags ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyi gtsug bltar mi snang ba nam mkha' ltar mtha' med pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gtsug tor gyi sngags ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyi gtsug bltar mi snang ba nam mkha' ltar mtha' med pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The ushnisha mantra is born from the Tathagata's invisible crown protuberance, which is like the sky in being limitless.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i go cha'i sngags ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i go cha'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra of the Tathagata's armor

original: de bzhin nyid thob par byed pa'i lam gyi ye shes 'bar ba des shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dag sreg par byed pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid thob par byed pa'i lam gyi ye shes 'bar ba des shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dag sreg par byed pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The mantra of the blazing wisdom of the path that causes the attainment of thatness burns up the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictions.

original: kun du 'bar ba'i sngags ni 'od kyi dkyil 'khor te de yang lam gyi shes rab 'bar ba ste /
analyzed: kun du 'bar ba'i sngags ni 'od kyi dkyil 'khor te de yang lam gyi shes rab 'bar ba ste /
translated: The mantra of the blazing circle of light is the blazing wisdom of the path.

original: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa sreg par byad pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa sreg par byad pa las byung ba'o //
translated: It burns up the obscurations of the knowable and the afflictions.

original: yang dag par gshags pa'i lce'i sngags ni /
analyzed: yang dag par gshags pa'i lce'i sngags ni /
translated: The mantra of the tongue of the Tathāgata

original: bden pa'i tshig gi chos la gnas pa las byung ba ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan dang ; gtsug tor la sogs pa'i sngags de rnams 'og nas 'byung ba'i phyag rgya dang ldan par bya ste /
analyzed: bden pa'i tshig gi chos la gnas pa las byung ba ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan dang ; gtsug tor la sogs pa'i sngags de rnams 'og nas 'byung ba'i phyag rgya dang ldan par bya ste /
translated: arises from abiding in the Dharma of true words. The mantras of the Tathāgata’s eye, uṣṇīṣa, and so on, are endowed with the mudras that will be explained below.

original: slob dpon nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur bsgyur na yang sngags de rnams kyis bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: slob dpon nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i skur bsgyur na yang sngags de rnams kyis bsgyur ba'o //
translated: If the master transforms into the body of the Tathāgata, he transforms with those mantras.

original: nam snying po 'bru gcig pa las bsgyur na ni 'di rnams kyang mi dgos so //
analyzed: nam snying po 'bru gcig pa las bsgyur na ni 'di rnams kyang mi dgos so //
translated: If he transforms from the single syllable essence mantra, those are not necessary.

original: slob ma @157a * //
analyzed: slob ma @157a * //
translated: The disciples

original: dbang bskur ba na yang bum pa'i chus blugs pa'i 'og tu sngags de rnams phyag rgya dang bcas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba na yang bum pa'i chus blugs pa'i 'og tu sngags de rnams phyag rgya dang bcas par sbyar ro //
translated: Also, when conferring initiation, after pouring the vase water, one should apply those mantras together with the seals.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi dkyil 'khor de bri ba'i tshe ni bgegs zhi bar 'gyur zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi dkyil 'khor de bri ba'i tshe ni bgegs zhi bar 'gyur zhes pa ni /
translated: How is it that when one draws that maṇḍala of the Bhagavat, the obstructors are pacified?

original: dkyil 'khor thog mar 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thog mar 'dri ba ste /
translated: [This is] the first drawing of the maṇḍala.

original: sbyor ba'i tshe dang bris nas slob ma la sogs pa gzung ba'i las byed pa'i tshe na /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i tshe dang bris nas slob ma la sogs pa gzung ba'i las byed pa'i tshe na /
translated: When one is engaged in the activity of drawing and after drawing, when one is engaged in the activity of accepting disciples and so forth,

original: slob ma la sogs pa bcud zin pa'i tshe bgegs byung na ji ltar bgyi zhes zhus pa'o //
analyzed: slob ma la sogs pa bcud zin pa'i tshe bgegs byung na ji ltar bgyi zhes zhus pa'o //
translated: when the disciples and so forth are gathered, if obstructors arise, what should one do?

original: sngags rnams kyang ni sgrub pa yi //
analyzed: sngags rnams kyang ni sgrub pa yi //
translated: The mantras are also accomplished.

original: bgegs rnams kyis ni gnod mi byed //
analyzed: bgegs rnams kyis ni gnod mi byed //
translated: The obstructors do not cause harm.

original: ces pa ni dkyil 'khor bris kyang rung ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni dkyil 'khor bris kyang rung ste /
translated: This is also suitable for drawing the maṇḍala.

original: spyir sngags sgrub pa la bgegs byung na ji ltar zhi bar bgyi zhes pa'o //
analyzed: spyir sngags sgrub pa la bgegs byung na ji ltar zhi bar bgyi zhes pa'o //
translated: In general, if obstructors arise in the practice of mantra, how should one pacify them?

original: sngags rnams kyang ni ji ltar sgrub //
analyzed: sngags rnams kyang ni ji ltar sgrub //
translated: How are the mantras also accomplished?

original: ces pa ni sngags sgrub pa bzlas pa'i yan lag bzhi la sogs pa ji ltar bgyi zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni sngags sgrub pa bzlas pa'i yan lag bzhi la sogs pa ji ltar bgyi zhes pa'o //
translated: This is asking, How should one perform the four branches of mantra practice, such as repetition?

original: 'bras bu'ang ci ru 'gyur zhes pa ni sngags bsgrubs na de'i 'bras bu ci 'dra bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'ang ci ru 'gyur zhes pa ni sngags bsgrubs na de'i 'bras bu ci 'dra bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: And what will be the result? is asking, What will the result be like if one practices mantra?

original: bgegs ni rang gi sems las byung ;🔽/ zhes pa nas /
analyzed: bgegs ni rang gi sems las byung ; / zhes pa nas /
translated: The obstacles arise from one's own mind,

original: tshangs pa brgya byin bcas pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa brgya byin bcas pa'o //
translated: up to Brahma and Indra.

original: zhes pa'i bar du bgegs zhi bar bya ba bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du bgegs zhi bar bya ba bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the pacification of obstacles.

original: de yang mtshan ma med pa ste /
analyzed: de yang mtshan ma med pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is signless,

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: and with signs.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni byang chub bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni byang chub bsgom pa'o //
translated: Signless is the cultivation of enlightenment.

original: mtshan ma ni 'phags pa mi g-yo ba'i gzugs su bsgyur zhing sngags dang phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor dang ldan par sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni 'phags pa mi g-yo ba'i gzugs su bsgyur zhing sngags dang phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor dang ldan par sbyar ba'o //
translated: Signs are transforming into the form of the noble Acala, and applying with mantra, mudra, and mandala.

original: bgegs ni rang gi sems las byung //
analyzed: bgegs ni rang gi sems las byung //
translated: The obstacles arise from one's own mind,

original: sngon chad ser sna bsnyen pas te //
analyzed: sngon chad ser sna bsnyen pas te //
translated: due to previously cultivating stinginess,

original: de yi rgyu ni gzhig pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de yi rgyu ni gzhig pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to destroy that cause,

original: byang chub sems zhes dran pa ste //
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes dran pa ste //
translated: one should recall the thought of enlightenment.

original: zhes pa ni bgegs chos dang zang zing gzhan la mi gtong bar 'jungs pa'i bsnyen pa'i bag chags rang gi sems la sogs pa las gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bgegs chos dang zang zing gzhan la mi gtong bar 'jungs pa'i bsnyen pa'i bag chags rang gi sems la sogs pa las gyur te /
translated: This is the latent impression of stinginess in the form of not giving to the obstructors the Dharma or other material things, which arises from one's own mind, etc.

original: bgegs de'i rgyu ni ser sna yin te /
analyzed: bgegs de'i rgyu ni ser sna yin te /
translated: The cause of that obstructor is stinginess.

original: de gzhig pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa na snying po nyid kyi rang bzhin goms par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de gzhig pa'i phyir byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa na snying po nyid kyi rang bzhin goms par bya ba ste /
translated: In order to destroy that, when cultivating the Thought of Enlightenment, one should cultivate the nature of the essence.

original: stong pa nyid goms par byas na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid goms par byas na /
translated: Having cultivated emptiness,

original: ser sna'i dngos po'am bgegs kyi dngos po dag dmigs su med pa'i sgo nas zhi bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: ser sna'i dngos po'am bgegs kyi dngos po dag dmigs su med pa'i sgo nas zhi bar 'gyur ro//
translated: the thing of stinginess or the thing of the obstructor will be pacified by way of non-apprehension.

original: gang gi rtog pa spangs pa zhes pa nas rnam par rtog pa las byung de kun de bzhin zhes pa'i bar du byang chub kyi sems de nyid kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: gang gi rtog pa spangs pa zhes pa nas rnam par rtog pa las byung de kun de bzhin zhes pa'i bar du byang chub kyi sems de nyid kyi khyad par te /
translated: The special quality of just that Thought of Enlightenment is from who has abandoned conceptualization up to all those arise from conceptualization, just so.

original: byang chub kyi sems de ni rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa spong zhing 'gog pa'i rang bzhin no zhas pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems de ni rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa spong zhing 'gog pa'i rang bzhin no zhas pa'o //
translated: That Thought of Enlightenment has the nature of abandoning and stopping conceptualization, etc.

original: sngags pa byang sems dran par bya //
analyzed: sngags pa byang sems dran par bya //
translated: The mantra practitioner should be mindful of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: yid la mi g-yo ba @157b yi bzlas //
analyzed: yid la mi g-yo ba @157b yi bzlas //
translated: The recitation is unmoving in the mind.

original: bgegs rnams kyang ni rab tu 'bros //
analyzed: bgegs rnams kyang ni rab tu 'bros //
translated: The obstructors will flee.

original: de yi phyag rgya byas na'o //
analyzed: de yi phyag rgya byas na'o //
translated: This is done with the seal.

original: zhes pa ni bgegs bsal ba'i thabs gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bgegs bsal ba'i thabs gnyis pa ste /
translated: This is the second method for dispelling obstructors.

original: sngags pa byang chub kyi sems dran par byas nas 'phags pa mi g-yo ba'i sngags yid kyis zlos pa ni /
analyzed: sngags pa byang chub kyi sems dran par byas nas 'phags pa mi g-yo ba'i sngags yid kyis zlos pa ni /
translated: The mantrin, having recalled the thought of awakening, mentally recites the mantra of Ārya Acalanātha.

original: de'i snying gar rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi nang na yi ge ham 'dug par bsams te /
analyzed: de'i snying gar rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi nang na yi ge ham 'dug par bsams te /
translated: He imagines the letter haṃ in the center of the wind maṇḍala in his heart.

original: yi ge ham gi sgra chos thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bur mi dmigs pa ni byang chub kyi sems dran pa'o //
analyzed: yi ge ham gi sgra chos thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bur mi dmigs pa ni byang chub kyi sems dran pa'o //
translated: The sound of the letter haṃ is the recollection of the thought of awakening, the non-observation of all phenomena as cause and effect.

original: sngags zlos yid la mi g-yo ba zlos pa ste /
analyzed: sngags zlos yid la mi g-yo ba zlos pa ste /
translated: The recitation is unmoving in the mind.

original: de ltar sngags de phyag rgya dang ldan par bzlas te /
analyzed: de ltar sngags de phyag rgya dang ldan par bzlas te /
translated: Thus, the mantra is recited with the seal.

original: bsdigs na bgegs de 'byer bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsdigs na bgegs de 'byer bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one threatens, the obstructors will flee.

original: rlung bcing ba ni 'di nyon cig pa nas sngon gyi rgyal bas gsungs zhes pa'i bar du rlung mnan pa'i cho ga ste /
analyzed: rlung bcing ba ni 'di nyon cig pa nas sngon gyi rgyal bas gsungs zhes pa'i bar du rlung mnan pa'i cho ga ste /
translated: Listen to the binding of the wind.

original: bdag yi ge aa las rnam par snang mdzad du bsgyur nas /
analyzed: bdag yi ge aa las rnam par snang mdzad du bsgyur nas /
translated: One should transform oneself into Vairocana from the letter A.

original: yid la 'phags pa mi g-yo ba'i snying po ham bsams shing /
analyzed: yid la 'phags pa mi g-yo ba'i snying po ham bsams shing /
translated: One should imagine the essence of noble Acala in the mind, the letter Ha.

original: rlung gi phyogs su yi ge dri'i thig le bdun bya ba ni /
analyzed: rlung gi phyogs su yi ge dri'i thig le bdun bya ba ni /
translated: In the wind direction, one should make seven drops of fragrant letters.

original: rlung gi rgyal po 'khor dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: rlung gi rgyal po 'khor dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The king of the wind and his retinue are there.

original: 'khor drug gi mtha' bskor nas rgyal po nyid dbus su bzhag la /
analyzed: 'khor drug gi mtha' bskor nas rgyal po nyid dbus su bzhag la /
translated: Surrounding the six retinue, one should place the king in the center.

original: kun kyang ri dags la zhon pa /
analyzed: kun kyang ri dags la zhon pa /
translated: All of them are mounted on deer.

original: kha dog sngon por bsams te /
analyzed: kha dog sngon por bsams te /
translated: One should imagine them as blue in color.

original: de'i steng du kham phor gyis bkab la /
analyzed: de'i steng du kham phor gyis bkab la /
translated: One should cover that with a clay pot.

original: kham phor de'i bar du bsams te /
analyzed: kham phor de'i bar du bsams te /
translated: One should imagine that clay pot in the center.

original: de'i steng du yi ge aam bsams te /
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge aam bsams te /
translated: One should imagine the letter Aṃ above that.

original: aam las dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gser gyi kha dog 'dra ba shin tu khro bar bsam mo //
analyzed: aam las dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gser gyi kha dog 'dra ba shin tu khro bar bsam mo //
translated: From the Aṃ, one should imagine a maṇḍala of great power, the color of gold, very wrathful.

original: sems dpa' chen po chu ni zhes pa nas /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po chu ni zhes pa nas /
translated: “O great being, the water…”

original: sprin de ma thag 'gyes pa phyogs kun nas ni langs pa'o zhes pa'i bar du chu'i bgegs bsal ba ste /
analyzed: sprin de ma thag 'gyes pa phyogs kun nas ni langs pa'o zhes pa'i bar du chu'i bgegs bsal ba ste /
translated: “…the cloud immediately disperses, rising in all directions.”

original: bdag nyid yi ge ra las 'phags pa mi g-yo ba mdog dmar po 'bar bar bsams la ;
analyzed: bdag nyid yi ge ra las 'phags pa mi g-yo ba mdog dmar po 'bar bar bsams la ;
translated: One should imagine oneself as Noble Acala, red in color, arisen from the syllable raṃ.

original: sprin gyi gzugs sa la bris te /
analyzed: sprin gyi gzugs sa la bris te /
translated: One should draw the form of a cloud on the ground.

original: ral gri'i phyag rgyas de gtubs na 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ral gri'i phyag rgyas de gtubs na 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one cuts it with the sword mudrā, it will be destroyed.

original: yang de la btab ste /
analyzed: yang de la btab ste /
translated: One should strike it again.

original: mkhas pas rdo rjer gyur pa ste /🔽zhes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhas pas rdo rjer gyur pa ste / zhes par 'gyur ro //
translated: The wise one will become a vajra.

original: yang na bgegs su 'gyur ba kun zhi bar 'gyur bar bya ba yang bshad do //
analyzed: yang na bgegs su 'gyur ba kun zhi bar 'gyur bar bya ba yang bshad do //
translated: Or, it is also explained that all obstacles will be pacified.

original: chu'i bgegs de nyid bsal ba'i phyir gzhan gsungs te /
analyzed: chu'i bgegs de nyid bsal ba'i phyir gzhan gsungs te /
translated: In order to remove that very obstacle of water, another [method] is taught:

original: bdag nyid phyag na rdo rjer bsgyur la /
analyzed: bdag nyid phyag na rdo rjer bsgyur la /
translated: One should transform oneself into Vajrapāṇi.

original: rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: rdo rje rtse lnga pa'i phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: One should form the five-pronged vajra mudrā.

original: phyag rgya'i rtse sprin gyi gzugs la phur bus gdab pa'i thabs su btsugs pa ni zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i rtse sprin gyi gzugs la phur bus gdab pa'i thabs su btsugs pa ni zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one stabs the tip of the mudrā into the form of the cloud as if nailing it, it will be pacified.

original: yang na bgegs su 'gyur ba kun zhi bar 'gyur ba bya ba yang bshad do //
analyzed: yang na bgegs su 'gyur ba kun zhi bar 'gyur ba bya ba yang bshad do //
translated: Or, it is also explained that all obstacles will be pacified.

original: 'chi ba yang ni @158a * //
analyzed: 'chi ba yang ni @158a * //
translated: Even death

original: dog med ces pa'i bar du bgegs zhi bar byed pa'i thabs gzhan du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: dog med ces pa'i bar du bgegs zhi bar byed pa'i thabs gzhan du gsungs pa ste /
translated: Up to “without fear” is the method of pacifying obstructors taught elsewhere.

original: sngags pa 'phags pa mi g-yo ba'i gzugs su bsgyur nas de'i sngags bzlas pa bya ste /
analyzed: sngags pa 'phags pa mi g-yo ba'i gzugs su bsgyur nas de'i sngags bzlas pa bya ste /
translated: The mantra practitioner, having transformed into the form of Ārya Acalanātha, should recite his mantra.

original: 'phags pa mi g-yo bar bsgyur ba yang /
analyzed: 'phags pa mi g-yo bar bsgyur ba yang /
translated: Also, the transformation into Ārya Acalanātha

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor snying gar bsams te /
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor snying gar bsams te /
translated: is as follows: Having imagined a wind maṇḍala at the heart,

original: de la gnas par bsam zhing sngags pa de nyid dkyil 'khor chen po'i sgo khyud kyi nang du 'dug la /
analyzed: de la gnas par bsam zhing sngags pa de nyid dkyil 'khor chen po'i sgo khyud kyi nang du 'dug la /
translated: one should imagine that the obstructor is placed there. The mantra practitioner should sit inside the enclosure of the great maṇḍala.

original: der bgegs kyi gzugs bris te /
analyzed: der bgegs kyi gzugs bris te /
translated: There, one should draw the form of the obstructor.

original: de'i spyi bor rkang pa g-yon pas btsir na bgegs zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i spyi bor rkang pa g-yon pas btsir na bgegs zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one presses down on his head with one’s left foot, the obstructor will be pacified.

original: ske tshe dug dang bsres pa yis //
analyzed: ske tshe dug dang bsres pa yis //
translated: “Having mixed black mustard seeds with poison,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: tshangs pa brgya byin bcas pa yang //
analyzed: tshangs pa brgya byin bcas pa yang //
translated: even Brahmā and Indra

original: zhes pa'i bar du yang bgegs gzhan bsal ba'i thabs gzhan bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du yang bgegs gzhan bsal ba'i thabs gzhan bshad pa ste /
translated: is the explanation of another method of removing other obstructors.

original: bgegs kyi gzugs byas la dug dang ske tshe bsres pas bskus te /
analyzed: bgegs kyi gzugs byas la dug dang ske tshe bsres pas bskus te /
translated: Having made the form of the obstructor, one should smear it with poison and black mustard seeds.

original: me la bskams na bgegs zhi bar 'gyur te //
analyzed: me la bskams na bgegs zhi bar 'gyur te //
translated: If one dries it in the fire, the obstructor will be pacified.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la phyag na rdo rjes 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa nas /
translated: Then Vajrapani said to the Lord...

original: sngags kyi sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang rang gi gnas la 'dug nas don thams cad la nan tan bgyi'o zhes pa'i bar du sngar bgegs bsal ba bshad pa'i skabs su /
analyzed: sngags kyi sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang rang gi gnas la 'dug nas don thams cad la nan tan bgyi'o zhes pa'i bar du sngar bgegs bsal ba bshad pa'i skabs su /
translated: ...and the bodhisattvas who practice the bodhisattva deeds through the door of mantra should also accomplish all their goals while remaining in their own places.

original: 'phags pa mi g-yo ba rlung gi kha dog tu gnas te /
analyzed: 'phags pa mi g-yo ba rlung gi kha dog tu gnas te /
translated: The noble Acala is established in the color of wind.

original: bskrad pa dang me'i kha dog tu bsgyur te ;
analyzed: bskrad pa dang me'i kha dog tu bsgyur te ;
translated: Expelling and transforming into the color of fire,

original: bgegs bskrad pa dang kham phor la dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor bsam pa nas phyag na rdo rje mjal ba'i don /
analyzed: bgegs bskrad pa dang kham phor la dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor bsam pa nas phyag na rdo rje mjal ba'i don /
translated: expelling obstructors and imagining the mandala of great earth in a bowl, the meaning of meeting with Vajrapani,

original: zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i las bya ba rnams la /
analyzed: zhi ba dang rgyas pa'i las bya ba rnams la /
translated: the performance of pacifying and increasing activities,

original: lha rnams rang rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas nas /
analyzed: lha rnams rang rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas nas /
translated: the deities abiding in their own mandalas,

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams byed par mjal te /
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams byed par mjal te /
translated: and the performance of pacifying and other activities are met with.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dam tshig gi tshul gyis de lta ste /
analyzed: dam tshig gi tshul gyis de lta ste /
translated: It is so by the way of commitment.

original: lha rnams rang rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas par sbyar na /
analyzed: lha rnams rang rang gi dkyil 'khor la gnas par sbyar na /
translated: If the deities are connected to their respective maṇḍalas,

original: gang du bsam pa de byin gyis brlabs la las gang bya ba rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pas ji skad gsungs pa bzhin du byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang du bsam pa de byin gyis brlabs la las gang bya ba rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pas ji skad gsungs pa bzhin du byed par 'gyur te /
translated: then wherever one wishes, that is empowered, and whatever actions are to be performed are also done just as the tathāgatas have taught.

original: de bas na sngags pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: de bas na sngags pa rnams kyang /
translated: Therefore, the mantra practitioners

original: lha'i kha dog ci 'dra ba der bsgyur te /
analyzed: lha'i kha dog ci 'dra ba der bsgyur te /
translated: transform into the color of the deity and

original: las bya ba rnams mjal to zhes pa'o //
analyzed: las bya ba rnams mjal to zhes pa'o //
translated: perform the rites.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān replied:

original: gsang ba'i bdag po de de bzhin no //
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po de de bzhin no //
translated: “Guhyapati, it is so!

original: ji skad smras pa de de bzhin te zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa de de bzhin te zhes pa ni /
translated: It is just as you have said.”

original: phyag na rdo rje mjal ba de phyin ci ma log par mjal to zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje mjal ba de phyin ci ma log par mjal to zhes pa'o //
translated: Since Vajrapāṇi’s encounter was unmistaken,

original: gang dang gang gi kha dog tu gsungs pa de'i dkyil @158b 'khor yang de nyid do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gang dang gang gi kha dog tu gsungs pa de'i dkyil @158b 'khor yang de nyid do zhes pa ni /
translated: “Whatever color is taught, that is the maṇḍala.”

original: lha rnams kyi kha dog ste /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi kha dog ste /
translated: The colors of the deities

original: ci 'dra ba de'i dkyil 'khor yang de 'dra bar bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba de'i dkyil 'khor yang de 'dra bar bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: are whatever they are, and the maṇḍala should be made in that way.

original: kha dog ser po ni dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: kha dog ser po ni dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la sbyar bar bya /
translated: The color yellow is applied to the maṇḍala of great power.

original: lha'i kha dog dkar po ni chu'i dkyil 'khor du sbyar bar bya /🔽lha'i kha dog dmar po ni me'i dkyil 'khor la sbyar bar bya /
analyzed: lha'i kha dog dkar po ni chu'i dkyil 'khor du sbyar bar bya / lha'i kha dog dmar po ni me'i dkyil 'khor la sbyar bar bya /
translated: The color white of the deity is applied to the maṇḍala of water.🔽The color red of the deity is applied to the maṇḍala of fire.

original: lha'i kha dog sngon po dang nag po ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: lha'i kha dog sngon po dang nag po ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The color blue and black of the deity is applied to the maṇḍala of wind.

original: de rnams ni so so'i dkyil 'khor 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni so so'i dkyil 'khor 'chad pa'o //
translated: Those are the individual maṇḍalas.

original: de las mchod pa'i yo byad la sogs pas gzhan du bsgyur na /
analyzed: de las mchod pa'i yo byad la sogs pas gzhan du bsgyur na /
translated: If one transforms them into something else with the articles of offering, and so on,

original: rgyas pa'i lha yang zhi bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyas pa'i lha yang zhi bar 'gyur /
translated: the deity of increase also becomes pacifying.

original: zhi ba yang khro bo la sogs par dgos pa'i phyir sgyur du rung bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi ba yang khro bo la sogs par dgos pa'i phyir sgyur du rung bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Since pacifying also becomes wrathful, and so on, one should understand that it is suitable to transform them.

original: lha la la ni kha dog thams cad dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: lha la la ni kha dog thams cad dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Some deities have all colors.

original: dper na a'arya t'a ra la sogs pa kha dog ljang gu bas kha dog thams cad dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: dper na a'arya t'a ra la sogs pa kha dog ljang gu bas kha dog thams cad dang ldan pa ste /
translated: For example, Āryatārā, who is green, has all colors.

original: dkyil 'khor kun dang las thams cad byed par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor kun dang las thams cad byed par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that she performs all maṇḍalas and all activities.

original: de bzhin du dgongs pa'i dbang gis mchod pa'i yo byad la sogs pas sgyur na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dgongs pa'i dbang gis mchod pa'i yo byad la sogs pas sgyur na /
translated: Likewise, if one transforms the articles of offering and so forth by the power of contemplation,

original: rang bzhin so so'i nges pa las kyang las thams cad byed par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin so so'i nges pa las kyang las thams cad byed par shes par bya'o //
translated: one should understand that one can perform all activities even in terms of the individual natures.

original: de la gsang ba'i bdag po ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sems can blo zhan pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de la gsang ba'i bdag po ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sems can blo zhan pa zhes pa nas /
translated: Therein, Guhyapati, in the future time, sentient beings of weak intellect...

original: de dag gis sngon sems can rnams la phan par dgongs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gis sngon sems can rnams la phan par dgongs pa'i phyir /
translated: ...because they have previously intended to benefit sentient beings,🔽...they do not fully understand all of these teachings.

original: 'di thams cad bstan par rab tu mi shes so zhes pa'i bar du lha rnams kyi kha dog gang yin pa dkyil 'khor yang de yin par gsungs pa /🔽dbang po dang me'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di thams cad bstan par rab tu mi shes so zhes pa'i bar du lha rnams kyi kha dog gang yin pa dkyil 'khor yang de yin par gsungs pa / dbang po dang me'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ni /
translated: The maṇḍalas of the colors of the deities and so on

original: 'jig rten pa'i rgyud la yod kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rgyud la yod kyi /
translated: are found in worldly tantras,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rgyud /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rgyud /
translated: but the transcendent maṇḍalas

original: bya ba'i rgyud dang spyod pa'i rgyud kun las mi 'byung bas na /
analyzed: bya ba'i rgyud dang spyod pa'i rgyud kun las mi 'byung bas na /
translated: are not found in any action or conduct tantras.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa ma yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Therefore, they say, “This was not taught by the Buddha.”

original: gang 'jig rten gyi rgyud rnams kyang /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten gyi rgyud rnams kyang /
translated: Those who say that even the worldly tantras

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pas sems can rnams so so'i dad pa dang rjes su mthun par mi shes so zhes pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pas sems can rnams so so'i dad pa dang rjes su mthun par mi shes so zhes pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ste /
translated: Because the Omniscient Buddha Bhagavat said, “Sentient beings do not know in accordance with their faith.”

original: de ci'i phyir de ltar mi shes she na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir de ltar mi shes she na /
translated: Why do they not know in that way?

original: blo zhen cing dad pa chung ba la sogs pa'i nyes pas bskal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo zhen cing dad pa chung ba la sogs pa'i nyes pas bskal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the fault of their small faith and so forth, they are obscured.🔽The characteristic of phenomena is also not known by fools.

original: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyang blun po rnams kyis mi shes so zhes pa ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yang de dag gis mi shes so zhes pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid kyang blun po rnams kyis mi shes so zhes pa ni chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yang de dag gis mi shes so zhes pa ste /
translated: This means that even the characteristic of phenomena, the nature of emptiness, is not known by them.

original: bdag kyang ma rung la /
analyzed: bdag kyang ma rung la /
translated: They ruin themselves,

original: gzhan yang ma rung bar byed do zhes pa dang sbyar ro //🔽rtag @159a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang ma rung bar byed do zhes pa dang sbyar ro // rtag @159a * //
translated: and they also ruin others.

original: tu sngags pa der gnas la //
analyzed: tu sngags pa der gnas la //
translated: The mantra practitioner always abiding there,

original: rab tu nges par las byed do //
analyzed: rab tu nges par las byed do //
translated: definitely performs the rite.

original: zhes pa ni sngags pas stong pa nyid la gnas nas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las bya'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags pas stong pa nyid la gnas nas zhi ba la sogs pa'i las bya'o zhes pa ste /
translated: This means that the mantra practitioner, abiding in emptiness, should perform the rites of pacification and so forth.

original: stong pa nyid la gnas nas las bya ba yang /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la gnas nas las bya ba yang /
translated: Also, with regard to performing actions while abiding in emptiness,

original: gcig ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas /
analyzed: gcig ni mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas /
translated: one abides in the samādhi of signlessness,

original: de nyid kyis grub pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis grub pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and thereby one attains accomplishment.

original: gcig ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin sngon du byas nas de las langs te /
analyzed: gcig ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin sngon du byas nas de las langs te /
translated: One who has previously cultivated the samādhi of emptiness rises from that and

original: bzlas pa la sogs pa byas nas grub pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: bzlas pa la sogs pa byas nas grub pa thob pa'o //
translated: having performed recitation and so on, attains accomplishment.

original: de dag ni bgegs zhi bar bya ba'i skabs so //
analyzed: de dag ni bgegs zhi bar bya ba'i skabs so //
translated: Those are the sections on pacifying obstructors.

original: da ni kun du bzang po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' de rnams thog ma mos pa spyod pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: da ni kun du bzang po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' de rnams thog ma mos pa spyod pa'i sa la zhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: Now, when those bodhisattvas, such as Samantabhadra, first enter the stage of engagement through belief,

original: rang gi rnam par grol pa'i sgo sngags kyi tshig bstan pa de nyid la goms par byas pas /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par grol pa'i sgo sngags kyi tshig bstan pa de nyid la goms par byas pas /
translated: they cultivate the mantra words that are the door of their own liberation

original: sa bcu dang sa bcu gcig pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rang rang gi rnam par thar pa'i sgo ji ltar chud pa /
analyzed: sa bcu dang sa bcu gcig pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rang rang gi rnam par thar pa'i sgo ji ltar chud pa /
translated: and, having perfected the ten stages, the eleventh stage, and so on, they enter their own door of liberation.

original: snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor du sngags rnams dgod pa'i phyir smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i dkyil 'khor du sngags rnams dgod pa'i phyir smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: Wishing to speak in order to set forth the mantras in the maṇḍala of the arising of great compassion,🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba ste /
translated: In order to set forth the mantras in the maṇḍala of the arising of great compassion, he wishes to request the Bhagavān.

original: de nas rdo rje 'dzin pa de dag phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rje 'dzin pa de dag phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, those vajra holders, Vajrapāṇi and so forth, with palms joined in supplication, said this to the Bhagavān:

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa de dag la mi nyams pa'i chos nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de rnams mi 'gong ba'am /🔽spobs pa skye bar byin gyis brlabs zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa de dag la mi nyams pa'i chos nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' de rnams mi 'gong ba'am / spobs pa skye bar byin gyis brlabs zhes pa'o //
translated: Then, the Bhagavān Vairocana blessed those bodhisattvas and those vajra holders with the nature of non-degeneration. This means he blessed those bodhisattvas to be undaunted and to generate eloquence.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rgyan zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rgyan zhes pa ni /
translated: The ornament of the buddhas refers to

original: kun du bzang po byang chub sems dpa' de ting nge 'dzin du zhugs na /
analyzed: kun du bzang po byang chub sems dpa' de ting nge 'dzin du zhugs na /
translated: when that bodhisattva Samantabhadra enters into meditative concentration,

original: spu'i khung bu re re nas sangs rgyas re re 'byung ste /
analyzed: spu'i khung bu re re nas sangs rgyas re re 'byung ste /
translated: from each of his pores, a buddha appears.

original: de ltar lus las sangs rgyas grangs med par 'gyur ba de nyid rgyan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lus las sangs rgyas grangs med par 'gyur ba de nyid rgyan zhes bya'o //
translated: In this way, the “countless buddhas” from the body are the “ornaments.”

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' so so'i yon tan dang rjes su mthun par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin rnams ni byang chub sems dpa' so so'i yon tan dang rjes su mthun par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the samādhis should be understood to be in accordance with the individual qualities of the bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin du sngags rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan las byung ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the mantras arise from the qualities of the tathāgatas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyi so so'i rnam par grol ba'i sgo ste de dag nyid kyi tshig tu byin gyis brlab par shes par bya'o //🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis 'khor 'dus pa thams cad la gzigs nas zhes pa nas rkyen dbang la ste /🔽zab la blta dka' ba zhes pa'i @159b bar du /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyi so so'i rnam par grol ba'i sgo ste de dag nyid kyi tshig tu byin gyis brlab par shes par bya'o // de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis 'khor 'dus pa thams cad la gzigs nas zhes pa nas rkyen dbang la ste / zab la blta dka' ba zhes pa'i @159b bar du /
translated: Those are the individual doors of liberation of those bodhisattvas, and one should understand that they are empowered as the words of those [mantras].

original: sngar yi ge aa rnam pa bzhi byang chub dang spyod pa dang / kun du sangs rgyas pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo bshad pa ste /
analyzed: sngar yi ge aa rnam pa bzhi byang chub dang spyod pa dang / kun du sangs rgyas pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo bshad pa ste /
translated: Then, the bhagavān Vairocana, having looked at the entire assembly, from “the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Śākyamuni” up to “the profound, difficult to see, difficult to realize, difficult to understand, and difficult to realize” is the explanation of the four aspects of the letter a—awakening, conduct, complete buddhahood, and nirvāṇa—as the door of samādhi.

original: de nyid kyi don byang chub dang spyod pa dang / kun du sangs rgyas pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin kun bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi don byang chub dang spyod pa dang / kun du sangs rgyas pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin kun bstan pa ste /
translated: universal buddhahood, and nirvana.🔽The teaching of that is for the sake of the migrating

original: de bstan pa yang gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnams /
analyzed: de bstan pa yang gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnams /
translated: beings to be tamed.

original: la la ni yi ge aa la sogs pa'i 'bru'i sgo nas goms par byed de /
analyzed: la la ni yi ge aa la sogs pa'i 'bru'i sgo nas goms par byed de /
translated: Some are familiarized through the syllables such as a and so on.

original: la la ni de'i don gyi sgo nas goms par byed de /
analyzed: la la ni de'i don gyi sgo nas goms par byed de /
translated: Some are familiarized through the meaning of that.

original: de nas don 'di bstan pas byang chub la sogs pa'i rang bzhin chung par bya ba don gyi sgo nas bstan to //
analyzed: de nas don 'di bstan pas byang chub la sogs pa'i rang bzhin chung par bya ba don gyi sgo nas bstan to //
translated: Then, through teaching this meaning, the nature of enlightenment and so on is taught through the meaning of the words.🔽The words of the Dharma that are taught are the words of the Dharma that🔽accomplish all hopes, the words of the Dharma that accomplish the🔽inexhaustible wisdom of the limitless three times, and the words of the🔽Dharma that accomplish the inexhaustible wisdom of the limitless three🔽times.🔽The words of the Dharma that accomplish all hopes are the words of🔽the Dharma that accomplish the inexhaustible wisdom of the limitless🔽three times.🔽The words of the Dharma that accomplish the inexhaustible wisdom

original: re ba thams cad rdzogs par byed pa dus gsum mtha' yas pa'i sgo gdon mi za ba'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i chos kyi tshig gsungs so zhes pa de la re ba thams cad rdzogs par byed pa dus gsum mtha' yas pa'i sgo gdon mi
analyzed: re ba thams cad rdzogs par byed pa dus gsum mtha' yas pa'i sgo gdon mi za ba'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i chos kyi tshig gsungs so zhes pa de la re ba thams cad rdzogs par byed pa dus gsum mtha' yas pa'i sgo gdon mi
translated: of the limitless three times are the words of the Dharma that accomplish🔽the inexhaustible wisdom of the limitless three times.🔽The words of the Dharma that accomplish the inexhaustible wisdom🔽of the limitless three times are the words of the Dharma that accomplish

original: za ba'i ye shes ni de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes la bya ste /
analyzed: za ba'i ye shes ni de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes la bya ste /
translated: the inexhaustible wisdom of the limitless three times.

original: re ba thams cad rdzogs par byed pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: re ba thams cad rdzogs par byed pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase “fulfilling all hopes” means

original: ye shes rnam par mi rtog kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis sku mi zad pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan la sogs pas khams gsum thams cad du khyab par sems can thams cad dang rjes su mthun par byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes rnam par mi rtog kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis sku mi zad pa'i rdo rje'i rgyan la sogs pas khams gsum thams cad du khyab par sems can thams cad dang rjes su mthun par byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: that, although the nonconceptual gnosis is without thoughts, by the power of its previous aspirations, it acts in accordance with the needs of all sentient beings, pervading the entire three realms with its inexhaustible vajra ornaments and so on.

original: dus gsum mtha' yas pa'i sgo gdon mi za ba'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dus gsum mtha' yas pa'i sgo gdon mi za ba'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase “the inexhaustible gnosis that definitely arises through the door of the infinite three times” means

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa mang po'i sgo nas stong pa nyid du 'jug cing ye shes nges par byed pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa mang po'i sgo nas stong pa nyid du 'jug cing ye shes nges par byed pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: that, through the door of the many kinds of samādhis of the hearers, solitary realizers, bodhisattvas, and so on, one enters into emptiness and ascertains gnosis.

original: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i chos kyi tshig gsungs so zhes pa ni ye shes de nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i chos kyi tshig gsungs so zhes pa ni ye shes de nyid yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The phrase “the words of the Dharma that bring completion” means that this gnosis is the words that bring completion.

original: de yang nam mkha' dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa la sogs te /
analyzed: de yang nam mkha' dri ma med pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa la sogs te /
translated: Moreover, the verses beginning with “in stainless space” and so on,

original: de rnams kyi don chud na ye shes de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi don chud na ye shes de yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: if one understands their meaning, that wisdom will be perfected.

original: de la / nam mkha' dri med ngo bo nyid med pa //
analyzed: de la / nam mkha' dri med ngo bo nyid med pa //
translated: In that regard, “stainless space is essenceless”

analyzed: chos de nyid rnam par dag pa de yang rnam par mi rtog bzhin du /
translated: nonconceptual,

analyzed: ji ltar 'gro ba kun gyi gnas ni nam mkha' yin te mi chags spyod yul ba //

analyzed: de ltar rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid 'di la sogs gsum ma lus skyid 'byung ba'o gsungs pa'o //
translated: Thus, this pure reality is the source of all three, and so on.

analyzed: khams gsum mchog de spyod na ni /

translated: This is saying that those who abide in the ground of Supreme Joy should cultivate this, and the result of that is that one will have the same experiential domain as the buddhas.

original: de las rnyed dka' gzhan med pa ni 'jig rten kun du snang bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de las rnyed dka' gzhan med pa ni 'jig rten kun du snang bar byed pa ste /
translated: There is nothing else more difficult to attain than that, which illuminates the entire world.🔽The pure reality that is taught by the Victorious Ones.

original: rgyal bas gsungs pa rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid do zhes pa ni sangs rgyas pa'i tshe 'thob pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: rgyal bas gsungs pa rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid do zhes pa ni sangs rgyas pa'i tshe 'thob pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: This is the result that is attained when one becomes a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas pa las rnyed par dka' ba gzhan med cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa las rnyed par dka' ba gzhan med cing /
translated: There is nothing else more difficult to attain than buddhahood.

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis khyab par snang bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the wisdom of omniscience pervades and illuminates all world systems.

original: rgyal bas gsungs pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: rgyal bas gsungs pa shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos nyid do //
translated: The Victorious One has taught this utterly pure reality.

original: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i chos nyid rnam par dag pa bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs so zhes pa ni sdud pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bu'i chos nyid rnam par dag pa bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis gsungs so zhes pa ni sdud pa'i tshig go //
translated: This is the summarizing statement: the utterly pure reality of that kind has been taught by the Transcendent Lord Vairocana.

original: der spyod pa rnam par rtog pa spangs te de'o zhes pa ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyis chos de la rnam par rtog pa spong ba ste spyod cig ces pa'o //🔽spangs pa'i chos de zab la 'gong ba med pa'o zhes pa ni chos nyid rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: der spyod pa rnam par rtog pa spangs te de'o zhes pa ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyis chos de la rnam par rtog pa spong ba ste spyod cig ces pa'o // spangs pa'i chos de zab la 'gong ba med pa'o zhes pa ni chos nyid rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: One should practice there, having abandoned conceptual thought.🔽The reality that is abandoned is profound and unobstructed.
That is the utterly pure reality.

original: rgya che zhing mi 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid pas 'gong ba'am 'gog pa med ces pa ste /
analyzed: rgya che zhing mi 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid pas 'gong ba'am 'gog pa med ces pa ste /
translated: It is vast and unchanging, having the characteristic of being completely perfect, so it is said to be unobstructed or unceasing.

original: chos nyid de'i rang bzhin spyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid de'i rang bzhin spyir bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the general teaching on the nature of that reality.

original: 'di lta ste gsang ba'i bdag po 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang po la myos par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rig pa yod do zhes pa nas /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste gsang ba'i bdag po 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang po la myos par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rig pa yod do zhes pa nas / 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, O Lord of Secrets, in the desire realm there is a knowledge called intoxicating the senses.

original: sngags kyis ni me'i tsha ba med par byas nas grang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngags kyis ni me'i tsha ba med par byas nas grang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By mantra, the heat of fire can be made to cease and become cold.

original: rigs kyi bu dpe'i tshul de lta bu las kyang sngags kyi mthu las mngon par dad par bya ba'i rigs so zhes pa'i bar du sngags kyi rgyu dang rang bzhin dang mthu dang 'bras bu bshad de /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dpe'i tshul de lta bu las kyang sngags kyi mthu las mngon par dad par bya ba'i rigs so zhes pa'i bar du sngags kyi rgyu dang rang bzhin dang mthu dang 'bras bu bshad de /
translated: Son of noble family, from such examples, you should understand the power of mantra.

original: rgyu dang rang bzhin ni rtag tu yi ge la sogs pa'i nang du bshad do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rang bzhin ni rtag tu yi ge la sogs pa'i nang du bshad do //
translated: The cause and nature are always explained within the syllables and so forth.

original: thabs 'dir ni sngags kyi mthus bstan pa bshad de /
analyzed: thabs 'dir ni sngags kyi mthus bstan pa bshad de /
translated: Here, in this method, the power of mantra is explained.

original: de yang sgrub ba yid gnyis dang the tshom can las 'og nas 'byung ba'i sngags kyi mthu rnams bstan pas /
analyzed: de yang sgrub ba yid gnyis dang the tshom can las 'og nas 'byung ba'i sngags kyi mthu rnams bstan pas /
translated: Moreover, the power of mantra will be taught below, for one who has doubts and hesitations in practice.

original: gang sgrub pa la the tshom du gyur pa la /
analyzed: gang sgrub pa la the tshom du gyur pa la /
translated: For one who has doubts in practice,

original: grub pa 'thob mi 'thob snyam pa'i the tshom bsal ba dang / de la rab ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang po chen po rig pas lha'i bu rnams rig par 'gyur zhes pa dang / gzugs yod pa'i khams kyi dbang po chen po'i bu la yid mgyogs zhes bya ba'i rigs las byung ba'i mthu dang gnyis ni rab tu bshad do //
analyzed: grub pa 'thob mi 'thob snyam pa'i the tshom bsal ba dang / de la rab ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang po chen po rig pas lha'i bu rnams rig par 'gyur zhes pa dang / gzugs yod pa'i khams kyi dbang po chen po'i bu la yid mgyogs zhes bya ba'i rigs las byung ba'i mthu dang gnyis ni rab tu bshad do //
translated: The best of these is the son of the gods who is known by the power of the great faculties of the desire realm, and the one who is born in the family of the son of the great faculties of the form realm, known as Manovega. These two are explained as the best.

original: dbang po'i mig 'phrul gyi sngags ni spyod pa dang / lha ma yin gyi sngags kyi sgyu ma la sogs pa'i sngags ni mthu 'bring du bshad do //
analyzed: dbang po'i mig 'phrul gyi sngags ni spyod pa dang / lha ma yin gyi sngags kyi sgyu ma la sogs pa'i sngags ni mthu 'bring du bshad do //
translated: The mantra of the eye magic of the faculties, and the mantra of the magic of the asuras, and so on, are explained as middling power.

original: dug dang rims la sogs pa dang / ma mo rnams kyi sngags kyis 'chi bar byed pa dang / me dang tsha ba la sogs pas drang bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni mthu tha mar bshad do //
analyzed: dug dang rims la sogs pa dang / ma mo rnams kyi sngags kyis 'chi bar byed pa dang / me dang tsha ba la sogs pas drang bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni mthu tha mar bshad do //
translated: The mantra of the mātṛs that kills by poison, fever, and so on, and that leads to fire, heat, and so on, is explained as the least power.

original: 'di lta ste gsang ba'i bdag po 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang po la myos par byed pa yod pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste gsang ba'i bdag po 'dod pa'i khams kyi dbang po la myos par byed pa yod pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Thus, O Lord of Secrets, in the desire realm, there is intoxication of the faculties.

original: 'dod pa zhes pa ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / re dang / reg pa rnams spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes pa ni gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / re dang / reg pa rnams spyod pa'o //
translated: Desire means to enjoy forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and textures.

original: khams kyi dbang po la zhes pa ni /🔽'dod pa'i khams kyi gnas rim pa drug gi dbang po la myos par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rim pa yod do zhes pa ni khams der skyes pa rnams rang bzhin gyi rig pa dang ldan pas rig pas rig pa de bsams pa'am brjod pa tsam gyis 'dod
analyzed: khams kyi dbang po la zhes pa ni / 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnas rim pa drug gi dbang po la myos par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rim pa yod do zhes pa ni khams der skyes pa rnams rang bzhin gyi rig pa dang ldan pas rig pas rig pa de bsams pa'am brjod pa tsam gyis 'dod
translated: The line “the faculties of the realm” means🔽that in the six levels of the desire realm there is a level called “intoxication.”

original: pa lnga'i longs spyod dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa lnga'i longs spyod dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those born in that realm are naturally endowed with knowledge. By the power of that knowledge, they can enjoy the five sense pleasures simply by thinking of them or by speaking of them.

original: des 'dod pa na 'khod pa'i lha'i bu rnams myos pas brgyal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des 'dod pa na 'khod pa'i lha'i bu rnams myos pas brgyal bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The line “the sons of the gods in the desire realm become intoxicated and faint” means

original: myos pa zhes pa ni mi dran zhing dbang @161b po mi gsal bar gyur pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: myos pa zhes pa ni mi dran zhing dbang @161b po mi gsal bar gyur pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: that intoxication does not mean that they become unconscious or that their faculties become unclear.

original: rig pa de'i mthus lha'i bu rnams 'dod pa lnga'i longs spyod la chags shing zhen par gyur te /
analyzed: rig pa de'i mthus lha'i bu rnams 'dod pa lnga'i longs spyod la chags shing zhen par gyur te /
translated: By the power of that knowledge, the sons of the gods become attached to and cling to the five sense pleasures.

original: 'dod pa'i dbang du gyur pas na 'dod pas myos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang du gyur pas na 'dod pas myos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they are under the power of desire, they are called “intoxicated with desire.”

original: me tog mang po sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i gnas dga' ba rnams kyang ston zhes pa ni /
analyzed: me tog mang po sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i gnas dga' ba rnams kyang ston zhes pa ni /
translated: “They also show them delightful places with many different kinds of flowers.”

original: de la me tog sna tshogs ni ldum ra dang / me tog gi tshal dang / yid du 'ong ba'i skyed mos tshal dang / me tog dang tshal de dag kyang dri zhim po dang / kha dog shin tu mdzes par brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: de la me tog sna tshogs ni ldum ra dang / me tog gi tshal dang / yid du 'ong ba'i skyed mos tshal dang / me tog dang tshal de dag kyang dri zhim po dang / kha dog shin tu mdzes par brgyan pa'o //
translated: The various flowers are gardens, flower groves, and delightful parks. Those flowers and groves are adorned with beautiful colors and sweet scents.

original: gnas dga' ba ni kun dga' ra ba dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i lding khang la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dga' ba ni kun dga' ra ba dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i lding khang la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: “Delightful places” refers to parks, pavilions adorned with various jewels, and so forth.

original: longs spyod bzang po rnam pa mang po yang mngon par sprul nas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: longs spyod bzang po rnam pa mang po yang mngon par sprul nas zhes pa ni /
translated: “Having emanated many kinds of excellent enjoyments”

original: longs spyod bzang po ni 'dod pa rnam pa lnga'i longs spyod bzang po la bya ste /
analyzed: longs spyod bzang po ni 'dod pa rnam pa lnga'i longs spyod bzang po la bya ste /
translated: “Excellent enjoyments” refers to the excellent enjoyments of the five types of sense objects.

original: kha zas kyi bza' ba dang lha'i gos rab tu bzang zhing 'jam pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: kha zas kyi bza' ba dang lha'i gos rab tu bzang zhing 'jam pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: They are the excellent enjoyments of food and drink, and the excellent, soft divine clothes and so forth.

original: mngon par sprul pa ni gnas de na lha'i bu rnams rang rang gi rig pa'i mthus /
analyzed: mngon par sprul pa ni gnas de na lha'i bu rnams rang rang gi rig pa'i mthus /
translated: Manifestation is that, in that place, the sons of gods by the power of their own knowledge

original: 'dod pa rnam pa lnga'i longs spyod 'byung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnam pa lnga'i longs spyod 'byung bar bya'o //
translated: cause the enjoyment of the five kinds of sense objects to arise.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams la yang sbyin pa dag kyang yongs su spyod do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha rnams la yang sbyin pa dag kyang yongs su spyod do zhes pa ni /
translated: The gods of the heaven of the lord of the magical creations also enjoy the pleasures of giving.

original: de la gzhan 'phrul dbang byed ces pa ni /
analyzed: de la gzhan 'phrul dbang byed ces pa ni /
translated: The heaven of the lord of the magical creations is so called

original: yang rang gi mthu las 'dod pa rnam pa lnga'i longs spyod 'byung ba rnams /
analyzed: yang rang gi mthu las 'dod pa rnam pa lnga'i longs spyod 'byung ba rnams /
translated: because the five kinds of sense objects arise there by the power of the gods themselves.

original: lha'i bu mo rnams la'ang sbyin pa de dag yongs su spyod do //
analyzed: lha'i bu mo rnams la'ang sbyin pa de dag yongs su spyod do //
translated: The gods of that heaven give those pleasures to the goddesses and enjoy them together.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sbyin pa la sogs pa yid bzhin du spyod kyang bdag nyid de la chags par mi spyod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sbyin pa la sogs pa yid bzhin du spyod kyang bdag nyid de la chags par mi spyod do //
translated: In the same way, although bodhisattvas enjoy giving and so forth as they wish, they do not enjoy them with attachment to themselves.

original: 'di lta ste dbang po chen po'i lha'i bu la yid mgyogs zhes bya bar rig pa zhes bya ni rig pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dbang po chen po'i lha'i bu la yid mgyogs zhes bya bar rig pa zhes bya ni rig pa ste /
translated: For example, the son of the great lord of gods is known as Manodeva, which means “mind god.”

original: bsams pa tsam gyis sems can gyi don du bya ba dang / ji ltar 'dod pa'i gnas de dag tu skad cig yud tsam gyis phyin par 'gyur bas na yid mgyogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsams pa tsam gyis sems can gyi don du bya ba dang / ji ltar 'dod pa'i gnas de dag tu skad cig yud tsam gyis phyin par 'gyur bas na yid mgyogs zhes bya'o //
translated: Since one can benefit sentient beings and go to any place one wishes in an instant, it is called “swift mind.”

original: des ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sems can rnams kyi don byed cing zhes pa ni /
analyzed: des ni stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams su sems can rnams kyi don byed cing zhes pa ni /
translated: “ There, one benefits sentient beings in the worlds of the great trichiliocosm” means

original: de la stong gsum gyi stong chen po ni bla dang 'og dang kun la bya ba'ang ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la stong gsum gyi stong chen po ni bla dang 'og dang kun la bya ba'ang ma yin gyi /
translated: that the great trichiliocosm is not above, below, or all around.

original: gzugs yod pa'i khams stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs yod pa'i khams stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams la bya'o //
translated: It refers to the worlds of the great trichiliocosm of the form realm.

original: stong gsum ni gzhung la grags pa'o //
analyzed: stong gsum ni gzhung la grags pa'o //
translated: The great trichiliocosm is well known in the scriptures.

original: sems can gyi don ni gzugs yod pa'i sems can rnams la /
analyzed: sems can gyi don ni gzugs yod pa'i sems can rnams la /
translated: Sentient beings are those with form.

original: rig pa de'i @162a * //
analyzed: rig pa de'i @162a * //
translated: Through the power of that knowledge,

original: mthus 'og nas 'byung ba'i longs spyod la sogs pas sems can rnams kyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: mthus 'og nas 'byung ba'i longs spyod la sogs pas sems can rnams kyi don byed pa'o //
translated: one benefits sentient beings with enjoyments and so on.

original: longs spyod dang zas la sogs pa rnams mngon par sprul nas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: longs spyod dang zas la sogs pa rnams mngon par sprul nas zhes pa ni /
translated: “ Having emanated enjoyments, food, and so on” means🔽that

original: de la khyad par du na /
analyzed: de la khyad par du na /
translated: In particular,

original: kha zas kham gyi bza' ba dang dri la sogs pa mi spyod de /
analyzed: kha zas kham gyi bza' ba dang dri la sogs pa mi spyod de /
translated: he does not enjoy food, such as morsels and smells.

original: longs spyod gzhan ni lhag ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: longs spyod gzhan ni lhag ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The other enjoyments are like the remainder.

original: gtsang ma'i gnas kyi lha'i bu rnams la sbyin pa dag kyang spyod do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gtsang ma'i gnas kyi lha'i bu rnams la sbyin pa dag kyang spyod do zhes pa ni /
translated: He also practices generosity to the sons of the gods of the pure abodes.

original: de las gtsang ma zhes pa ni gzugs kyi khams de na /🔽gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams la yang /
analyzed: de las gtsang ma zhes pa ni gzugs kyi khams de na / gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha rnams la yang /
translated: In that, the pure abodes are the form realm.

original: sbyin bdag rig pa'i mthu las byung ba'i longs spyod la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin bdag rig pa'i mthu las byung ba'i longs spyod la spyod pa'o //
translated: The gods of the pure abodes also enjoy enjoyments that arise from the power of the knowledge of the giver.

original: 'di yan chad ni sngags kyi mthu rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yan chad ni sngags kyi mthu rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: Up to this point, the power of mantra is fully taught.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: dper na mig 'phrul can gyi sngags kyis ni /
analyzed: dper na mig 'phrul can gyi sngags kyis ni /
translated: By the mantra of a magician,🔽many excellent pleasure groves, water, waterfalls, people, and so forth are manifested.

original: kun dga'i ra ba bzang po rnam pa mang po dang / chu dang 'bab chu dang mi la sogs pa mngon par ston to zhes pa ni dbang po'i sngags kyi mthu bshad de /
analyzed: kun dga'i ra ba bzang po rnam pa mang po dang / chu dang 'bab chu dang mi la sogs pa mngon par ston to zhes pa ni dbang po'i sngags kyi mthu bshad de /
translated: This explains the power of the mantra of the sense faculties.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: mig 'phrul can gyi sngags kyis zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mig 'phrul can gyi sngags kyis zhes pa ni /
translated: The mantra of a magician is om namo buddhāya.

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang lha ma yin du 'thab pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang lha ma yin du 'thab pa'i tshe /
translated: When the gods such as Indra fight with the demigods,

original: sngags kyi grangs med pa'i dbang po'i lha rnams su sprul nas /
analyzed: sngags kyi grangs med pa'i dbang po'i lha rnams su sprul nas /
translated: they emanate as countless gods of Indra through the power of mantra.

original: lha ma yin gyi mig bslu ba dang / gang la rgol ba'i gtol med par /
analyzed: lha ma yin gyi mig bslu ba dang / gang la rgol ba'i gtol med par /
translated: They deceive the eyes of the demigods and, without any means of resistance,

original: mig 'phrul gyi mthus byed pa'o //
analyzed: mig 'phrul gyi mthus byed pa'o //
translated: they act through the power of magical illusion.

original: dbang po ni sngags kyi mthu la kun dga'i ra ba bzang po dang / chu dang 'bab chu dang mig la sogs pa sngags kyi mthus mngon par spyod cing ston to //
analyzed: dbang po ni sngags kyi mthu la kun dga'i ra ba bzang po dang / chu dang 'bab chu dang mig la sogs pa sngags kyi mthus mngon par spyod cing ston to //
translated: Indra displays the power of mantra in the excellent pleasure grove, water, waterfalls, eyes, and so on.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: dper na lha ma yin gyi sngags kyis ni sgyu ma mang po ston to zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dper na lha ma yin gyi sngags kyis ni sgyu ma mang po ston to zhes pa ni /
translated: For example, the mantra of the demigods displays many illusions.

original: aa su ra sngags kyi mthus bshad de /
analyzed: aa su ra sngags kyi mthus bshad de /
translated: This is explained through the power of the mantra of Asura.

original: de yang gang zhe na /🔽lha ma yin dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshe lha ma yin gyi sngags kyi mthus /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na / lha ma yin dang dbang po la sogs pa'i tshe lha ma yin gyi sngags kyi mthus /
translated: What is that?🔽When the gods such as Indra fight with the demigods, through the power of the mantra of the demigods,

original: lha ma yin grangs med par sprul pa dang / r'a hu la lta bu'i gzugs lha ma yin gyi gnas nas /
analyzed: lha ma yin grangs med par sprul pa dang / r'a hu la lta bu'i gzugs lha ma yin gyi gnas nas /
translated: they emanate as countless demigods and, like Rahula, from the abode of the demigods,

original: ri rab ri'i rgyal po las 'phags pa'i lus byung ba nas /
analyzed: ri rab ri'i rgyal po las 'phags pa'i lus byung ba nas /
translated: His body is superior to that of Mount Meru, the king of mountains.

original: lha rnams la skrag pa dang mthus byin gyis brlabs pa'i sgyu ma rnams ston pa'o //
analyzed: lha rnams la skrag pa dang mthus byin gyis brlabs pa'i sgyu ma rnams ston pa'o //
translated: He displays the magic of fear and power to the gods.
