original: rtag tu dbang po la sogs pa'i sngags kyi mthu bshad pa dang / lha ma yin gyi sngags kyi mthu bshad pa des 'di gnyis ni mthu 'bring du bshad pa la bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu dbang po la sogs pa'i sngags kyi mthu bshad pa dang / lha ma yin gyi sngags kyi mthu bshad pa des 'di gnyis ni mthu 'bring du bshad pa la bya'o //
translated: The explanation of the power of the mantras of Indra and so forth, and the explanation of the power of the asura mantras, these two are explained as having middling power.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: dper na sngags kyis ni dug dang rims la sogs pa med par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni mi rnams kyi sngags mthu @162b bshad de /
analyzed: dper na sngags kyis ni dug dang rims la sogs pa med par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni mi rnams kyi sngags mthu @162b bshad de /
translated: For example, by mantra, poison, epidemics, and so forth become nonexistent. This explains the power of human mantras.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de sngags de gnyis kyi mthus dug thams cad dang rims la sogs pa'i nad thams cad zhi zhing med par byed pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de sngags de gnyis kyi mthus dug thams cad dang rims la sogs pa'i nad thams cad zhi zhing med par byed pa la bya'o //
translated: By the power of those two mantras, all poisons, all diseases such as epidemics and so forth are pacified and made nonexistent.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: dper na ma zhes bya ba'i lha rnams kyi sngags kyis ni /
analyzed: dper na ma zhes bya ba'i lha rnams kyi sngags kyis ni /
translated: For example, by the mantra of the god called Ma,

original: sems can rnams 'chi bar byed do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams 'chi bar byed do zhes pa ni /
translated: beings are killed.

original: ma bdun po rnams kyi sngags kyi mthu bshad de /
analyzed: ma bdun po rnams kyi sngags kyi mthu bshad de /
translated: The power of the mantras of the seven mothers is explained.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams su 'thob pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i lha rnams dang / lha ma yin rnams su 'thob pa'i tshe /
translated: When the gods such as Indra and the demigods are fighting,

original: lha rnams kyis lha ma yin thub par ma gyur na /
analyzed: lha rnams kyis lha ma yin thub par ma gyur na /
translated: if the gods are not able to defeat the demigods,

original: dbang po dang tshangs pa la sogs pa rang rang las ma zhes bya ba'i lha mo bdun sprul te /
analyzed: dbang po dang tshangs pa la sogs pa rang rang las ma zhes bya ba'i lha mo bdun sprul te /
translated: Indra, Brahma and so on emanate seven goddesses called mothers from their own bodies.

original: lha mo bdun po de rnams kyis mtshon gyis btab pa'i khrag sa la ma lhung bar 'thungs pa dang / gdod lha ma yin rnams zhi bar 'gyur bar yang bya'o //
analyzed: lha mo bdun po de rnams kyis mtshon gyis btab pa'i khrag sa la ma lhung bar 'thungs pa dang / gdod lha ma yin rnams zhi bar 'gyur bar yang bya'o //
translated: Those seven goddesses drink the blood of those struck by weapons without letting it fall to the ground and then the demigods are pacified.

original: bdun gyi sngags de spyod pa'i las rnams byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: bdun gyi sngags de spyod pa'i las rnams byed pa'i tshe /
translated: When one performs the activities of the conduct of the mantra of the seven mothers,

original: ma rnams kyi sngags kyi tshig bzhin byas nas /
analyzed: ma rnams kyi sngags kyi tshig bzhin byas nas /
translated: one should act according to the words of the mantras of the mothers.

original: sems can 'chi bar byed pa dang / lha dang lha ma yin du 'thab pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sems can 'chi bar byed pa dang / lha dang lha ma yin du 'thab pa'i tshe /
translated: When sentient beings are dying and when the gods and demigods are fighting,

original: 'jig rten na sems can rnams dge bar spyod pa mang zhing /
analyzed: 'jig rten na sems can rnams dge bar spyod pa mang zhing /
translated: in the world, sentient beings engage in virtue a great deal.

original: bsod nams che na lha rnams rgyal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: bsod nams che na lha rnams rgyal bar 'gyur /
translated: If the merit is great, the gods will be victorious.

original: dge ba spyad pa nyung zhing mthu chung na lha ma yin rgyal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba spyad pa nyung zhing mthu chung na lha ma yin rgyal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the practice of virtue is small and weak, the demigods will be victorious.

original: de la lha rnams rgyal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de la lha rnams rgyal bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the gods are victorious,

original: gang zla ba dang spyang kis zin pa'i dngos grub kyang thob /
analyzed: gang zla ba dang spyang kis zin pa'i dngos grub kyang thob /
translated: they will obtain the power of the moon and the wolf-grasp.

original: lha ma yin rnams rgyal na sems can gyi khams su sems can rnams bcing bar byed pa'i rims nad rnams kyi sngags kyi mthu las 'byung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: lha ma yin rnams rgyal na sems can gyi khams su sems can rnams bcing bar byed pa'i rims nad rnams kyi sngags kyi mthu las 'byung bar byed pa'o //
translated: If the demigods are victorious, they will cause the plague that binds sentient beings in the realm of sentient beings to arise from the power of the mantra.

original: 'di ltar sngags kyis ni me'i tsha ba med par byas nas grang bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngags kyis ni me'i tsha ba med par byas nas grang bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
translated: Thus, by the mantra, fire is made cold, having removed its heat.

original: sngags kyi mthus me 'bar ba'i nang du zhugs kyang /
analyzed: sngags kyi mthus me 'bar ba'i nang du zhugs kyang /
translated: Thus, by the power of the mantra, even if one enters the blazing fire,

original: tshig pa dang gdung ba la sogs pa med cing chu'i nang du 'gro ba dang 'dra ste grang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig pa dang gdung ba la sogs pa med cing chu'i nang du 'gro ba dang 'dra ste grang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: there is no burning, no scorching, and so on, and it becomes cold, as if one were entering water.

original: rigs kyi bu dpe tshul de lta bu las kyang sngags kyi mthu las mngon par dad par 'gyur ba dang / rigs so zhes pa ni rtag tu mthu rab 'bring rnam pa gsum bstan pa la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dpe tshul de lta bu las kyang sngags kyi mthu las mngon par dad par 'gyur ba dang / rigs so zhes pa ni rtag tu mthu rab 'bring rnam pa gsum bstan pa la /
translated: Son of good family, from this kind of example, one should have faith in the power of mantra, and it is appropriate.

original: gang ma dad pa rnams dad par 'gyur ba dang the tshom dang yid gnyis pa'i 'gro ba rnams the tshom bsal nas sngags kyi mthu la mngon par dad par bya ba'i rigs so zhes bskul ba'o //
analyzed: gang ma dad pa rnams dad par 'gyur ba dang the tshom dang yid gnyis pa'i 'gro ba rnams the tshom bsal nas sngags kyi mthu la mngon par dad par bya ba'i rigs so zhes bskul ba'o //
translated: The phrase it is appropriate is a call to those who are always faithful to the three types of power, whether great, medium, or small, to have faith in the power of mantra, having cleared away doubts and ambivalence.🔽The explanation of the nature of mantra, from The power of that mantra is not arisen from mantra up to one should know that it is always uninterruptedly engaged in the way of mantra, is as follows: What is that?

original: sngags de'i mthu yang sngags las byung ba yang ma yin zhes pa nas /🔽rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sngags kyi tshul gyi rjes @163a * //🔽su 'jug par rig par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du sngags kyi rang bzhin bshad pa la bya ste de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: sngags de'i mthu yang sngags las byung ba yang ma yin zhes pa nas / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sngags kyi tshul gyi rjes @163a * // su 'jug par rig par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du sngags kyi rang bzhin bshad pa la bya ste de yang gang zhe na /
translated: The phrase The power of that mantra is not arisen from mantra means

original: de la sngags kyi mthu yang sngags las byung ba ma yin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la sngags kyi mthu yang sngags las byung ba ma yin zhes pa ni /
translated: that the power of mantra is not arisen from mantra.

original: sngags kyi mthu de sngags kyi yig 'bru las byung ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: sngags kyi mthu de sngags kyi yig 'bru las byung ba yang ma yin /
translated: The power of the mantra does not come from the syllables of the mantra.

original: de ste sngags kyi yig 'bru las sangs rgyas kyi mthu de yod na ni /
analyzed: de ste sngags kyi yig 'bru las sangs rgyas kyi mthu de yod na ni /
translated: If the power of the Buddha were in the syllables of the mantra,

original: sngags kyi glegs bam la sogs pa rkun pos kyang mi thob /
analyzed: sngags kyi glegs bam la sogs pa rkun pos kyang mi thob /
translated: the books of the mantras and so forth would not be stolen by thieves.

original: mes kyang tshig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mes kyang tshig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They would not be burned by fire.

original: de bas na sngags kyi mthu las mthu 'byung ba yang ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: de bas na sngags kyi mthu las mthu 'byung ba yang ma yin no zhes so //
translated: Therefore, the power does not come from the power of the mantra.

original: don la yang zhugs pa ma yin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: don la yang zhugs pa ma yin zhes pa ni /
translated: “ It does not enter into the object” means

original: ral gri dang 'khor lo dang ri lu la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams la ste /
analyzed: ral gri dang 'khor lo dang ri lu la sogs pa'i rdzas rnams la ste /
translated: the substances such as the sword, the wheel, and the pill.

original: rdzas de rnams la sngags kyi mthu zhugs nas grub par 'byung ba yang ma yin zhes so //
analyzed: rdzas de rnams la sngags kyi mthu zhugs nas grub par 'byung ba yang ma yin zhes so //
translated: The power of the mantra does not enter into those substances and arise as the accomplishment.

original: sbyor ba las rnyed pa yang ma yin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba las rnyed pa yang ma yin zhes pa ni /
translated: “ It is not found through application” means

original: sgrub pa la 'byung ba'i sbyor bde gnyis las sngags kyi mthu 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pa la 'byung ba'i sbyor bde gnyis las sngags kyi mthu 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: the power of the mantra does not arise from the application that arises in the practice.

original: de ste sgrub ba la 'jug ba las byung ba yin na grub zin pa yin pas bsgrub mi dgos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ste sgrub ba la 'jug ba las byung ba yin na grub zin pa yin pas bsgrub mi dgos zhes pa'o //
translated: If it is the case that it arises from the practice, then it is already established, so there is no need to establish it.

original: 'on kyang rigs kyi bu dus gsum las 'das pa zab mo bsam gyis mi khyab pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las mngon par grub pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs kyi bu dus gsum las 'das pa zab mo bsam gyis mi khyab pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las mngon par grub pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni /
translated: However, son of noble family, it is because it is established from the profound, inconceivable, dependent origination that transcends the three times.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: It is explained that whether or not the tathāgatas appear in the world,

original: sngags kyi chos nyid ni yong nas 'dug pa'o zhes bshad de /
analyzed: sngags kyi chos nyid ni yong nas 'dug pa'o zhes bshad de /
translated: the reality of mantra has always been present.

original: 'on kyang rigs kyi bu dus gsum las 'das pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang rigs kyi bu dus gsum las 'das pa zhes pa ni /
translated: However, son of noble family, “transcending the three times”

original: dus gsum du snga ma 'das pa'i dus na grub pa'i rang bzhin ma yin na ni /
analyzed: dus gsum du snga ma 'das pa'i dus na grub pa'i rang bzhin ma yin na ni /
translated: means that if it is not the case that the nature of mantra is established in the past,

original: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus na grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus na grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: it will not be established in the future or in the present.

original: de ste ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang da ltar gyi dus na grub pa'i rang bzhin yod na ni snga ma 'das pa'i dus na 'grub par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ste ma 'ongs pa'i dus dang da ltar gyi dus na grub pa'i rang bzhin yod na ni snga ma 'das pa'i dus na 'grub par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the case that the nature of mantra is established in the future and in the present, it will not be established in the past.

original: de bas sngags grub pa'i rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: de bas sngags grub pa'i rang bzhin ni /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the accomplishment of mantra

original: dus gsum gang la yang gnas pa yin pas na dus gsum las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gang la yang gnas pa yin pas na dus gsum las 'das pa'o //
translated: is beyond the three times, because it abides in any of the three times.

original: zab mo bsam gyis mi khyab pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las mngon par gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni ;
analyzed: zab mo bsam gyis mi khyab pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las mngon par gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni ;
translated: Since it is manifest from the profound, inconceivable dependent origination,

original: dper na me tog sna tshogs dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dper na me tog sna tshogs dang 'dra ste /
translated: it is like, for example, various flowers.🔽When the color of the seed, sprout, and leaf become blue, etc.,

original: sa bon dang / myu gu dang lo ma'i che kha dog sngon po la sogs pa gzhan la me tog tu gyur pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sa bon dang / myu gu dang lo ma'i che kha dog sngon po la sogs pa gzhan la me tog tu gyur pa'i tshe /
translated: at the time of the flower, the color changes.

original: kha dog gzhan du gyur pa lta bu dang / ba lta bus rtsva rtsub po dang sngon po la sogs pa zos kyang /
analyzed: kha dog gzhan du gyur pa lta bu dang / ba lta bus rtsva rtsub po dang sngon po la sogs pa zos kyang /
translated: Just as when a cow eats rough, blue grass, etc.,

original: 'o ma 'jam zhing dkar ba'i rang bzhin lta bur @163b gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'o ma 'jam zhing dkar ba'i rang bzhin lta bur @163b gyur pa ste /
translated: the nature of the milk becomes smooth and white.

original: de lta bas na sngags kyi dngos grub ni gang la yang mi gnas mod kyi zab mo bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos nyid rgyu rkyen gcig tshogs pa la sngags kyi chos nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs pa las /
analyzed: de lta bas na sngags kyi dngos grub ni gang la yang mi gnas mod kyi zab mo bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos nyid rgyu rkyen gcig tshogs pa la sngags kyi chos nyid kyis byin gyis brlabs pa las /
translated: Thus, the attainment of mantra does not abide anywhere, but from the blessing of the reality of mantra in the assembly of the causes and conditions of the profound inconceivable reality,

original: grub pa rab 'bring rnam pa gsum la sogs par thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grub pa rab 'bring rnam pa gsum la sogs par thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: the three types of attainment—supreme, middling, and lesser—and so on, are obtained.🔽“ Unchanging” means that because it arises from the reality blessed by mantra,

original: sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos nyid las byung bas na mi 'gyur ba'o zhes pa ni byin gyis rlob pa dang mi 'gyur ba bshad de /
analyzed: sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i chos nyid las byung bas na mi 'gyur ba'o zhes pa ni byin gyis rlob pa dang mi 'gyur ba bshad de /
translated: it is unchanging.

original: de las byin gyis brlabs zhes pa gang grub pa nyid la chos nyid la byin gyis rlob cing /
analyzed: de las byin gyis brlabs zhes pa gang grub pa nyid la chos nyid la byin gyis rlob cing /
translated: “ Blessed” means that the reality of the attainment itself is blessed.

original: grub pa thob pa de yang brtan zhing mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: grub pa thob pa de yang brtan zhing mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The attainment that is obtained is stable and unchanging.

original: de bas na rigs kyi bu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyi rgyun du zhugs pas rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sngags kyi tshul gyi rjes su 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rigs kyi bu bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin gyi rgyun du zhugs pas rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sngags kyi tshul gyi rjes su 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, son of noble family, one who has entered the stream of the inconceivable nature of reality should always and continuously engage in the way of mantra.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das dus gsum la ma chags pa'i stobs kyis gnas kyi byin gyis brlabs pa zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das dus gsum la ma chags pa'i stobs kyis gnas kyi byin gyis brlabs pa zhes pa nas /
translated: Then, the Bhagavān, by the power of not being attached to the three times, blessed the place, and so on, up to🔽the completely perfect Buddha's words being proclaimed from one to another.

original: yang dag par kun rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis tshig gis btab pa gcig nas gcig tu mngon par grags pa'o zhes pa'i bar du byang chub kyi rang bzhin yang lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i dmigs ston pa'i yi ge aa rnam pa bzhi bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa
analyzed: yang dag par kun rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis tshig gis btab pa gcig nas gcig tu mngon par grags pa'o zhes pa'i bar du byang chub kyi rang bzhin yang lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i dmigs ston pa'i yi ge aa rnam pa bzhi bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa
translated: The Bhagavān spoke the four-branched nature of awakening, the four types of the letter A that reveal the object.

original: ste / aa rnam pa bzhi sngar yang bshad de /
analyzed: ste / aa rnam pa bzhi sngar yang bshad de /
translated: The four types of A have been explained before,

original: 'dir yang bzlas te gsungs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir yang bzlas te gsungs pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: but why are they repeated here?

original: sngar bshad pa ni don dam pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur pa'i yi ge 'bru re po spyir bshad pa ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa ni don dam pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur pa'i yi ge 'bru re po spyir bshad pa ste /
translated: The previous explanation was a general explanation of each letter that serves as the door to ultimate samādhi.

original: 'dir yang bzlas te gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir yang bzlas te gsungs pa ni /
translated: The repetition here

original: sngags bsgrub pas de'i don sgom zhing brlab par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngags bsgrub pas de'i don sgom zhing brlab par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: is for the sake of those who practice mantra to meditate on its meaning and bless it.

original: khyad par du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par du gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is taught in particular.

original: de la dus gsum dang ma chags pa'i stobs kyi gnas byin gyis brlabs pa ;
analyzed: de la dus gsum dang ma chags pa'i stobs kyi gnas byin gyis brlabs pa ;
translated: The power of the three times and non-attachment bless the place.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan rnam par dag pa'i snying po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin du zhugs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan rnam par dag pa'i snying po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin du zhugs so //
translated: He entered the samadhi called the essence of the pure adornments of the inconceivable tathagatas.

original: aa zhes pa ni aa rnam pa bzhi po de gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: aa zhes pa ni aa rnam pa bzhi po de gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: The a is because those four kinds of a are taught.

original: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin du zhugs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin du zhugs te /
translated: The Bhagavan entered samadhi.

original: de rnams kyis kyang don dam pa dang kun rdzob gnyis kyis ston te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang don dam pa dang kun rdzob gnyis kyis ston te /
translated: Those also teach by means of the ultimate and the conventional.

original: de la don dam par ston pa ni yi ge aa de'i sgo nas de bzhin nyid ston pa'o //
analyzed: de la don dam par ston pa ni yi ge aa de'i sgo nas de bzhin nyid ston pa'o //
translated: Among them, the teaching of the ultimate is the teaching of suchness by means of the letter a.

original: kun rdzob tu ston pa ni yi ge aa de las skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis 'byung bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ston pa ni yi ge aa de las skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis 'byung bar bstan pa ste /
translated: The teaching of the conventional is the teaching of the arising of the thirty-two marks of a great being from that letter a.

original: gang gi phyir yi ge brgya pa'i le'u las aa 'di rnams las yi ge ka la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis 'phro bar bshad pa @164a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yi ge brgya pa'i le'u las aa 'di rnams las yi ge ka la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis 'phro bar bshad pa @164a * //
translated: Because in the chapter on the hundred-syllable mantra, it explains that the thirty-two letters beginning with ka emanate from those a's.

original: de yi ge sum cu rtsa gnyis po de rnams kyang /
analyzed: de yi ge sum cu rtsa gnyis po de rnams kyang /
translated: Those thirty-two letters

original: skyes bu chen bo'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis su blta'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu chen bo'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis su blta'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: should be seen as the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di las don rnam pa gnyis su ston pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di las don rnam pa gnyis su ston pa'o //
translated: This samadhi teaches two topics.

original: yi ge aa de rnams 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: yi ge aa de rnams 'byung ba ste /
translated: Those letters A arise

original: de la dus gsum du ma chags pa'i stobs kyi gnas zhes pa ni don dam pa de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: de la dus gsum du ma chags pa'i stobs kyi gnas zhes pa ni don dam pa de bzhin nyid de /
translated: . The basis of the power of non-attachment in the three times is ultimate suchness.

original: yi ge aa rnams kyi dmigs bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: yi ge aa rnams kyi dmigs bstan par bya ste /
translated: The object of the letters A should be taught.

original: dus gsum du ma chags pa'i stobs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: dus gsum du ma chags pa'i stobs zhes pa ni /
translated: The power of non-attachment in the three times is

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: the nature of suchness.

original: mi 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid pas nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid pas nam mkha' dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: Because it has the characteristic of unchanging perfection, it is like space.

original: dus gsum du thogs pa med pa'i mthu dang ldan pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum du thogs pa med pa'i mthu dang ldan pa zhes pa'o //
translated: It is said to have the power of unobstructedness in the three times.

original: gnas zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gnas zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The basis is the nature of suchness.

original: yi ge aa'i 'bru byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge aa'i 'bru byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
translated: It is the consecration of the seed syllable A.

original: 'khor ba de'i mtha' ji tsam pa'i bar du yi ge aa rnams su lhag par gnas zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'khor ba de'i mtha' ji tsam pa'i bar du yi ge aa rnams su lhag par gnas zhes pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that the letters A remain for as long as cyclic existence lasts.

original: de ni don dam par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni don dam par bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught in terms of the ultimate.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: The body of the Tathagata is inconceivable.

original: gnas rgyan rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu yi ge aa las skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams 'byung bar bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gnas rgyan rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni kun rdzob tu yi ge aa las skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams 'byung bar bstan pa ste /
translated: The purity of the adornments of the body is taught in terms of the conventional, from the letter A there arises the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: The inconceivable state of the Tathagata is the inconceivable body of the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku las rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku las rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The inconceivability of the Tathagata is because various inconceivable miracles arise from the body of the Tathagata.

original: rgya chen po ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams te /
analyzed: rgya chen po ni skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams te /
translated: The vast is the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: mtshan de rnams kyang yi ge aa 'di bzhi las byung bas na /
analyzed: mtshan de rnams kyang yi ge aa 'di bzhi las byung bas na /
translated: Since those marks arise from these four letters A,

original: rgyan zhes pa ni aa 'di rnams yid la bya'o //
analyzed: rgyan zhes pa ni aa 'di rnams yid la bya'o //
translated: The “ornament” is these a syllables.🔽“Pure” means that those thirty-two marks are located in the nāḍīs, and also in the relative, they are the four purities.

original: rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po de rnams phyogs na gnas pa dang / rtsa la'ang kun rdzob pa na rnam par dag pa bzhes pa'o / snying po zhes pa ni 'byung ba'i gnas zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po de rnams phyogs na gnas pa dang / rtsa la'ang kun rdzob pa na rnam par dag pa bzhes pa'o / snying po zhes pa ni 'byung ba'i gnas zhes pa'i don te /
translated: “Essence” means the “source.”

original: de lta bu'i don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi ston cing 'byung ba'i yi ge aa rnam pa bzhi ting nge 'dzin las byung bas na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i don dam pa dang kun rdzob kyi ston cing 'byung ba'i yi ge aa rnam pa bzhi ting nge 'dzin las byung bas na /
translated: Thus, the four kinds of syllables that indicate the ultimate and relative truths and that arise are the four kinds of a syllables that arise from samādhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin de dus gsum du na ma chags pa'i stobs kyi gnas byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de dus gsum du na ma chags pa'i stobs kyi gnas byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: Since that samādhi is the blessing of the basis of the power of nonattachment in the three times,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam pa'i gnas kyis rgyan rnam pa'i snying po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam pa'i gnas kyis rgyan rnam pa'i snying po zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called “the essence of the aspect of the ornament of the basis of the tathāgatas’ intention.”

original: chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa so sor brjod pa'i sgra las chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa'i stobs yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shin tu @164b mos pa las 'byung ba'i tshig 'di bzhi dbyangs gcig tu 'byung bar gsungs te zhes pa ni /🔽chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa so sor dmigs pa'i sgra zhes pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa so sor brjod pa'i sgra las chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa'i stobs yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shin tu @164b mos pa las 'byung ba'i tshig 'di bzhi dbyangs gcig tu 'byung bar gsungs te zhes pa ni / chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa so sor dmigs pa'i sgra zhes pa ni /
translated: The sound of the expression of the entire dharmadhatu proclaims the four statements of the tathagatas who are the perfect strength of the dharmadhatu, which arise from the words of the one who is extremely devoted.

original: sgra 'byung ba aa 'di bzhi gsungs so zhes pa dang / 'brel te /
analyzed: sgra 'byung ba aa 'di bzhi gsungs so zhes pa dang / 'brel te /
translated: The sound of the expression of the entire dharmadhatu is related to the statement, “The four sounds of the arising of a are proclaimed.”

original: aa 'di bzhi sgra ma skyes par 'byung ba la dmigs pas /
analyzed: aa 'di bzhi sgra ma skyes par 'byung ba la dmigs pas /
translated: Since those four a sounds are observed as the arising of unborn sound,

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi tshig thams cad kyang ma skyes pa'i tshig tu sdug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi tshig thams cad kyang ma skyes pa'i tshig tu sdug par 'gyur te /
translated: all the words of phenomena such as vases and so on are also included in unborn words.

original: de ston pa'i aa bzhi bye brag gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ston pa'i aa bzhi bye brag gsungs pa /
translated: The four a syllables that demonstrate that are proclaimed in particular.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi stobs la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sgo pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi stobs la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sgo pa ste /
translated: The statement, “The one who abides in the strength of the dharmadhatu,” is the door.

original: aa de rnams chos kyi dbyings kyi tshig tu gyur pas na /
analyzed: aa de rnams chos kyi dbyings kyi tshig tu gyur pas na /
translated: Since those a syllables become the words of the dharmadhatu,

original: chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “abiding in the ultimate realm.”

original: stobs zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi tshig las gzhan du mi 'gyur bar mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi tshig las gzhan du mi 'gyur bar mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Power” means that the ultimate realm is powerful, since it does not change into anything else.

original: mi mnyam pa'i stobs zhes pa ni de dag mthu phun sum sogs pa ston ba'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'i stobs zhes pa ni de dag mthu phun sum sogs pa ston ba'o //
translated: “ Unequalled power” shows that it is fully powerful.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shin tu mos pa las byung ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas shin tu mos pa las byung ba zhes pa ni /
translated: “ The perfect Buddha, arisen from intense aspiration” means that

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyu'i tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyu'i tshe /
translated: when the Tathāgata was a cause

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa'i yon tan rnams la ji ltar mos pa mngon par byang chub pa'i tshe yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa de las yi ge aa 'di bzhi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pa'i yon tan rnams la ji ltar mos pa mngon par byang chub pa'i tshe yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa de las yi ge aa 'di bzhi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: he had intense aspirations for the qualities of a perfect Buddha, and when he was enlightened, they were fulfilled.

original: dbyangs gcig tu 'byung zhes pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i so so'i tshig rnams ma skyes pa'i sgra gcig pur 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyangs gcig tu 'byung zhes pa ni bum pa la sogs pa'i so so'i tshig rnams ma skyes pa'i sgra gcig pur 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “ In a single sound” means that the individual words such as “vase” are produced in a single sound of non-production.

original: chos kyi dbyings thams cad khyab par byas nas nam mkha' dang mnyam par gyur nas zhes pa ni ma skyes pa'i sgras chos kyi dbyings thams cad nam mkhas khyab pa dang 'dra bar byas nas zhes pa'am /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings thams cad khyab par byas nas nam mkha' dang mnyam par gyur nas zhes pa ni ma skyes pa'i sgras chos kyi dbyings thams cad nam mkhas khyab pa dang 'dra bar byas nas zhes pa'am /
translated: Having pervaded the entire realm of phenomena, it becomes equal to space.🔽This means that the unborn syllable A pervades the entire realm of phenomena, like space.

original: chos kyi dbyings nam mkha'i mtha' dang mnyam par khyab par byas nas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings nam mkha'i mtha' dang mnyam par khyab par byas nas zhes pa ste /
translated: Or else, it means that the realm of phenomena is pervaded by the unborn syllable A, which is equal to the limits of space.

original: 'di yang chos kyi dbyings zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang chos kyi dbyings zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the realm of phenomena should be understood as the worlds.

original: yi ge aa ni byang chub kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: yi ge aa ni byang chub kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The syllable A is the nature of enlightenment.

original: rnam pa bzhi la ni byang chub kyi yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi la ni byang chub kyi yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It has four aspects, which are endowed with the four aspects of enlightenment.

original: byang chub dang spyod pa dang kun du sangs rgyas pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa rnams rim bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: byang chub dang spyod pa dang kun du sangs rgyas pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa rnams rim bzhin du blta'o //
translated: Enlightenment, conduct, complete buddhahood, and nirvana should be seen in order.

original: de byung ma thag tu chos kyi dbyings grags pa'i sgo las /
analyzed: de byung ma thag tu chos kyi dbyings grags pa'i sgo las /
translated: Immediately after that, from the door of fame in the realm of phenomena,

original: 'di ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshig gis btab pa brjod pa'i skad gcig nas gcig tu grags pa'o zhes bya bya ba ni /🔽snying po de rnams gsungs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyi sgra @165a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi tshig gis btab pa brjod pa'i skad gcig nas gcig tu grags pa'o zhes bya bya ba ni / snying po de rnams gsungs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyi sgra @165a * //
translated: Thus, the sound of the words of the Perfectly Awakened One, spoken from one moment to the next, is proclaimed.

original: las de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig gi mtshan ma ma byung ma skyes pa'i sgra sgrog par byung ngo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: las de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshig gi mtshan ma ma byung ma skyes pa'i sgra sgrog par byung ngo zhes pa'o //
translated: From the sound of the words of the Thus-Gone One, the sound of the non-arising and non-production of the characteristics of the words of the Thus-Gone One resounds.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis thos pa rnams shes pa nas rtag tu nan tan cher bya ba dang / sems can yongs su dag pa'o zhes pa'i bar du de lta bu ma skyes pa'i sgra 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du khyab pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis thos pa rnams shes pa nas rtag tu nan tan cher bya ba dang / sems can yongs su dag pa'o zhes pa'i bar du de lta bu ma skyes pa'i sgra 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du khyab pa /
translated: The sound of the non-arising of the words of the Thus-Gone One, which pervades all world systems, is heard by the bodhisattvas, from the time they first give rise to bodhicitta up to the tenth bodhisattva level.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis thos nas ngo mtshar du gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis thos nas ngo mtshar du gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattvas, having heard it, are amazed.

original: de'i rjes su sngags pa dang bcom ldan 'das la slar gsol ba /
analyzed: de'i rjes su sngags pa dang bcom ldan 'das la slar gsol ba /
translated: After that, the mantra practitioner again supplicates the Blessed One.

original: 'di ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi snying po 'di sgrub pa zhig yod na zhes pa nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi snying po 'di sgrub pa zhig yod na zhes pa nas /
translated: If there is someone who practices this essence of the perfectly accomplished Buddha, up to the signs will appear.

original: mngon rtags byung ba'i bar du 'dug go zhes pa'i bar du sgrub pa'i sngon rol du byang chub sems bskyed par bya ba ste /
analyzed: mngon rtags byung ba'i bar du 'dug go zhes pa'i bar du sgrub pa'i sngon rol du byang chub sems bskyed par bya ba ste /
translated: Up to this point, one should generate the mind of enlightenment prior to practice.

original: de yang gtsug lag khang ngam skyed mos tshal la sogs pa'i gnas ming gis smos pa'am /
analyzed: de yang gtsug lag khang ngam skyed mos tshal la sogs pa'i gnas ming gis smos pa'am /
translated: Moreover, one should stay in a place such as a temple, a pleasure grove, and so on, named by its name,

original: de las gzhan pa'i gnas bdag nyid sems gang du dga' bar 'dug ste sgom mo //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gnas bdag nyid sems gang du dga' bar 'dug ste sgom mo //
translated: or in any other place where one's mind feels comfortable.

original: de skyed mos tshal dang phug ni lus dben par bya ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: de skyed mos tshal dang phug ni lus dben par bya ba'i gnas so //
translated: A pleasure grove and a cave are places for making the body isolated.

original: gtsug lag khang ni sems dben na lus mi dben kyang bla ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang ni sems dben na lus mi dben kyang bla ste /
translated: A temple is not a place for making the body isolated, but it is fine for making the mind isolated.

original: sems dben pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: sems dben pa'i gnas so //
translated: It is a place for making the mind isolated.

original: gang na yid dpen pa der zhes pa ni gnas de dag las gzhan gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: gang na yid dpen pa der zhes pa ni gnas de dag las gzhan gang yang rung ste /
translated: Where the mind is isolated means any of those places or any other suitable place.

original: sems gang du dben pa de gtso bas der 'dug ste /
analyzed: sems gang du dben pa de gtso bas der 'dug ste /
translated: Since the mind is the main thing, one should stay where the mind is isolated.

original: mtshan ma byung ba'i bar du bsgom mo zhes pa dang 'brel te //
analyzed: mtshan ma byung ba'i bar du bsgom mo zhes pa dang 'brel te //
translated: One should meditate until the signs arise.

original: mtshan ma yang skabs 'dir ni nang med pa dang / bru ba mi tsha ba la sogs pa sngags bzlas pa las byung ba la ni mi bya'i /
analyzed: mtshan ma yang skabs 'dir ni nang med pa dang / bru ba mi tsha ba la sogs pa sngags bzlas pa las byung ba la ni mi bya'i /
translated: And the signs here are not to be taken as the absence of hunger, thirst, and so on, which arise from the recitation of the mantra.

original: bsam gtan sems brtan zhing mi 'gyur bar gyur pa la bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan sems brtan zhing mi 'gyur bar gyur pa la bya'o //
translated: Rather, they are to be taken as the stability and immovability of the mind of meditative concentration.

original: de las gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: de las gang yang rung ste /
translated: From among those,

original: snying po tshig gcig zung la zhes pa nas /
analyzed: snying po tshig gcig zung la zhes pa nas /
translated: one should take hold of the essence, a single word,

original: nam mkha' bzhin thog ma nas zhi ba de la zhugs par soms la zhes pa'i bar du /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin thog ma nas zhi ba de la zhugs par soms la zhes pa'i bar du /
translated: and think that one has entered into that which is primordially peaceful like space.

original: gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis byang chub kyi sems goms par byas te /
analyzed: gong du smos pa'i tshul gyis byang chub kyi sems goms par byas te /
translated: In accordance with the above-mentioned method, one should cultivate the thought of awakening,

original: mtshan ma byung nas rang gi lha'i gzugs su sbyar ba goms par bya ba dang / de'i snying gar me long gi dkyil 'khor la sangs rgyas kyi sku bsam pa dang ; sangs rgyas kyi sku'i snying gar yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang bzlas pa'i sngags bsam ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma byung nas rang gi lha'i gzugs su sbyar ba goms par bya ba dang / de'i snying gar me long gi dkyil 'khor la sangs rgyas kyi sku bsam pa dang ; sangs rgyas kyi sku'i snying gar yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang bzlas pa'i sngags bsam ste /
translated: and when the signs arise, one should cultivate the union with the form of one’s deity, and the contemplation of the form of the Buddha in the center of a mirror, and the contemplation of the moon disk and the mantra of the recitation in the heart of the form of the Buddha.

original: de'i rim pa yang 'di'o //
analyzed: de'i rim pa yang 'di'o //
translated: The stages of this are as follows.

original: aa rnam pa bzhi po las gang yang rung ba cig snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsams pa la /
analyzed: aa rnam pa bzhi po las gang yang rung ba cig snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsams pa la /
translated: From among the four types of a, one should visualize at the heart a moon maṇḍala.

original: aa de'i sgra chos thams cad thog ma nas ma skyes pa'o zhes pa la @165b dmigs shing /
analyzed: aa de'i sgra chos thams cad thog ma nas ma skyes pa'o zhes pa la @165b dmigs shing /
translated: Focusing on the sound of that a, “All phenomena are originally unborn,”

original: rang gi phung po lnga thog ma nas ma byung ma skyes pa'i sbyor ba'am /
analyzed: rang gi phung po lnga thog ma nas ma byung ma skyes pa'i sbyor ba'am /
translated: one should meditate on emptiness by way of the application of one’s five aggregates being originally nonarisen and unborn,

original: rdul phran du gzhig pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bas stong pa nyid du gzhig ste /
analyzed: rdul phran du gzhig pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bas stong pa nyid du gzhig ste /
translated: or by the application of destroying them with emptiness by way of destroying them into subtle particles, and so on.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la aa gnas pa tsam 'ba' zhig yod par bsams te /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la aa gnas pa tsam 'ba' zhig yod par bsams te /
translated: One should think that only the a exists on the moon maṇḍala.

original: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang aa nyid kyang gong ma'i tshul gyis dmigs su med par bshig ste /
analyzed: de nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang aa nyid kyang gong ma'i tshul gyis dmigs su med par bshig ste /
translated: Then, the moon maṇḍala and the a itself should be destroyed as before, so that they are not visualized.

original: ji tsam 'dod kyi bar du stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: ji tsam 'dod kyi bar du stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon du bya'o //
translated: One should actualize the samādhi of emptiness for as long as one wishes.

original: de nas snying rje'i dbang gis ting nge 'dzin de las langs te /
analyzed: de nas snying rje'i dbang gis ting nge 'dzin de las langs te /
translated: Then, through the power of compassion, one should arise from that samādhi.

original: sgyu ma lta bur mos pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur mos pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: One should imagine that one is like an illusion.

original: aa de snying ga'i phyogs su bsams nas /
analyzed: aa de snying ga'i phyogs su bsams nas /
translated: Having visualized that A in the region of the heart,

original: aa de las 'od 'phro ba 'byung ba dang / 'dus pa'i sbyor bas rang gi lha'i gzugs su bsgyur bar bya ste /
analyzed: aa de las 'od 'phro ba 'byung ba dang / 'dus pa'i sbyor bas rang gi lha'i gzugs su bsgyur bar bya ste /
translated: one should transform it into one’s deity’s form by the yoga of light rays radiating and reabsorbing.

original: de yang the tshom med par rang gi lha'i gzugs su snang bar gyur gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de yang the tshom med par rang gi lha'i gzugs su snang bar gyur gyi bar du'o //
translated: And that should be done without doubt, until one’s deity’s form appears.

original: de la spyir lha'i gzugs su bsgyur ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la spyir lha'i gzugs su bsgyur ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In that regard, in general, there are three ways of transforming into a deity’s form.

original: gcig ni phyag rgya dang sngags sbyar bas lha'i gzugs de dag go snyam par mos pa tsam mo ;
analyzed: gcig ni phyag rgya dang sngags sbyar bas lha'i gzugs de dag go snyam par mos pa tsam mo ;
translated: One is merely the imagination that one’s deity’s form is the combination of a seal and a mantra.

original: gnyis ni rtag tu goms pa'i dbang gis rang gi lha'i gzugs su the tshom med par gsal bar snang ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis ni rtag tu goms pa'i dbang gis rang gi lha'i gzugs su the tshom med par gsal bar snang ba'o //
translated: The second is the appearance of one’s deity’s form without doubt, due to the power of constant familiarity.

original: gsum ni sbyor ba'i mthus rang gi lus brjes te /
analyzed: gsum ni sbyor ba'i mthus rang gi lus brjes te /
translated: The third is the transformation of one’s body by the power of yoga,

original: lha'i lus su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: lha'i lus su gyur pa ste /
translated: and the arising of one’s deity’s body.

original: de la skabs 'dir rtag tu goms pa'i dbang gis rang gi lus lha'i gzugs su gsal bar snang ba la bya'o //
analyzed: de la skabs 'dir rtag tu goms pa'i dbang gis rang gi lus lha'i gzugs su gsal bar snang ba la bya'o //
translated: In this context, one should understand that the appearance of one’s deity’s form is due to the power of constant familiarity.

original: de ltar rang gi lus lha'i gzugs su bsgyur nas /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi lus lha'i gzugs su bsgyur nas /
translated: Having thus transformed one’s body into a deity’s form,

original: de'i snying po aa gcig bsams te /
analyzed: de'i snying po aa gcig bsams te /
translated: One should imagine a single A in its center.

original: aa de las byang chub kyi sems kyi phyag rgya bsgyur ba zla ba'i dkyil 'khor me long 'dra bar bsams te /
analyzed: aa de las byang chub kyi sems kyi phyag rgya bsgyur ba zla ba'i dkyil 'khor me long 'dra bar bsams te /
translated: From that A, one should imagine the moon mandala, which is the transformation of the seal of the Thought of Enlightenment, like a mirror.

original: de yang shin tu gsal ba dri ma med par bsam /
analyzed: de yang shin tu gsal ba dri ma med par bsam /
translated: Moreover, one should imagine it to be very clear and stainless.

original: de'i dbus su yi ge aa las bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi skur gyur par bsams te /
analyzed: de'i dbus su yi ge aa las bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi skur gyur par bsams te /
translated: In its center, one should imagine the form of the Bhagavat Vairocana arisen from the letter A.

original: de bas na de gsungs pa gnyis po yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de bas na de gsungs pa gnyis po yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the two are the perfect Buddhas.

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su padma'i rgyal po chen po'i steng na /
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su padma'i rgyal po chen po'i steng na /
translated: In the center of the mirror mandala, on top of a great king of lotuses,

original: phug gi nang na ting nge 'dzin du zhugs shing /
analyzed: phug gi nang na ting nge 'dzin du zhugs shing /
translated: like one who is absorbed in contemplation,

original: bzhugs pa bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bzhugs pa bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: residing in a cave, and so on.

original: phug gi nang na bzhugs bzhin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: phug gi nang na bzhugs bzhin zhes pa ni /
translated: Residing in a cave means

original: me long gi dkyil 'khor nang na bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba ltar /
analyzed: me long gi dkyil 'khor nang na bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan snang ba ltar /
translated: that, just as the reflection of a face appears in the center of a mirror,

original: de nyid kyi nang na nye bar 'dug par bsams te zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi nang na nye bar 'dug par bsams te zhes pa'o //
translated: one should imagine him to be seated in its center.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsams te /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsams te /
translated: Then, having visualized a moon disc in the heart of the Tathagata,🔽one should visualize the mantra

original: de'i dbus su bzlas par bya ba'i @166a * //🔽sngags bsams nas /
analyzed: de'i dbus su bzlas par bya ba'i @166a * // sngags bsams nas /
translated: which is to be repeated in the middle of that.

original: de bzlas shing sngon du bsnyen pa 'bum byas te /
analyzed: de bzlas shing sngon du bsnyen pa 'bum byas te /
translated: Repeating that, one should perform the preliminary repetition one hundred thousand times.

original: de bas na gsungs pa thog mar bsnyen to //
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa thog mar bsnyen to //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one should first perform the preliminary repetition.

original: de la chig 'bum tshang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la chig 'bum tshang bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: In that regard, one should complete one hundred thousand.

original: de bas na zla ba gnyis po la me tog spos la sogs pa gsol zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na zla ba gnyis po la me tog spos la sogs pa gsol zhes pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said that one should offer flowers, incense, and so forth for two months.

original: sngar 'bum gcig grangs su bzlas la ;
analyzed: sngar 'bum gcig grangs su bzlas la ;
translated: Having previously recited the mantra one hundred thousand times,

original: de nas zla ba gnyis dang / snga dro dang phyi dro la mel tshe thun re re /
analyzed: de nas zla ba gnyis dang / snga dro dang phyi dro la mel tshe thun re re /
translated: then for two months, one should recite one watch in the morning and one watch in the evening.

original: nyi ma gung la mel tshe thun phyed bzlas pa'i sbyor bas dus chad pa ste /
analyzed: nyi ma gung la mel tshe thun phyed bzlas pa'i sbyor bas dus chad pa ste /
translated: At noon, one should recite half a watch.

original: sngar chig 'bum grangs zlos pa dang zla ba gnyis dus su zlos pa las /
analyzed: sngar chig 'bum grangs zlos pa dang zla ba gnyis dus su zlos pa las /
translated: From the previous recitation of one hundred thousand times and the recitation at the two times,

original: zla ba phyi ma gcig la ni dri dang me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa mi bya bar bzlas te ;
analyzed: zla ba phyi ma gcig la ni dri dang me tog la sogs pa'i mchod pa mi bya bar bzlas te ;
translated: in the following month, one should recite without making offerings of scent, flowers, and so forth.

original: dang po sems ma goms pa la phyi'i mchod pa la sogs pas sems g-yengs su dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po sems ma goms pa la phyi'i mchod pa la sogs pas sems g-yengs su dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, because of the fear of distraction by external offerings, etc.

original: zla ba phyi ma gnyis po la ni goms shing brtan par gyur pas phyi'i mchod pa la sogs pas mi g-yengs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba phyi ma gnyis po la ni goms shing brtan par gyur pas phyi'i mchod pa la sogs pas mi g-yengs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the next two months, because of the stability of the practice, there is no distraction by external offerings, etc.

original: phan par bsgrub par bya ba ni /
analyzed: phan par bsgrub par bya ba ni /
translated: The accomplishment of benefit

original: sems can la ni rnam pa mang du zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sems can la ni rnam pa mang du zhes pa ni /
translated: is for the sake of sentient beings in many ways.

original: da ni dpa' bo chen po'i snying po 'bru rnam pa lnga pa rnams ni bsgrub pa dang sa rnams bshad de /
analyzed: da ni dpa' bo chen po'i snying po 'bru rnam pa lnga pa rnams ni bsgrub pa dang sa rnams bshad de /
translated: Now, the essence of the great hero, the five seed syllables, are explained as the accomplishments and the stages.

original: de la spyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yon tan mos pa spyod pa'i sa nas brtsams te kun du sangs rgyas par gyur gyi bar du ci bsags pa rnams sdud pa'i sgor gyur pa ni /
analyzed: de la spyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yon tan mos pa spyod pa'i sa nas brtsams te kun du sangs rgyas par gyur gyi bar du ci bsags pa rnams sdud pa'i sgor gyur pa ni /
translated: In general, the qualities of the cause and result of the tathāgata, beginning from the stage of devoted conduct up to complete buddhahood, are gathered at the door of the accumulations.🔽The nirvāṇa with remainder and the nirvāṇa without remainder

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: are the result of the accumulations.

original: de las phung po lhag ma med pa ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na /
analyzed: de las phung po lhag ma med pa ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa na /
translated: When one attains nirvana without remainder,🔽

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'du shes pa yang spangs pa 'og ma'i phra mo'i gnas su mngon par byang chub pa'o //🔽phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'du shes pa yang spangs pa 'og ma'i phra mo'i gnas su mngon par byang chub pa'o // phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni /
translated: The essence of the nirvana without remainder is the manifest enlightenment in the abode of the subtle lower stage, which is the abandonment of the perception of the characteristics of the Tathagata.

original: kun du sangs rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid chos rnams sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du nga'i chos rnams ni stong pa'o snyam pa'i 'du shes tsam pa'i bag chags phra mo lhag mar lus pa 'dod pa'i khams su byang chub kyi shing drung du mngon par byang chub nas bdud rnam
analyzed: kun du sangs rgyas pa'i mtshan nyid chos rnams sgyu ma'i rang bzhin du nga'i chos rnams ni stong pa'o snyam pa'i 'du shes tsam pa'i bag chags phra mo lhag mar lus pa 'dod pa'i khams su byang chub kyi shing drung du mngon par byang chub nas bdud rnam
translated: The essence of the nirvana with remainder is the manifest enlightenment in the abode of the subtle higher stage, which is the abandonment of the perception of the characteristics of the complete Buddha, the mere perception that my dharmas are empty, the subtle residual impression that remains.

original: bzhi btul ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi btul ba'o //
translated: Having attained manifest enlightenment in the desire realm at the foot of the Bodhi tree, he subdued the four demons.

original: de la phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i snying po ni /
analyzed: de la phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i snying po ni /
translated: The essence of the nirvana without remainder is the manifest enlightenment in the abode of the subtle lower stage, which is the abandonment of the perception of the characteristics of the Tathagata.

original: aa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: aa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four aspects of a:

original: de rnams kyi sgrub pa la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sgrub pa la sogs pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The accomplishment of those and so on have already been explained.

original: 'dir ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i snying po bdud bzhi 'joms pa'i ting nge 'dzin nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyi @166b sgrub pa dang las rnams 'chad de /
analyzed: 'dir ni phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i snying po bdud bzhi 'joms pa'i ting nge 'dzin nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyi @166b sgrub pa dang las rnams 'chad de /
translated: Here, the essence of nirvana with remainder, the samadhi that conquers the four maras, is explained as the accomplishment and activities of the doors of samadhi.

original: de yang de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad 'khor 'dus pa thams cad la gzigs nas /
analyzed: de yang de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad 'khor 'dus pa thams cad la gzigs nas /
translated: Then, the bhagavat Vairochana, having looked at the entire assembly,

original: phyag na rdo rje gsang ba'i bdag po la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje gsang ba'i bdag po la bka' stsal pa /
translated: spoke to Vajrapani, the lord of secrets:

original: phyag na rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yid las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi yid las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Vajrapani, the mind-born of the tathagatas, and so on.

original: de la yi ge aa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nas bdung bzhi bcom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin de rnams nyid dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhin byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la yi ge aa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo nas bdung bzhi bcom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin de rnams nyid dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor bzhin byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa yang 'di lta ste /
translated: There, the conquest of the four maras through the door of samadhi, such as the samadhi of the syllable a, and the stages of the consecration of those samadhis as the mandala of great power and so on are as follows.

original: yi ge aa ni chos thams cad thog ma nas ma skyes par chud pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mo ston pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge aa ni chos thams cad thog ma nas ma skyes par chud pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mo ston pa ste /
translated: The letter A indicates the door of meditative absorption that causes one to understand that all phenomena are primordially unborn.

original: de'i sgo nas phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams ma skyes par chud de /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i chos rnams ma skyes par chud de /
translated: Through that door, phenomena such as the aggregates, constituents, and sense spheres are understood to be unborn.

original: dmigs su med na phung po'i bdud bcom pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs su med na phung po'i bdud bcom pa'o //
translated: If they are not objectified, the demon of the aggregates is destroyed.

original: yi ge ba ni chos thams cad ngag gi lam dang bral ba ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo ste /
analyzed: yi ge ba ni chos thams cad ngag gi lam dang bral ba ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo ste /
translated: The letter Ba indicates the door of meditative absorption that teaches that all phenomena are free from the path of speech.

original: ngag gi lam ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: ngag gi lam ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The path of speech is discursive thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa med par chud de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med par chud de /
translated: One understands that [phenomena] are free from discursive thought.

original: rnam par mi rtog pas lha'i bu'i bdud bcom mo //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pas lha'i bu'i bdud bcom mo //
translated: Since there is no discursive thought, the demon of the sons of the gods is destroyed.

original: de ltar phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang / de la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med na /
analyzed: de ltar phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams dang / de la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med na /
translated: Thus, if there are no phenomena such as the aggregates and no discursive thoughts that objectify them,

original: de dag la chags par 'gyur ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams med par yi ge ra'i sgo nas mtshon te /
analyzed: de dag la chags par 'gyur ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams med par yi ge ra'i sgo nas mtshon te /
translated: the afflictions such as attachment that would cause one to be attached to them are also absent. This is indicated by the letter Ra.

original: chos thams cad rdul dang 'dra bar chud de /
analyzed: chos thams cad rdul dang 'dra bar chud de /
translated: All phenomena are understood to be like dust.

original: rdul che ba ni nyon mongs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: rdul che ba ni nyon mongs pa la bya ste /
translated: The great particle refers to the afflictions.

original: des nyon mongs pa'i bdud bcom mo //
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa'i bdud bcom mo //
translated: He conquers the demon of the afflictions.

original: yi ge ha ni chos thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bur chud pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo de nyon mongs pa la las dang tshe 'byung ste /
analyzed: yi ge ha ni chos thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bur chud pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo de nyon mongs pa la las dang tshe 'byung ste /
translated: The syllable ha is the door of meditative stabilization that comprehends all phenomena as cause and effect.

original: nyon mongs pa la las dang tshe yang mi 'byung /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la las dang tshe yang mi 'byung /
translated: When the afflictions are comprehended, karma and life do not arise.

original: tshe ma byung na 'chi bar mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: tshe ma byung na 'chi bar mi 'byung ste /
translated: When life does not arise, death does not arise.

original: de ltar chud pas 'chi ba'i bdud bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar chud pas 'chi ba'i bdud bcom pa'o //
translated: Comprehending in that way, he conquers the demon of death.

original: de ltar chos rnams thog ma nas ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du chud pa'i sgo ni yi ge la ste /
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams thog ma nas ma skyes pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du chud pa'i sgo ni yi ge la ste /
translated: In that way, the door of comprehending phenomena as the nature of emptiness through the mode of being primordially unborn and so on is the syllable.

original: chos thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad nam mkha' dang 'dra'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: It is taught that all phenomena are like space.

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin de rnams la kun rdzob tu yang yi ge aa la sogs pa re re las dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du yang spyar te /
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin de rnams la kun rdzob tu yang yi ge aa la sogs pa re re las dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du yang spyar te /
translated: In that way, those meditative stabilizations are also applied to the maṇḍala of great maṇḍala and so on from each of the syllables such as a and so on, even conventionally.

original: yi ge aa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'i bdud bcom ste /
analyzed: yi ge aa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'i bdud bcom ste /
translated: The demon of the aggregate of meditative concentration, which enters through the door of the letter A, is conquered.

original: phung po ni sra zhing khur khyer nus pa'o //
analyzed: phung po ni sra zhing khur khyer nus pa'o //
translated: The aggregate is hard and able to carry a load.

original: de bzhin du de'i rjes mthun par yi ge aa de las /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rjes mthun par yi ge aa de las /
translated: Similarly, in accordance with that, from that letter A

original: sa'i dkyil 'khor du gyur te /
analyzed: sa'i dkyil 'khor du gyur te /
translated: the circle of earth is formed.

original: sa yang sra zhing @167a * //
analyzed: sa yang sra zhing @167a * //
translated: Earth is hard and

original: khur khyer bzod pa'o //
analyzed: khur khyer bzod pa'o //
translated: able to bear a load.

original: yi ge pa las rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur te /
analyzed: yi ge pa las rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor gyur te /
translated: From the letter Pa, the door of meditative concentration free from discursive thought is formed.

original: de ni rtog pa la sogs pa'i dri ma dag par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rtog pa la sogs pa'i dri ma dag par byed pa'o //
translated: That purifies the stains of discursive thought and so forth.

original: de bzhin du yi ge ba las chu'i dkyil 'khor du gyur pa'am de'i rjes su mthun pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge ba las chu'i dkyil 'khor du gyur pa'am de'i rjes su mthun pa ste /
translated: Similarly, from the letter Ba, the circle of water is formed or is in accordance with that.

original: me ni thams cad sreg cing med par byed pa'o //
analyzed: me ni thams cad sreg cing med par byed pa'o //
translated: Fire burns everything and makes it disappear.

original: yi ge ra las chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin du gyur te /
analyzed: yi ge ra las chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin du gyur te /
translated: From the letter Ra, the meditative concentration free from the dust of all phenomena is formed.

original: de bzhin du yi ge ha las rlung gi dkyil 'khor du gyur pa yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge ha las rlung gi dkyil 'khor du gyur pa yang /
translated: Similarly, from the letter Ha, the circle of wind is formed.

original: de'i rjes su mthun pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su mthun pa ste /
translated: That is in accordance with that.

original: rlung ni thams cad du 'thor ba'am 'jig par byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rlung ni thams cad du 'thor ba'am 'jig par byed pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Wind is the nature of scattering or destroying everything.

original: yi ge kha las chos thams cad stong pa nam mkha'i rang bzhin du chud pa'i ting nge 'dzin du gyur te /
analyzed: yi ge kha las chos thams cad stong pa nam mkha'i rang bzhin du chud pa'i ting nge 'dzin du gyur te /
translated: From the letter kha, all phenomena are included in the nature of space, becoming the meditative concentration of emptiness.

original: de bzhin du yi ge kha las nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor du gyur pa dang nam mkha'i rang bzhin du mthun te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge kha las nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor du gyur pa dang nam mkha'i rang bzhin du mthun te /
translated: Likewise, from the letter kha, the maṇḍala becomes space, and the nature of space is unified.

original: de dag ni spyi'i don to //
analyzed: de dag ni spyi'i don to //
translated: Those are the general meanings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yid las byung //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yid las byung //
translated: Arisen from the mind of the tathāgatas

original: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes las 'byung zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid kyi ye shes las 'byung zhes pa ste /
translated: means arisen from the gnosis of suchness.

original: aa la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid de dag nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: aa la sogs pa'i stong pa nyid de dag nyid la bya'o //
translated: That should be applied to the emptiness of the vowels and so on.🔽The play of karma and action

original: las dang bya ba rnam par rol pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa rab la sogs pa dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams byed pa'o //
analyzed: las dang bya ba rnam par rol pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa rab la sogs pa dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams byed pa'o //
translated: means performing the activities of pacifying and so on.🔽Conduct is play

original: spyod pa ni rol mo zhes pa ni rol mo mkhan dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: spyod pa ni rol mo zhes pa ni rol mo mkhan dang 'dra ste /
translated: means like a musician.

original: rol mo mkhan gyi gar la sogs pa'i rol mo sna tshogs ston te /
analyzed: rol mo mkhan gyi gar la sogs pa'i rol mo sna tshogs ston te /
translated: A musician displays various plays, such as dancing.

original: de bzhin du snying po 'di rnams kyang grub pa dang las sna tshogs ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du snying po 'di rnams kyang grub pa dang las sna tshogs ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Likewise, these quintessences are taught to be the various accomplishments and activities.

original: khams bzhi 'dus pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: khams bzhi 'dus pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase “the gathering of the four elements”

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams kyi dkyil 'khor rnams snying po 'di rnams las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi khams kyi dkyil 'khor rnams snying po 'di rnams las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: means that the maṇḍalas of the earth, water, fire, and wind elements arise from these quintessences.

original: nam mkha' dang 'dra bar khyab par shes pa ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang 'dra bar khyab par shes pa ni /
translated: The statement “they should be known to pervade like space”

original: 'di ltar nam mkha' thams cad du khyab pa de bzhin du snying po de rnams kyis kyang thams cad du khyab pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha' thams cad du khyab pa de bzhin du snying po de rnams kyis kyang thams cad du khyab pa ste /
translated: means that just as space pervades everything, so too do these quintessences pervade everything.

original: de dag ni snying po de rnams kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni snying po de rnams kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the nature of the quintessences.

original: snang ba dang ni mi snang ba'i 'bras bu'i gtso zhes pa ni mthu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: snang ba dang ni mi snang ba'i 'bras bu'i gtso zhes pa ni mthu bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase “the principal result, visible and invisible” teaches their power.

original: snang ba ni rig 'dzin la sogs pa'i mngon sum du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba ni rig 'dzin la sogs pa'i mngon sum du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The visible result is the direct experience of the vidyādhara and so on.

original: mi snang ba ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i 'bras bu re zhig nas thob pa ste /
analyzed: mi snang ba ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i 'bras bu re zhig nas thob pa ste /
translated: The invisible result is the attainment of the result of buddhahood and so on after some time.

original: de lta bu mchog gi sbyin pa byed pa zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu mchog gi sbyin pa byed pa zhes pa'o //
translated: Such is the performance of the supreme generosity.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi mngon sum du gyur zhes pa ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi mngon sum du gyur zhes pa ni /
translated: In the presence of all the Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas, and Bodhisattvas,

original: de dag gi spyod yul du gyur pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi spyod yul du gyur pa zhes pa ste /
translated: means that they are the domain of experience of those.

original: nyan thos rnams kyang sa ma lus pa dang chu ma lus pa la sogs pa'i ting @167b nge 'dzin mngon du byed de /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyang sa ma lus pa dang chu ma lus pa la sogs pa'i ting @167b nge 'dzin mngon du byed de /
translated: The Sravakas also actualize the samadhis of all the earth, all the water, and so forth.

original: de yang dkyil 'khor de dag gi rang bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang dkyil 'khor de dag gi rang bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is because those mandalas are their nature.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang sa gzhi thams cad rin po che la sogs pas bkang ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang sa gzhi thams cad rin po che la sogs pas bkang ste /
translated: The Bodhisattvas also fill the entire earth with jewels and so forth,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byed pa la sogs pa yang dkyil 'khor 'di dag gi rang bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa byed pa la sogs pa yang dkyil 'khor 'di dag gi rang bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and make offerings to the Tathagatas and so forth. And that is because those mandalas are their nature.

original: sngags kyi sgor byang chub sems dpa' spyad pa spyod pa rnams re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes pa ni bstan pa 'di la zhugs pa rnams grub pa la sogs pa 'thob pa'i sgo nas re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro
analyzed: sngags kyi sgor byang chub sems dpa' spyad pa spyod pa rnams re ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes pa ni bstan pa 'di la zhugs pa rnams grub pa la sogs pa 'thob pa'i sgo nas re ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro
translated: The gateway of mantra is called the fulfiller of all hopes for those bodhisattvas who practice, because it fulfills all hopes by attaining accomplishments and so forth.

original: // sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs zhes pa ni bstan pa 'dir zhugs pa dang ma zhugs pa gnyis ka sems can la phan 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: // sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs zhes pa ni bstan pa 'dir zhugs pa dang ma zhugs pa gnyis ka sems can la phan 'dogs pa ste /
translated: Benefiting all sentient beings means benefiting both those who have entered this teaching and those who have not.

original: las du ma dang ldan pa ni gdon dang dug la sogs pa sel ba'i las sna tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: las du ma dang ldan pa ni gdon dang dug la sogs pa sel ba'i las sna tshogs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessing many activities means possessing various activities such as dispelling harm, poison, and so forth.

original: phyag na rdo rje spyod pa'i rol mo las bya ba mngon par 'byung ba 'bras bu'i gtso bo sems can kun gyi mngon sum pa de gang zhe na ;
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje spyod pa'i rol mo las bya ba mngon par 'byung ba 'bras bu'i gtso bo sems can kun gyi mngon sum pa de gang zhe na ;
translated: What is the principal result of Vajrapāṇi's play, which is directly perceived by all sentient beings?

original: gong du smos pa de dag nyid dang dngos su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong du smos pa de dag nyid dang dngos su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is those very things mentioned above, and it is directly taught. Therefore, it is said what is it?

original: gang zhe na zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhe na zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: What is it? is stated.

original: chog shes pas thog mar byas pa ni /
analyzed: chog shes pas thog mar byas pa ni /
translated: Having first made contentment,

original: bdag gi de nyid rim bzhin du'o //
analyzed: bdag gi de nyid rim bzhin du'o //
translated: one should do one's own reality in stages.

original: zhes pa nas ci smos /
analyzed: zhes pa nas ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention

original: de ni bdag nyid kyis /
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid kyis /
translated: that one should transform oneself

original: rgyal ba mchog tu bsgyur na'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba mchog tu bsgyur na'o //
translated: into the supreme Victor?

original: zhes pa'i bar du sngags pas bdag gi de kho na nyid sbyar ba dang / de'i rjes su sngags pa 'chad de /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du sngags pas bdag gi de kho na nyid sbyar ba dang / de'i rjes su sngags pa 'chad de /
translated: Up to here, the mantra practitioner should apply one's own reality, and after that, the mantra practitioner is explained.

original: sngags pas bdag gi de kho na nyid sbyor ba sngon du byas te /
analyzed: sngags pas bdag gi de kho na nyid sbyor ba sngon du byas te /
translated: Having first applied one's own reality,

original: de nas sngags kyi yi ge rnams lus la so so'i gnas su bkod de /
analyzed: de nas sngags kyi yi ge rnams lus la so so'i gnas su bkod de /
translated: the mantra practitioner should arrange the mantra syllables in their respective places on the body,

original: dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la sogs par bsgyur nas /
analyzed: dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la sogs par bsgyur nas /
translated: transforming them into the maṇḍala of great dominion, and so on,

original: de dag gi bsgrub pa dang las la sogs pa la 'jug go//
analyzed: de dag gi bsgrub pa dang las la sogs pa la 'jug go//
translated: and then engage in their practice, activities, and so forth.

original: rim pa de lta bur 'jug pa yang sngon sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams thog ma nas ma skyes pa stong pa'i rang bzhin du mngon par byang chub pa nas /
analyzed: rim pa de lta bur 'jug pa yang sngon sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos rnams thog ma nas ma skyes pa stong pa'i rang bzhin du mngon par byang chub pa nas /
translated: This is the sequence of engagement. Moreover, the former buddhas, the transcendent conquerors, manifestly awakened to the nature of phenomena, which are primordially unborn and empty.

original: de'i 'og tu sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis sku mi zad pa la sogs pa'i rgyan rnams kun rdzob kyi tshul du 'jig rten thams cad du khyab par ston te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyis sku mi zad pa la sogs pa'i rgyan rnams kun rdzob kyi tshul du 'jig rten thams cad du khyab par ston te /
translated: Then, by the power of former aspirations, the inexhaustible body and so forth are displayed in all worlds in the manner of conventional reality.

original: de bas na sngags pas kyang bdag gi de kho na nyid stong par dmigs pa sngon du byas te /
analyzed: de bas na sngags pas kyang bdag gi de kho na nyid stong par dmigs pa sngon du byas te /
translated: Therefore, the mantrin also, having previously visualized one's reality as empty,

original: yi ge dgod pa dang bzlas pa la sogs pa phyis bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge dgod pa dang bzlas pa la sogs pa phyis bya'o //
translated: should later arrange the syllables, recite, and so forth.

original: de la chog shes par thog mar byas pa ni bdag gi de nyid rim bzhin no zhes pa nas de'i sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag gi de nyid bar gsungs zhes pa'i bar du @168a * //🔽bdag gi de nyid sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: de la chog shes par thog mar byas pa ni bdag gi de nyid rim bzhin no zhes pa nas de'i sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag gi de nyid bar gsungs zhes pa'i bar du @168a * // bdag gi de nyid sbyor ba ste /
translated: Therein, the application of one's reality is from firstly, one should be content up to the reality of one's self of all buddhas.🔽The application of one's reality

original: bdag gi de bzhin nyid ces pa ni /
analyzed: bdag gi de bzhin nyid ces pa ni /
translated: is the reality of one's self.

original: sngags mkhan rang gi snying po yang /
analyzed: sngags mkhan rang gi snying po yang /
translated: The mantra practitioner's own essence

original: yi ge aa'i sgo nas thog ma nas ma byung ma skyes par stong par bshigs te /
analyzed: yi ge aa'i sgo nas thog ma nas ma byung ma skyes par stong par bshigs te /
translated: is also from the perspective of the syllable A, destroyed as empty, not arisen from the beginning, not produced.

original: de bas na aa las dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor kha dog shin tu ser zhing lci ba bsams te /
analyzed: de bas na aa las dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor kha dog shin tu ser zhing lci ba bsams te /
translated: Therefore, one should imagine the mandala of great power from A, very yellow in color and heavy.

original: de'i steng na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs te /
analyzed: de'i steng na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs te /
translated: The Blessed Buddha resides on that.

original: de lta bur bdag nyid kyi lus la bsams te /
analyzed: de lta bur bdag nyid kyi lus la bsams te /
translated: One should imagine one's own body in that way.

original: de bas na gsungs pa chog shes pas thog mar bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa chog shes pas thog mar bya'o zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said, One should begin with contentment.

original: bdag gi de nyid rim bzhin du'o //
analyzed: bdag gi de nyid rim bzhin du'o //
translated: One's own reality in stages.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa bzhin byas shing /
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa bzhin byas shing /
translated: This is done like the cultivation of bodhicitta.
