original: lha'i gzugs su bsgrub pa la sogs pa'i las rim pa bzhin du bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i gzugs su bsgrub pa la sogs pa'i las rim pa bzhin du bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One should perform the stages of the rites such as accomplishing the deity's form in stages.

original: sngags mkhan 'dug nas snga ma bzhin du zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sngags mkhan 'dug nas snga ma bzhin du zhes pa ni /
translated: The mantra practitioner, sitting as before,

original: gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bshad pa'i rim pa bzhin du 'dug nas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gong du de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bshad pa'i rim pa bzhin du 'dug nas zhes pa'o //
translated: means sitting as explained in the stages of explaining the essence of the Tathagata above.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dran par bya //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dran par bya //
translated: One should recollect the Tathagata.

original: zhes pa ni slob pa la sogs pa'i las rnams bya na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni slob pa la sogs pa'i las rnams bya na /
translated: This means that when performing the rites such as for a disciple,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mdun du bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mdun du bsam par bya ste /
translated: one should imagine the Tathagata in front.

original: sngags dag rig pa la sogs pa dmigs pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngags dag rig pa la sogs pa dmigs pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mantras, the awarenesses, etc., are the objects of observation.

original: gnyis su na de bzhin gshegs pa mdun du bsams nas bgegs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su na de bzhin gshegs pa mdun du bsams nas bgegs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Alternately, having imagined the Tathāgata in front, [the mandala] is without obstruction.

original: bdag nyid aa ru bya ba ni 'khor ba dang bcas brgyas par te zhes pa'i bdag nyid yi ge aa las stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du bsams te /
analyzed: bdag nyid aa ru bya ba ni 'khor ba dang bcas brgyas par te zhes pa'i bdag nyid yi ge aa las stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du bsams te /
translated: The self is made into a, which is the nature of emptiness, from the letter a, having imagined it as the nature of emptiness.

original: klad kor gyis ni 'dzin par byed pa'i ye shes kyang stong pa nyid du ston pa ste /
analyzed: klad kor gyis ni 'dzin par byed pa'i ye shes kyang stong pa nyid du ston pa ste /
translated: The zero shows that the apprehending awareness is also emptiness.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med par stong pa'i rang bzhin du bsgyur bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa med par stong pa'i rang bzhin du bsgyur bar bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One should transform into the nature of emptiness, which is without apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: thams cad kha dog ser zhing bzang //
analyzed: thams cad kha dog ser zhing bzang //
translated: Everything is yellow and good,

original: grva bzhi la ni rdo rjes mtshan //
analyzed: grva bzhi la ni rdo rjes mtshan //
translated: marked with vajras in the four corners.

original: zhes pa ni stong pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa de las /
analyzed: zhes pa ni stong pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa de las /
translated: This is the transformation into the nature of emptiness.

original: dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gru bzhi kha dog shin tu ser ba rdo rje'i mtshan ma btab pa bsam mo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor gru bzhi kha dog shin tu ser ba rdo rje'i mtshan ma btab pa bsam mo zhes pa'o //
translated: From that, one should imagine the square maṇḍala of the great lord, very yellow in color, marked with vajra signs.

original: sngags pa der 'dug bsam pa ni //
analyzed: sngags pa der 'dug bsam pa ni //
translated: The mantra practitioner should think,

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyi gtso //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kun gyi gtso //
translated: “The chief of all the perfect Buddhas.”

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor de'i steng na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi skur bsams te //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor de'i steng na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi skur bsams te //
translated: This means that one should imagine the Bhagavat Vairocana in the form of a body in the center of the maṇḍala.

original: de yang bdag gi lus nyid de ltar bsam par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang bdag gi lus nyid de ltar bsam par shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should understand that one’s own body is imagined in that way.

original: nam zhig sngags pa de the tshom //
analyzed: nam zhig sngags pa de the tshom //
translated: When the mantra practitioner

original: med bdag nyid yang dag 'gyur na //
analyzed: med bdag nyid yang dag 'gyur na //
translated: becomes free of doubt,

original: zhes pa ni bdag gi de kho na nyid stong par dmigs pa dang / lha'i gzugs su gsal bar snang @168b ba the tshom med par gyur nas zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni bdag gi de kho na nyid stong par dmigs pa dang / lha'i gzugs su gsal bar snang @168b ba the tshom med par gyur nas zhes pa ste /
translated: This means that when one becomes free of doubt regarding the perception of one’s own reality as empty and the appearance of the deity’s form as clear,

original: stong pa nyid du the tshom med par gyur pa yang ting nge 'dzin dag pa dang / ji bzhin pa dang bral ba dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad spang ba na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du the tshom med par gyur pa yang ting nge 'dzin dag pa dang / ji bzhin pa dang bral ba dang / rnam par rtog pa thams cad spang ba na /
translated: one becomes free of doubt regarding emptiness. When the purity of samādhi, the absence of just what is, and the abandonment of all conceptual thoughts are

original: ji lta ba nyid du the tshom med pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba nyid du the tshom med pa'o //
translated: free of doubt regarding the way things are.

original: lha'i gzugs su gsal ba the tshom med pa yang /
analyzed: lha'i gzugs su gsal ba the tshom med pa yang /
translated: One becomes free of doubt regarding the clear appearance of the deity’s form.

original: ting nge 'dzin lha'i gzugs su kun du gsal ba dang / rnam par spang ba ni ji bzhin pa nyid du the tshom med ba zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin lha'i gzugs su kun du gsal ba dang / rnam par spang ba ni ji bzhin pa nyid du the tshom med ba zhes pa ste /
translated: The manifestation of the deity’s form in samādhi, and the abandonment, which is the absence of doubt about reality,

original: nam zhig sngags pa rab tu mos pa'i sems kyis byed par gyur na /
analyzed: nam zhig sngags pa rab tu mos pa'i sems kyis byed par gyur na /
translated: are the two things that the mantrin should accomplish with a mind of devotion.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i rjes su sangs ba rnams thob ste /
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i rjes su sangs ba rnams thob ste /
translated: When he does so, he will obtain the following qualities that will be described below.

original: 'on kyang 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten pa kun la phan par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten pa kun la phan par byed pa ste /
translated: However, he will benefit all the worldly beings who are subject to change.

original: zhes pa ni grub pa la sogs pa thob pa'i sgo nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni grub pa la sogs pa thob pa'i sgo nas /
translated: This means that, by attaining powers and so forth,

original: sems can rnams la phan gdags nus te /
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan gdags nus te /
translated: he will be able to benefit sentient beings.

original: de ni pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of the welfare of others.

original: ngo mtshar mang po dang yang ldan //
analyzed: ngo mtshar mang po dang yang ldan //
translated: He will also possess many wonders,🔽and will dwell in the abode of magical illusions.

original: mig 'phrul rnams kyi gnas na 'dug / ces pa ni rig 'dzin la sogs pa'i grub pa thob nas /
analyzed: mig 'phrul rnams kyi gnas na 'dug / ces pa ni rig 'dzin la sogs pa'i grub pa thob nas /
translated: Having attained powers such as the vidyādhara,

original: mig 'phrul mkhan dang 'dra bar rdzu 'phrul ngo mtshar sna tshogs rnams byed nus par 'gyur zhes pa ste mthu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mig 'phrul mkhan dang 'dra bar rdzu 'phrul ngo mtshar sna tshogs rnams byed nus par 'gyur zhes pa ste mthu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: he will be able to perform various wondrous miracles, like a magician. This is the perfection of power.

original: thog ma med nas bsags pa ni //
analyzed: thog ma med nas bsags pa ni //
translated: “Those accumulated since beginningless time,

original: ma rig sogs pas dog pa rnams //
analyzed: ma rig sogs pas dog pa rnams //
translated: those bound by ignorance and so forth,

original: de dag thams cad 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'byung ba ni //
translated: all of them arise

original: sngags pa nam zhig snyoms thub na'o //
analyzed: sngags pa nam zhig snyoms thub na'o //
translated: when the mantrin is able to enter into union.

original: zhes pa ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas ma rig pa'i dbang gis 'khor ba dog pa na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas ma rig pa'i dbang gis 'khor ba dog pa na /
translated: This means that when one is bound in saṃsāra by the power of ignorance since beginningless time,

original: mi dge ba dang nyon mongs pa'i las bsags pa sbyor ba de lta bu la snyoms par thub na /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang nyon mongs pa'i las bsags pa sbyor ba de lta bu la snyoms par thub na /
translated: if one is able to enter into union with such a practice,

original: de dag thams cad byang bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad byang bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ste /
translated: all of those are purified.

original: de ni spong ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni spong ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the perfection of abandonment.

original: nam zhig sems ni bsgom bya ba //
analyzed: nam zhig sems ni bsgom bya ba //
translated: When the mind is cultivated,

original: bla na med pa'i byang chub sems //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i byang chub sems //
translated: the unsurpassed mind of enlightenment,

original: de nas sngags pa las rnams ni //
analyzed: de nas sngags pa las rnams ni //
translated: then the mantrin’s

original: dge dang mi dge las byung ba'i //
analyzed: dge dang mi dge las byung ba'i //
translated: actions, whether virtuous or nonvirtuous,

original: sbyor ba rtag tu mi gos pa //
analyzed: sbyor ba rtag tu mi gos pa //
translated: arise from the practice, but the mantrin is never tainted,

original: padmo chus mi chags dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: padmo chus mi chags dang 'dra'o //
translated: like a lotus that is not attached to water.

original: zhes pa ste byang chub kyi sems te stong pa'i mtshan nyid pas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dngos po rnams kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ste byang chub kyi sems te stong pa'i mtshan nyid pas dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dngos po rnams kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the thought of enlightenment, which is the antidote to the substantial results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, because it is characterized by emptiness.

original: de la mi dge ba'i 'bras bu mi gos pa ni rigs na dge ba'i 'bras bu mi gos na /
analyzed: de la mi dge ba'i 'bras bu mi gos pa ni rigs na dge ba'i 'bras bu mi gos na /
translated: If the result of nonvirtue does not stain, then it is reasonable that the result of virtue also does not stain.

original: tshul khrims bsrung ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yang med dam zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrung ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yang med dam zhe na /
translated: But then, is there no result of observing morality and so on?

original: byang chub kyi sems ni stong pa'i rang bzhin pas /🔽de ba dag dmigs su med par 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni stong pa'i rang bzhin pas / de ba dag dmigs su med par 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: The thought of enlightenment is empty by nature.

original: de las @169a * //
analyzed: de las @169a * //
translated: Therefore, the virtuous and nonvirtuous actions that are its objects are not found.

original: langs nas phyis sbyor ba bdag 'tshang rgya ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i lus dang / longs spyod la sogs pa dang ldan par shog cig ces smon lam 'debs pas dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu'i bag chags slar lta bar 'gyur ro //🔽ci smos de ni bdag nyid kyis /
analyzed: langs nas phyis sbyor ba bdag 'tshang rgya ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i lus dang / longs spyod la sogs pa dang ldan par shog cig ces smon lam 'debs pas dge ba'i las kyi 'bras bu'i bag chags slar lta bar 'gyur ro // ci smos de ni bdag nyid kyis /
translated: But when one rises from that, one makes the aspiration prayer, “Later, may I be endowed with a body, resources, and so on that are the causes of my own enlightenment.” Thus, the habitual tendencies of the results of virtuous actions are again taken up.🔽What need is there to mention that when one transforms

original: rgyal pa mchog tu bsgyur na'o //
analyzed: rgyal pa mchog tu bsgyur na'o //
translated: oneself into the supreme Victor?

original: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems 'ba' zhig bsgoms pas kyang /
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub kyi sems 'ba' zhig bsgoms pas kyang /
translated: This is to say, by meditating on the Thought of Enlightenment alone,

original: de ltar gyur na byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa la sbyor ba pa de bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi skur bsgyur ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa la sbyor ba pa de bdag nyid sangs rgyas kyi skur bsgyur ba ni /
translated: if it is like that, then the one who is engaged in the meditation on the Thought of Enlightenment, transforming himself into the Buddha's body,

original: mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las kyis mi gos par gyur pa lta ci smos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba la sogs pa'i las kyis mi gos par gyur pa lta ci smos zhes pa'o //
translated: need hardly say that he is not defiled by nonvirtuous actions and so on.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bdud bzhi rab tu 'dul ba rdo rje rnam par rol pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad bdud bzhi rab tu 'dul ba rdo rje rnam par rol pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs zhes pa ni /
translated: Then the Lord entered into the concentration called the Vajra Play, the Subduer of the Four Demons.

original: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de la zhugs nas bdud bzhi las rgyal bar byed pa dang / rdo rje rnam par rol pa'i sngags rnams 'byung bas na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ting nge 'dzin de la zhugs nas bdud bzhi las rgyal bar byed pa dang / rdo rje rnam par rol pa'i sngags rnams 'byung bas na /
translated: Having entered into that concentration, the Lord, in order to conquer the four demons and in order that the mantras of the Vajra Play would come forth,

original: ting nge 'dzin de bdud bzhi las rgyal ba rdo rje rnam par rol pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de bdud bzhi las rgyal ba rdo rje rnam par rol pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that concentration is called the Vajra Play, the Conqueror of the Four Demons.

original: de la bdud bzhi las rgyal ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la bdud bzhi las rgyal ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therein, the Conqueror of the Four Demons

original: spong ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: is the perfection of abandonment.

original: rdo rje rnam par rol pa zhes pa ni rdo rje dang 'dra bar cis kyang mi tshugs par rna par rol pa sprul pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje rnam par rol pa zhes pa ni rdo rje dang 'dra bar cis kyang mi tshugs par rna par rol pa sprul pa ste /
translated: The one called “playing with the vajra” is playing with the vajra, which is like the vajra in that it cannot be harmed by anything.

original: mthu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthu phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of power.

original: de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: bdud bzhi las rgyal bar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdud bzhi las rgyal bar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “victorious over the four māras,” and so on.

original: rdo rje yi ge'i tshig 'di rnams gsungs so zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: rdo rje yi ge'i tshig 'di rnams gsungs so zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: These vajra-word phrases are said.

original: bdud bzhi las rgyal ba zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bdud bzhi las rgyal ba zhes pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: “Victorious over the four māras” is as before.

original: rgyud drug rnam par rol pa zhes pa ni yi ge rnams kyi sgo nas stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs na /
analyzed: rgyud drug rnam par rol pa zhes pa ni yi ge rnams kyi sgo nas stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la zhugs na /
translated: “Playing with the six continuums” means that when one enters the samādhi of emptiness through the syllables,

original: rgyud drug la sogs pa thams cad dmigs su med par chud pa rgyud drug las rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: rgyud drug la sogs pa thams cad dmigs su med par chud pa rgyud drug las rnam par grol lo //
translated: all the six continuums, and so on, are included in the nonobservation of all phenomena, liberated from the six continuums.

original: gnyis su yi ge de rnams kyi sgo nas dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du sbyar zhing /
analyzed: gnyis su yi ge de rnams kyi sgo nas dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor du sbyar zhing /
translated: Alternately, those syllables are applied to the maṇḍala of great power, and so on, and

original: rig 'dzin la sogs pa'i grub pa thob nas rim gyis sa la bla ma la 'phar bas na /
analyzed: rig 'dzin la sogs pa'i grub pa thob nas rim gyis sa la bla ma la 'phar bas na /
translated: after attaining the powers of the knowledge holders, and so on, one gradually ascends to the stage of the guru.

original: rgyud drug las rnam par grol lo zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rgyud drug las rnam par grol lo zhes pa ste /
translated: One is liberated from the six destinies.

original: sngags de rnams pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sngags de rnams pha rol gyi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: These mantras teach the perfection of the other's goal.

original: thams cad mkhyen gyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen gyi ye shes yongs su rdzogs par byed pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The line it brings about the perfection of the wisdom of omniscience

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: teaches the perfection of wisdom.

original: gong ma'i rim gyis zhugs na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rdzogs par @169b 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong ma'i rim gyis zhugs na thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rdzogs par @169b 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one enters by the stages of the above, one will perfect the wisdom of omniscience.

original: sngags kyi yi ge 'bru rnams las bdud bzhi 'joms pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor 'gyur ba'i rim pa ni gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: sngags kyi yi ge 'bru rnams las bdud bzhi 'joms pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor 'gyur ba'i rim pa ni gong du bshad zin to //
translated: The stages of the transformation of the mantra syllables into the samadhis that conquer the four maras and the mandalas of the great lords and so forth have already been explained above.🔽Then, the line Then, Vajrapani, the Lord of Secrets, and those Vajra Holders...

original: de nas phyag na rdo rje gsang ba'i bdag po dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa de dag dang zhes pa nas /
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rje gsang ba'i bdag po dang / rdo rje 'dzin pa de dag dang zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: gang gi sems can theg chen gyi //🔽sngags kyi spyod pa bla med la //🔽mthong ba'i chos la bder spyod pa //
analyzed: gang gi sems can theg chen gyi // sngags kyi spyod pa bla med la // mthong ba'i chos la bder spyod pa //
translated: the line ...those beings who are in the Mahayana...🔽The line ...enjoy the bliss of the Dharma in this life...

original: rnam par spyod pa dga' bar ro //
analyzed: rnam par spyod pa dga' bar ro //
translated: The line ...they will enjoy the delightful conduct...

original: zhes pa'i bar du bcom ldan 'das kyi sngags gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du bcom ldan 'das kyi sngags gsungs pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavān spoke the mantras up to this point.

original: phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyis /
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje la sogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de rnams kyis /
translated: Those bodhisattvas such as Vajrapāṇi

original: sngags de rnams kyi mthu dang yon tan rnams chud na ngo mtshar du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngags de rnams kyi mthu dang yon tan rnams chud na ngo mtshar du 'gyur te /
translated: are amazed at the power and qualities of those mantras.

original: sngags de rnams kyi rjes su bsngags pa rnyed nas /
analyzed: sngags de rnams kyi rjes su bsngags pa rnyed nas /
translated: Having obtained praise for those mantras,

original: so so'i gnas su dgongs pa cho ga rnams bshad du gsol ba ste /
analyzed: so so'i gnas su dgongs pa cho ga rnams bshad du gsol ba ste /
translated: they request the explanation of the rites of their respective realizations.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad don kun te zhes pa ni snying po 'di rnams sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bya ba thams cad byed pa don gyi mchog go zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad don kun te zhes pa ni snying po 'di rnams sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bya ba thams cad byed pa don gyi mchog go zhes pa'o //
translated: All the buddhas and bodhisattvas are the supreme purpose, meaning that these essence mantras accomplish all the activities of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, they are the supreme purpose.

original: des ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' skyong ba rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas dang 'jig rten 'di yin na nyan thos pa gang dpa' bo rnams sa'i steng na ma lus par rdzu 'phrul rnam pa du mar spyod do zhes pa ni snying po 'di rnams kyi mthus sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang rdzu 'phrul sna
analyzed: des ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' skyong ba rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas dang 'jig rten 'di yin na nyan thos pa gang dpa' bo rnams sa'i steng na ma lus par rdzu 'phrul rnam pa du mar spyod do zhes pa ni snying po 'di rnams kyi mthus sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang rdzu 'phrul sna
translated: By the power of these essence mantras, the buddhas and bodhisattvas also engage in various kinds of miracles.

original: tshogs spyod / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang ting nge 'dzin gyis nam mkha' stong pa la sar bsams te /
analyzed: tshogs spyod / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang ting nge 'dzin gyis nam mkha' stong pa la sar bsams te /
translated: The shravakas and pratyekabuddhas also imagine the empty sky to be the earth through samadhi.🔽They engage in the four types of conduct on that earth,

original: de la spyod lam bzhir gnas pa dang / ro smad la chu 'byung /🔽ro stod la me 'byung ba dang / rlung gi dkyil 'khor bsams nas /
analyzed: de la spyod lam bzhir gnas pa dang / ro smad la chu 'byung / ro stod la me 'byung ba dang / rlung gi dkyil 'khor bsams nas /
translated: water arises from the lower part of their bodies,🔽and fire arises from the upper part of their bodies.

original: ri la sogs pa yang 'jig par byed pa la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs spyod do zhes pa'o //

original: de las gzhan yang gtso bo zhes pa nas rab tu sdud pa'i mchog ni klad kyi 'khor dang bcas pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ba'i sgrub pa rnams bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan yang gtso bo zhes pa nas rab tu sdud pa'i mchog ni klad kyi 'khor dang bcas pa'o zhes pa'i bar du ba'i sgrub pa rnams bshad pa ste /
translated: Furthermore, the explanation of the mantra from “the principal” up to “the supreme of all that is gathered” is the brain with its retinue.

original: yi ge bsam pa yang dbang chen @171b gyi dkyil 'khor du bsam pa ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: yi ge bsam pa yang dbang chen @171b gyi dkyil 'khor du bsam pa ni snga ma bzhin te /

analyzed: de la khyad par du nang gi dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor lte ba'i thad kar bsam mo //
translated: The difference is that the inner maṇḍala of great A is contemplated at the level of the navel.

original: kha ba 'o ma'am dung 'dra bar //
analyzed: kha ba 'o ma'am dung 'dra bar //
translated: Like snow, milk, or a conch,

original: lte ba'i dbus nas byung bar de //
analyzed: lte ba'i dbus nas byung bar de //
translated: arising from the center of the navel,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: kha ba'i phung po'i dbus na zhugs //
analyzed: kha ba'i phung po'i dbus na zhugs //
translated: residing in the center of a heap of snow,

original: gdug pa kun kyang rab tu zhi //
analyzed: gdug pa kun kyang rab tu zhi //
translated: all poisons are pacified.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ba'i las gcig bshad pa ste /🔽bdag nyid dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor du bsgyur na /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ba'i las gcig bshad pa ste / bdag nyid dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor du bsgyur na /
translated: This explains the activity of pacifying.🔽If one transforms oneself into the maṇḍala of great A,

original: nang gi rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor lte ba'i thad kar bsam ste /
analyzed: nang gi rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor lte ba'i thad kar bsam ste /
translated: one should contemplate the inner maṇḍala of great A at the level of the navel.

original: de'i steng du padmo dkar po kha ba 'o ma dung 'dra ba lte ba'i nang nas 'byung ba 'dug par bsams te /
analyzed: de'i steng du padmo dkar po kha ba 'o ma dung 'dra ba lte ba'i nang nas 'byung ba 'dug par bsams te /
translated: On top of that, imagine a white lotus, like a snow-white milk-filled conch shell, and that you are sitting in the center of it.🔽

original: padmo'i steng du yi ge ba ston gyi zla ba'i kha dog 'dra ba bsams la /
analyzed: padmo'i steng du yi ge ba ston gyi zla ba'i kha dog 'dra ba bsams la /
translated: On top of that, imagine a white lotus like snow, milk, or a conch, and in the center of that imagine a syllable va like the color of the autumn moon.

original: ba la chu rgyun dgu 'byung bas bskor te /🔽chu'i dkyil 'khor zla ba'i 'od 'dra ba de'i gzhir gyur pa bsams la /
analyzed: ba la chu rgyun dgu 'byung bas bskor te / chu'i dkyil 'khor zla ba'i 'od 'dra ba de'i gzhir gyur pa bsams la /
translated: Surrounding the va are nine streams of water.🔽Imagine that the foundation of that water maṇḍala is like the light of the moon.

original: yi ge ba de yang bum pa 'dra ba smug pa'i zil pa dkar po 'dus pa 'dra ba'i nang na 'dug par bsams te /
analyzed: yi ge ba de yang bum pa 'dra ba smug pa'i zil pa dkar po 'dus pa 'dra ba'i nang na 'dug par bsams te /
translated: The syllable va is imagined to be like a vase, inside of which is a white dew drop like a pearl.

original: bdag gi lus kyi nang thams cad khyab par bsams na /
analyzed: bdag gi lus kyi nang thams cad khyab par bsams na /
translated: If one imagines that it pervades one’s entire body,

original: gdug pa dang tsha ba'i rims la sogs pa thams cad 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdug pa dang tsha ba'i rims la sogs pa thams cad 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: all contagious and hot fevers and so on will be purified.

original: de bzhin du bdag gi lus dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la 'dug par bsams la gzhan gyi lus la de bzhin du bsams na /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gi lus dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la 'dug par bsams la gzhan gyi lus la de bzhin du bsams na /
translated: Similarly, if one imagines one’s body on the maṇḍala of the great lord of wrath and imagines the same for the body of another,

original: gdug pa dang tsha ba'i rims la sogs pa 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdug pa dang tsha ba'i rims la sogs pa 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: all contagious and hot fevers and so on will be purified.

original: 'o ma mu tig phreng dkar dang // zhes pa nas /
analyzed: 'o ma mu tig phreng dkar dang // zhes pa nas /
translated: and so on up to

original: sngags pa yid la bsams na ni //
analyzed: sngags pa yid la bsams na ni //
translated: if the mantra practitioner thinks of it,

original: gdug pa kun las thar bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gdug pa kun las thar bar 'gyur //
translated: he will be freed from all poisons.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ba'i las gzhan te /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ba'i las gzhan te /
translated: This is another rite.

original: yi ge bde snga ma bzhin du bsams nas smug zil med par de la chu rgyun dkar po 'byung ste /
analyzed: yi ge bde snga ma bzhin du bsams nas smug zil med par de la chu rgyun dkar po 'byung ste /
translated: Having visualized the syllable va as before, a white stream of water arises from it without smoke.

original: chu rgyun des ba de la 'khor nas 'khyil bar 'dug par bsams la /
analyzed: chu rgyun des ba de la 'khor nas 'khyil bar 'dug par bsams la /
translated: That stream of water encircles the cow and remains swirling.

original: de bdag gi dbugs kyis bskyod nas rang gi lus thams cad du khyab par bsams na /
analyzed: de bdag gi dbugs kyis bskyod nas rang gi lus thams cad du khyab par bsams na /
translated: If one imagines that it pervades one's entire body,

original: des gdug pa la sogs pa'i nad rnams zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des gdug pa la sogs pa'i nad rnams zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it will pacify diseases such as poison and so on.

original: de bzhin du pha rol bsams na yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol bsams na yang /
translated: Similarly, if one imagines the other person,

original: gdug pa la sogs pa'i nad rnams de bzhin du zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdug pa la sogs pa'i nad rnams de bzhin du zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: diseases such as poison and so on will be pacified in the same way.

original: dkyil 'khor de la sgrub pa ni //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de la sgrub pa ni //
translated: The accomplishment in that maṇḍala

original: dngos po 'di rnams thub sems kyis //
analyzed: dngos po 'di rnams thub sems kyis //
translated: is these things by the mind of the Sage.

original: zhes pa nas de ni zhi byed dpal ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor ro zhes gsungs pa yin zhes pa'i bar du ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi sbyor ba la gnas nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas de ni zhi byed dpal ldan pa'i dkyil 'khor ro zhes gsungs pa yin zhes pa'i bar du ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi sbyor ba la gnas nas /
translated: The passage from “the maṇḍala of the glorious pacifier” up to “the maṇḍala of the glorious pacifier” is the pacification maṇḍala.

original: rdo rje la sogs @172a * //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs @172a * //
translated: The substances such as the vajra

original: pa'i rdzas ming gis smos pa de rnams bsgrubs na /
analyzed: pa'i rdzas ming gis smos pa de rnams bsgrubs na /
translated: that are mentioned by name are accomplished.🔽The attainments such as longevity are obtained.

original: tshe ring ba la sogs pa'i grub pa rnams thob par 'gyur te rim bzhin du sbyor bar bya'o //🔽rab tu sdud pa'i chog pa ni //
analyzed: tshe ring ba la sogs pa'i grub pa rnams thob par 'gyur te rim bzhin du sbyor bar bya'o // rab tu sdud pa'i chog pa ni //
translated: The concise rite

original: klad kyi 'khor dang bcas na'o //
analyzed: klad kyi 'khor dang bcas na'o //
translated: is with the head and the circle.

original: zhes pa ni nad pa'i lus la ba de klad kor dang bcas par bsams na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni nad pa'i lus la ba de klad kor dang bcas par bsams na /
translated: If one imagines the body of the patient with the head and the circle,

original: ba ni gzung ba'i chos thams cad stong par byad pa /
analyzed: ba ni gzung ba'i chos thams cad stong par byad pa /
translated: the head is the emptiness of all phenomena that are apprehended.

original: klad kor ni 'dzin pa thams cad stong par ston te /
analyzed: klad kor ni 'dzin pa thams cad stong par ston te /

original: de ltar lus de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis ka dang bral te /
analyzed: de ltar lus de gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis ka dang bral te /
translated: Thus, the body is free from both the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: stong pas nad kyang stong pa'i rang bzhin du 'dus te med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: stong pas nad kyang stong pa'i rang bzhin du 'dus te med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since it is empty, the illness also dissolves into the nature of emptiness and becomes nonexistent.🔽The supreme of all

original: ra de ni nyid mchog yin zhes pa nas /
analyzed: ra de ni nyid mchog yin zhes pa nas /
translated: is the supreme of all.

original: me dang bcas par sbyar na'o zhes pa'i bar du ra'i sgrub pa dang las rnams bshad de /
analyzed: me dang bcas par sbyar na'o zhes pa'i bar du ra'i sgrub pa dang las rnams bshad de /
translated: The practice and activities of ra are explained up to “when applied with fire.”

original: ra ni yang dag mchog yin te //
analyzed: ra ni yang dag mchog yin te //
translated: Ra is the supreme, the most excellent.

original: zhes pa ni chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin stong pa'i rang bzhin mchog gi de bzhin nyid de yi ger de ston pas na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin stong pa'i rang bzhin mchog gi de bzhin nyid de yi ger de ston pas na /
translated: This is the supreme suchness of the nature of emptiness, the samādhi free from the dust of all phenomena. Since that is taught by the syllable ra,

original: mchog gi de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: mchog gi de bzhin nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: it is called “supreme suchness.”

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the characteristic of the ultimate.

original: 'od can gyis 'od ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'od can gyis 'od ces bya ba ni /
translated: The luminous one is light.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba dang skar ma la sogs pa'i 'od can rnams te /
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba dang skar ma la sogs pa'i 'od can rnams te /
translated: The luminous ones are the sun, moon, stars, and so on.

original: 'od can de rnams kyi nang na me ni 'od can gyi mchog ste /
analyzed: 'od can de rnams kyi nang na me ni 'od can gyi mchog ste /
translated: Among those luminous ones, fire is the most luminous.

original: yi ger ni me'i sa bon yin pas na 'od can rnams kyi mchog ces bya ste /
analyzed: yi ger ni me'i sa bon yin pas na 'od can rnams kyi mchog ces bya ste /
translated: Since the syllable ra is the seed of fire, it is called “the most luminous.”

original: kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the nature of the relative.

original: des na las rnams gang yang rung //
analyzed: des na las rnams gang yang rung //
translated: Therefore, any of the activities

original: mtshams med par ni 'gyur ba rnams //
analyzed: mtshams med par ni 'gyur ba rnams //
translated: will become the heinous

original: de kun 'byung gyur sbyor bas ni //
analyzed: de kun 'byung gyur sbyor bas ni //
translated: when applied to those.

original: shin tu 'thob par bsams na'o //
analyzed: shin tu 'thob par bsams na'o //
translated: If one thinks of it as very much obtained.

original: zhes pa'i bar du de la bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du de la bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
translated: Up to here is the teaching of the result of meditation on it.

original: chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du bsgoms na /
analyzed: chos thams cad rdul dang bral ba stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin du bsgoms na /
translated: If one meditates on all phenomena as the nature of emptiness free from dust,

analyzed: mi dge bcu la sogs pa'i las rnams dang / de'i 'bras bu mtshams med pa la sogs pa dmigs su med pas 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: the karma of the ten nonvirtues and so on and the result of that, the heinous crimes and so on, do not occur because they are not observed.

original: rab tu kun dmar yid 'ong gru gsum lta bu ru ni 'dug /'bar ba'i phreng bas 'khor lo ni//
analyzed: rab tu kun dmar yid 'ong gru gsum lta bu ru ni 'dug /'bar ba'i phreng bas 'khor lo ni//
translated: The triangle, very red and attractive, is situated in the center of the fire mandala.

original: gru gsum rva can snying gar gzhag / ces pa ni me'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid de snying gar nang gi rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gru gsum shin tu dmar ba /
analyzed: gru gsum rva can snying gar gzhag / ces pa ni me'i dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid de snying gar nang gi rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du gru gsum shin tu dmar ba /

analyzed: 'greng bur 'dug pa gru gsum gyi mtshan nyid btab par bsam mo zhes pa'o //
translated: standing upright, with the characteristic of a triangle.

original: de ru 'dug pas sbyor bas bsam //
analyzed: de ru 'dug pas sbyor bas bsam //
translated: One should think of it as situated there by the yoga.

original: ra @172b klad kor dang bcas par te //
analyzed: ra @172b klad kor dang bcas par te //
translated: The triangle is endowed with a head of ra.

original: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid dbus na yi ger kha dog dmar po klad kor dang bcas pa 'greng bur 'dug par bsam zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi mtshan nyid dbus na yi ger kha dog dmar po klad kor dang bcas pa 'greng bur 'dug par bsam zhes pa ste /
translated: This is the definition of the maṇḍala: in the center, one should imagine the syllable raṃ, red in color, standing upright with a dot.

original: klad kor dang bcas pa ni /
analyzed: klad kor dang bcas pa ni /
translated: The dot shows

original: kun du sangs rgyas pa'i snying po gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba ston pa'o //
analyzed: kun du sangs rgyas pa'i snying po gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba ston pa'o //
translated: the essence of universal buddhahood, free from the duality of grasped and grasper.

original: de bzhin du yi ge ba yang klad kor med kyang kun du sangs rgyas pa'i snying po bas pa'i bu ga nyid klad kor lta bur 'dzin pa med par ston par blta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge ba yang klad kor med kyang kun du sangs rgyas pa'i snying po bas pa'i bu ga nyid klad kor lta bur 'dzin pa med par ston par blta'o //
translated: Similarly, the syllable va, although without a dot, should be seen as showing the essence of universal buddhahood, the hole of the letter va itself like a dot, without grasping.

original: dngos po de rnams der sgrubs su //
analyzed: dngos po de rnams der sgrubs su //
translated: Those entities are established there.

original: zhes pa ni me dang bcas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni me dang bcas par sbyar ro //
translated: This is the application with fire.

original: zhes pa'i bar du yi ge ra bsgrub pa ba dang las rnams bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du yi ge ra bsgrub pa ba dang las rnams bshad pa ste /
translated: Up to here, the establishment of the syllable ra and the activities have been explained.

original: sngags pa ra'i dkyil 'khor la gnas nas /
analyzed: sngags pa ra'i dkyil 'khor la gnas nas /
translated: The mantra practitioner, abiding in the maṇḍala of ra,

original: bsgrub pa ming gis smos pa rnams rgyud dang rtog pa gzhan las byung ba'i tshogs rdzas kyi mtshan ma dang bcas pa'am mtshan ma med par bsgrubs na /
analyzed: bsgrub pa ming gis smos pa rnams rgyud dang rtog pa gzhan las byung ba'i tshogs rdzas kyi mtshan ma dang bcas pa'am mtshan ma med par bsgrubs na /
translated: The accomplishments mentioned by name are accomplished with or without the signs of the assembled substances that occur in other tantras and commentaries.

original: nyi ma la sogs pa grub ste ci bsgo ba nyan to //
analyzed: nyi ma la sogs pa grub ste ci bsgo ba nyan to //
translated: The sun and so forth are accomplished and they listen to whatever is commanded.

original: ha de yang dag mchog yin te//
analyzed: ha de yang dag mchog yin te//
translated: That ha is the supreme reality.

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: Up to:

original: bdud rnams rnam par 'gyur byed pa //
analyzed: bdud rnams rnam par 'gyur byed pa //
translated: The one who causes the maras to tremble.

original: rgyu kun mi dmigs pa ru ste //
analyzed: rgyu kun mi dmigs pa ru ste //
translated: The non-apprehension of all causes.

original: zhes pa'i bar du ha zhes pa'i bsgrub pa dang / yon tan dang dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bshad pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du ha zhes pa'i bsgrub pa dang / yon tan dang dkyil 'khor la sogs pa bshad pa ste /
translated: Up to here, the accomplishment of ha, the qualities, the maṇḍala, and so forth are explained.

original: ha de de nyid mchog yin te //
analyzed: ha de de nyid mchog yin te //
translated: That ha is the supreme reality.

analyzed: zhes pa ni chos thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bur ston pa'i rang bzhin pas de kho na nyid kyi mchog ces pa'o //
translated: Since it shows all phenomena as cause and effect, it is the supreme reality.

original: de yang rlung las mngon byung ba //🔽zhes pa ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor las byung ba'am /
analyzed: de yang rlung las mngon byung ba // zhes pa ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor las byung ba'am /
translated: Moreover, it arises from the wind.🔽It arises from the maṇḍala of wind,

original: de las rlung gi dkyil 'khor 'byung bas so //
analyzed: de las rlung gi dkyil 'khor 'byung bas so //
translated: or the maṇḍala of wind arises from it.

original: rgyu dang las dang 'bras bu yin //
analyzed: rgyu dang las dang 'bras bu yin //
translated: It is the cause, action, and result.

original: gang gi sa bon skyes par te //
analyzed: gang gi sa bon skyes par te //
translated: The seed of which is born

original: de yis kun kyang 'joms pa ni //
analyzed: de yis kun kyang 'joms pa ni //
translated: is destroyed by that.

original: gang gi 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The one with its retinue

original: zhes pa ni de'i rang bzhin bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de'i rang bzhin bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching of the result of meditating on its nature.

original: ha zhes pa ni klad kor dang bcas par bsam pas /
analyzed: ha zhes pa ni klad kor dang bcas par bsam pas /
translated: The syllable ha is contemplated with a dot above it.

original: chos thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul gyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis ka dmigs su med de /
analyzed: chos thams cad rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tshul gyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis ka dmigs su med de /
translated: All phenomena are not observed as the duality of object and subject in the manner of cause and effect.

original: rgyu zhes pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu zhes pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The cause is the afflictions such as ignorance.

original: las ni lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: las ni lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Karma is the virtuous, nonvirtuous, and so on, that are performed by means of body, speech, and mind.

original: 'bras bu ni de dag gi rnam par smin pa ngan song dang ngan 'gro la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni de dag gi rnam par smin pa ngan song dang ngan 'gro la sogs pa'o //
translated: The result is the ripening of those, such as the lower realms and bad migrations.

original: gang gi sa bon rnams skye ba //
analyzed: gang gi sa bon rnams skye ba //
translated: The seed of which is born

original: zhes @173a * //
analyzed: zhes @173a * //
translated: is destroyed by that.

original: pa ni rgyu dang las de dag gis yang phung po skyed pa ste /
analyzed: pa ni rgyu dang las de dag gis yang phung po skyed pa ste /

analyzed: de dag thams cad dmigs su med par stong pas na 'joms par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Since all of them are empty, without reference, they are destroyed.

original: de yi gzugs kyang bshad pa ni //
analyzed: de yi gzugs kyang bshad pa ni //
translated: His form is also explained:

original: kha dog nag la 'od che ba //🔽'jigs shing 'bar ba'i phreng bar 'khor //
analyzed: kha dog nag la 'od che ba // 'jigs shing 'bar ba'i phreng bar 'khor //
translated: black in color, with great radiance,🔽frightening, surrounded by a garland of flames,

original: kun du g-yo ba 'bar bzhin du'o //
analyzed: kun du g-yo ba 'bar bzhin du'o //
translated: shaking all around, blazing.

original: zhes pa ni yi ge ha nyid kyi gzugs bstan ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni yi ge ha nyid kyi gzugs bstan ba ste /
translated: This shows the form of the syllable hūṃ itself.

original: de yang rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng na gnas par bsam ste /
analyzed: de yang rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi steng na gnas par bsam ste /
translated: Moreover, one should imagine it to be located on the wind maṇḍala.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gsungs pa dang // dkyil 'khor de'i steng bsam pa ni //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor gsungs pa dang // dkyil 'khor de'i steng bsam pa ni // zhes pa ni /
translated: The wind maṇḍala is taught, and imagining it above that maṇḍala,

original: ba dan bcas par g-yo bzhin te //
analyzed: ba dan bcas par g-yo bzhin te //
translated: with a banner, it shakes.

analyzed: bas ni gdung ba'i rnam pa ste //

analyzed: sngags pa snga ma bzhin du sbyor ba'i stan la gnas nas /

analyzed: yi ge aa dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la snga ma bzhin du bsams te /

analyzed: rlung ni kun du 'gro ba ste //

analyzed: zhes pa nas /

analyzed: / gnas mchog kyang ni bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The line Lord of Secrets, the accomplishment of mantra is not accomplished by those who have a body, but by those who do not have a body up to the line therefore, the omniscient one is accomplished

translated: and the supreme abode is accomplished generally teaches that the accomplishments of mantra arise from mental contemplation, verbal expression, and the blessings of the Tathagata.

original: gzugs med pa'i ngo bo rnams las zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i ngo bo rnams las zhes pa ni /

analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo gzugs med pa rnams las /
translated: means from the nature of the mind and mental factors that are formless.

original: rnam pa tha dad pa rnams las mngon par 'du byas pa rnams sems kyi bsam pa las 'byung ngo zhes pa dang 'brel te /
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pa rnams las mngon par 'du byas pa rnams sems kyi bsam pa las 'byung ngo zhes pa dang 'brel te /
translated: “From the different aspects” means that the formations arise from the mind’s intention.

original: mdor na phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams las zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mdor na phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams las zhes pa ni /
translated: In brief, “from external things”

original: sems kyi bsam pa tsam las grub pa rnam pa mang po sna tshogs pa gzugs dang ldan pa rnams /
analyzed: sems kyi bsam pa tsam las grub pa rnam pa mang po sna tshogs pa gzugs dang ldan pa rnams /
translated: means that many different things that possess form are established from the mind’s intention alone.

original: sems las byung ba'i gzugs med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba'i gzugs med pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: “Formless things arise from the mind” means that formless things that are mental factors arise.

original: ngag rnam par bskyod pa tsam gyis las thams cad dang / sa bon bya ba 'byung zhes pa ni ha la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyi sgra brjod pa tsam las ha la sogs pa'i yig 'bru @176b dbang chen la sogs pa'i sa bon gyi dkyil 'khor gyi sa bon du 'gyur ba yang /
analyzed: ngag rnam par bskyod pa tsam gyis las thams cad dang / sa bon bya ba 'byung zhes pa ni ha la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyi sgra brjod pa tsam las ha la sogs pa'i yig 'bru @176b dbang chen la sogs pa'i sa bon gyi dkyil 'khor gyi sa bon du 'gyur ba yang /
translated: “All actions and the arising of the seed are from the mere vibration of speech” means that from the mere utterance of the sound of the syllables such as ha, the seed syllables of the maṇḍala of the seed syllables such as ha arise.

original: rab dang 'bring la sogs pa'i grub pa dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams byed par 'gyur ba 'byung ngo zhes pa'o //🔽las thams cad spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mdun na zhes pa nas /
analyzed: rab dang 'bring la sogs pa'i grub pa dang zhi ba la sogs pa'i las rnams byed par 'gyur ba 'byung ngo zhes pa'o // las thams cad spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mdun na zhes pa nas /
translated: It is said that the buddhas will appear to perform the activities of pacifying, increasing, and so forth, and to bring about the accomplishments of the highest, middling, and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs brnyan lta bur bzhugs so zhes pa'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du byin gyis brlabs par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs brnyan lta bur bzhugs so zhes pa'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du byin gyis brlabs par bshad pa ste /
translated: The passage from “The bodhisattvas who engage in the conduct of all activities” up to “the tathāgatas remain like reflections” explains the consecration of all tathāgatas.🔽The consecration of those tathāgatas is that, by the power of their aspirations, in accordance with the individual faiths of the beings to be tamed, all their hopes will be fulfilled.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de byin gyis brlab pa yang smon lam gyi shugs kyis gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnams ji ltar dad pa'i so so'i rjes su mthun pa thams cad kyi re ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba sems can re re'i mdun na gzugs brnyan lta bur🔽bzhugs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de byin gyis brlab pa yang smon lam gyi shugs kyis gdul ba'i 'gro ba rnams ji ltar dad pa'i so so'i rjes su mthun pa thams cad kyi re ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba sems can re re'i mdun na gzugs brnyan lta bur🔽bzhugs pa ni /
translated: Each being will have a tathāgata in their presence, like a reflection.

original: zla ba gnam la 'dug kyang gzugs brnyan mtsho dang rdzing bu dang snod kyi chu la sogs pa thams cad du snang bar gyur pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: zla ba gnam la 'dug kyang gzugs brnyan mtsho dang rdzing bu dang snod kyi chu la sogs pa thams cad du snang bar gyur pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: It is like the moon in the sky, whose reflection appears in all the water vessels such as lakes, ponds, and pots.

original: de lta bur sems kyis tshig brjod pa tsam dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs las grub pa rnam pa mang po sna tshogs pa rnams 'byung ba la ltos zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur sems kyis tshig brjod pa tsam dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs las grub pa rnam pa mang po sna tshogs pa rnams 'byung ba la ltos zhes pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the mere utterance of words by the mind and the various kinds of accomplishments that occur through the blessings of the Tathagata should be seen.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni rnam par rtog pa yang med ces pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de ni rnam par rtog pa yang med ces pa nas /
translated: The Tathagata is without conceptualization, and so on up to

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa las rnam par dul zhes pa'i bar ni /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa las rnam par dul zhes pa'i bar ni /
translated: he is disciplined in terms of Dharma and non-Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de ltar sems can thams cad kyi mdun na gnas kyang rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di rnams dang bral zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de ltar sems can thams cad kyi mdun na gnas kyang rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di rnams dang bral zhes pa ste /
translated: The Tathagata abides in the presence of all sentient beings in that way, but is free from these things such as conceptualization and so on.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa yang med ces pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa de ngas sems can 'di rnams kyi don bya'o snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa de la mi 'dzin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa yang med ces pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa de ngas sems can 'di rnams kyi don bya'o snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa de la mi 'dzin zhes pa'o //
translated: “It is without conceptualization” means that the Tathāgata does not grasp the conceptualization “I will benefit these sentient beings.”

original: yid kyi yul las 'das zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yid kyi yul las 'das zhes pa ni /
translated: “It is beyond the domain of the mind” means

original: yid ni ji bzhin pa dang bcas pa'i sems te de las 'das zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yid ni ji bzhin pa dang bcas pa'i sems te de las 'das zhes pa'o //
translated: that it is beyond the mind that is associated with the way things are.

original: bya ba dang las dang zhes pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas spyod pa'i bya ba dang las rnams dang bral lo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba dang las dang zhes pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyi sgo nas spyod pa'i bya ba dang las rnams dang bral lo zhes pa'o //
translated: “It is free from action and agent” means that it is free from the actions and agents that are performed through the three doors of body, speech, and mind.

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa las rnam par bral ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa las rnam par bral ba zhes pa ni /
translated: “It is free from Dharma and non-Dharma” means

original: chos ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam /
analyzed: chos ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam /
translated: that Dharma is the path of the ten virtues

original: chos ma yin pa ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ste /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa ni mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ste /
translated: and non-Dharma is the path of the ten non-virtues.

original: de dag ni dngos po rnams dang bral lo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni dngos po rnams dang bral lo zhes pa'o //
translated: It is free from those things.🔽The source of the mantra conduct

original: kun mkhyen gnas su thob byed pa //
analyzed: kun mkhyen gnas su thob byed pa //
translated: that causes the attainment of the state of omniscience

original: sngags spyad las ni 'byung ba ste //🔽zhes pa ni de ltar dngos po de @177a * //
analyzed: sngags spyad las ni 'byung ba ste //🔽zhes pa ni de ltar dngos po de @177a * //
translated: is the Tantra of the Perfected Lion.🔽Thus, the source of the mantra conduct that causes the attainment of the state of omniscience is the Tantra of the Perfected Lion.

original: rnams dang yang lnga mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams sngags kyi spyod pa'i sgo nas thob par byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnams dang yang lnga mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams sngags kyi spyod pa'i sgo nas thob par byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: And also the five, the superknowledges and so forth, are attained by means of the mantra conduct.🔽Therefore, one should accomplish the omniscient one

original: de bas kun mkhyen sgrub pa dang // gnas mchog kyang ni bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas kun mkhyen sgrub pa dang // gnas mchog kyang ni bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: and also accomplish the supreme abode.

original: zhes pa ni de lta bas na lnga mngon par shes pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis shes nas mchog kyang bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de lta bas na lnga mngon par shes pa dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis shes nas mchog kyang bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, one should accomplish the five superknowledges and the supreme knowledge of the Bhagavān Buddha.

original: de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: Then, the glorious Vajra Holder,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /
translated: up to

original: yid ni de ltar shes par bya //
analyzed: yid ni de ltar shes par bya //
translated: the mind should be known thus.

original: sngags pa sngags rgyud la gnas so //
analyzed: sngags pa sngags rgyud la gnas so //
translated: The mantra practitioner abides in the mantra tantra.

original: zhes pa'i bar du snga phyi dang nang gi bslab pa'i yan lag bzhi dang dpa' bo chen po snying po lnga'i bzlas pa yan lag gsum sngar bshad pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying ga nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bzlas par bya ba'i sngags dgod pa dang
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du snga phyi dang nang gi bslab pa'i yan lag bzhi dang dpa' bo chen po snying po lnga'i bzlas pa yan lag gsum sngar bshad pa rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying ga nas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bzlas par bya ba'i sngags dgod pa dang
translated: Up to here, the earlier and later, the four internal branches of training, and the three-branched recitation of the great hero's five essences explained above, the mantra to be recited is arranged on the moon maṇḍala in the heart of the tathāgata.

original: / dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams la bzlas par bya ba'i sngags rnams dgod de /
analyzed: / dbang chen la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rnams la bzlas par bya ba'i sngags rnams dgod de /
translated: The mantras to be recited in the maṇḍalas of Maheśvara and so on are set forth.

original: bzlas par bya'o zhes mdo tsam du gsungs te /
analyzed: bzlas par bya'o zhes mdo tsam du gsungs te /
translated: It is said in brief that they should be recited.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang bzlas pa'i sngags rnams zlos pa nyid kyi tshe na /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang bzlas pa'i sngags rnams zlos pa nyid kyi tshe na /
translated: When the maṇḍala of the moon and the mantras to be recited are recited,

original: gsal bar snang bar bsam pa'i thabs zhib tu ma gsungs te /
analyzed: gsal bar snang bar bsam pa'i thabs zhib tu ma gsungs te /
translated: the method of imagining them to appear clearly is not explained in detail.

original: de dag gsal bar snang ba'i yongs su sbyang ba'i sgo nas bshad pa dang / nang gi bzlas pa'i yan lag bzhi'i sbyor ba la /
analyzed: de dag gsal bar snang ba'i yongs su sbyang ba'i sgo nas bshad pa dang / nang gi bzlas pa'i yan lag bzhi'i sbyor ba la /
translated: The explanation in terms of the purification of their clear appearance and the application of the four limbs of inner recitation

original: bdag gi snying gar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku me long gi dkyil 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs par bsam pa yang mdo tsam gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag gi snying gar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku me long gi dkyil 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs par bsam pa yang mdo tsam gsungs te /
translated: is also said in brief: imagine the form of the tathāgata in one’s heart, abiding in the center of a mirror.

original: gsal ba nyid du ma bshad pas de yang sngags zlos pa'i tshe na sems kyi gsal bar snang bar bya bar bshad pa ste /
analyzed: gsal ba nyid du ma bshad pas de yang sngags zlos pa'i tshe na sems kyi gsal bar snang bar bya bar bshad pa ste /
translated: Since that is not explained clearly, it is explained that when the mantra is recited, it should appear clearly to the mind.

original: de la / de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: de la / de nas dpal ldan rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: In that regard, the Śrīvajra holder

original: mig mi 'dzums par ngo mtshar te //
analyzed: mig mi 'dzums par ngo mtshar te //
translated: is amazed and does not close his eyes.

original: zhes pa ni gong du dbang chen po'i snying po rnams bshad pa thos shing chud na ngo mtshar du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gong du dbang chen po'i snying po rnams bshad pa thos shing chud na ngo mtshar du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is to say, it is a wonder to hear and to understand the explanation of the essence of the great empowerment above.

original: de ni rdo rje spor ba ni //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje spor ba ni //
translated: Then, the vajra is brandished,

original: 'od zer kun du 'bar ba bzhin //
analyzed: 'od zer kun du 'bar ba bzhin //
translated: like a blazing light all around.

original: 'di kun snang bar gyur pa yang //
analyzed: 'di kun snang bar gyur pa yang //
translated: All of this becomes light,

original: sangs rgyas zhing rnams khyab par ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing rnams khyab par ro //
translated: pervading the buddha-fields.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar ngo mtshar du gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar ngo mtshar du gyur te /
translated: Thus, it is a wonder.

original: dga' ba'i shugs kyis rdo rje spor ba ste /
analyzed: dga' ba'i shugs kyis rdo rje spor ba ste /
translated: The vajra is brandished with the force of joy.

original: rdo rje'i 'od 'phro 'bar ba dang 'dra bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad khyab ste snang bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i 'od 'phro 'bar ba dang 'dra bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad khyab ste snang bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Like the blazing light of the vajra, it pervades all buddha-fields and becomes light.

original: gnyis su de ltar rdo rje sbor ba yang ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams @177b sngags spyod pa la dad pa bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis su de ltar rdo rje sbor ba yang ma 'ongs pa'i 'gro ba rnams @177b sngags spyod pa la dad pa bskyed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the vajra is brandished like this in order to generate faith in the practice of mantra for future beings.

original: sngags kyi phyag rgya rdo rje spor bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad 'od kyis khyab pa mthong na dad pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngags kyi phyag rgya rdo rje spor bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad 'od kyis khyab pa mthong na dad pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When they see all buddha-fields pervaded by the light of the mantra mudra vajra, faith arises.

original: sngags pa rnams kyi gnas gsungs pa //
analyzed: sngags pa rnams kyi gnas gsungs pa //
translated: The places of the mantra practitioners are taught.

original: gnas de yang ni ma rnyed na //🔽sngags de rnams ni gang nas dong //
analyzed: gnas de yang ni ma rnyed na // sngags de rnams ni gang nas dong //
translated: If those places are not found,🔽from where do those mantras come?

original: gtso bo de rnams gang nas lhags //
analyzed: gtso bo de rnams gang nas lhags //
translated: From where do those principal ones come?

original: zhes pa ni sngar bzlas pa'i yan lag bzhi la sogs pa gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngar bzlas pa'i yan lag bzhi la sogs pa gsungs pa ni /
translated: This is saying that the four branches of repetition and so forth were previously taught.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sngags gnas par bya ba bshad pa rnams zlos pa nyid kyi tshe na /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sngags gnas par bya ba bshad pa rnams zlos pa nyid kyi tshe na /
translated: When the mantras that are to be placed on the moon maṇḍala are recited,

original: bdag gi snying ga nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying gar 'dod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying gnas dbugs slar sdud par bsam zhing /
analyzed: bdag gi snying ga nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying gar 'dod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying gnas dbugs slar sdud par bsam zhing /
translated: one should imagine that they come from one’s heart to the heart of the tathāgata and that they are drawn back into one’s breath from the heart of the tathāgata.

original: bdag gi snying gar dmigs pa na gang nas lhags pa'i gnas gsal bar bdag gis ma dmigs na /
analyzed: bdag gi snying gar dmigs pa na gang nas lhags pa'i gnas gsal bar bdag gis ma dmigs na /
translated: When one visualizes them in one’s heart, if one does not clearly visualize the place from which they come,

original: de gnas de dag dmigs par bgyi ba bshad du gsol zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de gnas de dag dmigs par bgyi ba bshad du gsol zhes pa'o //
translated: please explain the places that are to be visualized.

original: tshig mchog khyod kyis mi mkhyen med //
analyzed: tshig mchog khyod kyis mi mkhyen med //
translated: There is nothing that you, supreme one, do not know.

original: chos rnams kun gyi gnas khyod do //
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyi gnas khyod do //
translated: You are the place of all phenomena.

original: chu rnams kyi ni rgya mtsho bzhin //
analyzed: chu rnams kyi ni rgya mtsho bzhin //
translated: You are like the ocean of waters.

original: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa'i tshig ste //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das la bstod pa'i tshig ste //
translated: This is the praise of the Blessed One.

original: chos rnams kun gyi gnas khyod do //
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyi gnas khyod do //
translated: You are the abode of all phenomena.

original: zhes pa ni lugs kyi chos dang chud pa'i chos kyi gnas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni lugs kyi chos dang chud pa'i chos kyi gnas zhes pa'o //
translated: This is the abode of the Dharma of the scriptures and the Dharma of realization.

original: chu rnams kyi ni rgya mtsho bzhin //
analyzed: chu rnams kyi ni rgya mtsho bzhin //
translated: Like the ocean for the waters.

original: zhes pa ni de'i dpe ste chu rnams thams cad kyi gnas kyang rgya mtsho yin pa dang 'dra'o zhes pa'o //🔽sems dpa' chen po yid gnas par //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de'i dpe ste chu rnams thams cad kyi gnas kyang rgya mtsho yin pa dang 'dra'o zhes pa'o // sems dpa' chen po yid gnas par //
translated: This is the example. Just as the ocean is the abode of all waters,

original: dkyil 'khor rnams ni bshad pa ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rnams ni bshad pa ste /
translated: The maṇḍalas are explained as the abode of the great beings.

original: gong du phyag na rdo rjes gsol ba'i don te /
analyzed: gong du phyag na rdo rjes gsol ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of the request made above by Vajrapāṇi is this.

original: sngags rnams kyi gnas dkyil 'khor rnams gsungs pa ni yid yin par bshad de /
analyzed: sngags rnams kyi gnas dkyil 'khor rnams gsungs pa ni yid yin par bshad de /
translated: The maṇḍalas, which are the abodes of the mantras, are explained as the mind.

original: yid ces pa ni ji bzhin pa dang bcas pa'i sems te /
analyzed: yid ces pa ni ji bzhin pa dang bcas pa'i sems te /
translated: The mind is the mind that is endowed with suchness.

original: nam bdag gi sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i ji bzhin par snang bar gyur pa de nyid gnas zhes bshad do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: nam bdag gi sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i ji bzhin par snang bar gyur pa de nyid gnas zhes bshad do zhes pa ste /
translated: Whenever one's mind appears as the maṇḍala of the moon, and so forth, that itself is explained as the abode.

original: mdor na sngags zlos par byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: mdor na sngags zlos par byed pa'i tshe /
translated: In brief, when one is reciting the mantra,

original: rab tu goms pa'i mthus bdag gi sems nyid zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ji bzhin par gsal bar snang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu goms pa'i mthus bdag gi sems nyid zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ji bzhin par gsal bar snang bar bya'o //
translated: By the power of thorough familiarity, one’s own mind itself should be made to appear clearly, just like the moon mandala, and so on.

original: de bas na gsungs pa sngags rnams kyi gnas snying du shes na 'bras bu thob ces pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa sngags rnams kyi gnas snying du shes na 'bras bu thob ces pa ste /
translated: Therefore it is said, “If the abode of the mantras is known to be the heart, the result is attained.”

original: bdag nyid sems nyid sngags rnams kyi gnas su shes na /
analyzed: bdag nyid sems nyid sngags rnams kyi gnas su shes na /
translated: If one knows that one’s own mind is the abode of the mantras,

original: ting nge 'dzin khugs shing sems sbyong ba'i mtshan ma bas @178a * //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin khugs shing sems sbyong ba'i mtshan ma bas @178a * //
translated: one will master samādhi and the signs of training the mind will arise.

original: te ; des na ji ltar bsam pa'i grub pa la sogs pa 'thob par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: te ; des na ji ltar bsam pa'i grub pa la sogs pa 'thob par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one will attain the accomplishments of whatever one wishes for, and so on.

original: yid kyis bsams pa de yang ni //
analyzed: yid kyis bsams pa de yang ni //
translated: That which is imagined by the mind

original: dkar po ser po dmar po ste //
analyzed: dkar po ser po dmar po ste //
translated: is white, yellow, and red.

original: de la bye brag 'byed pa yang //
analyzed: de la bye brag 'byed pa yang //
translated: That which is differentiated

original: sems kyis kyang ni bya ba yin //
analyzed: sems kyis kyang ni bya ba yin //
translated: is also done by the mind.

original: zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes pa ni /
translated: This is the related statement:

original: sems dpa' chen po yid gnas pa ni /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po yid gnas pa ni /
translated: “The mind of the great being

original: dkyil 'khor rnams ni bshad pa ste //🔽zhes pa'i 'brel pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rnams ni bshad pa ste //🔽zhes pa'i 'brel pa'i tshig ste /
translated: is explained to be the maṇḍala.”

original: yid ji ltar gnas yin pa dang / dkyil 'khor yang gang rnams yin pa bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yid ji ltar gnas yin pa dang / dkyil 'khor yang gang rnams yin pa bstan pa ste /
translated: and the maṇḍalas are also the mind.

original: dbang chen dang chu'i dkyil 'khor dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po la sogs pa rnams yid kyis bsams pa ste /
analyzed: dbang chen dang chu'i dkyil 'khor dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po la sogs pa rnams yid kyis bsams pa ste /
translated: The maṇḍalas of great earth, water, and so on, white, yellow, red, and so on, are imagined by the mind.

original: de rnams bye brag tu 'byed cing yongs su chad par byed pa ni sems nyid de /
analyzed: de rnams bye brag tu 'byed cing yongs su chad par byed pa ni sems nyid de /
translated: The mind itself distinguishes and delineates them.

original: sems kyi dkyil 'khor de rnams gang yang rung ba cig bsams nas /

analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul du sems mgu bar gyur pa de ni sngags rnams kyi gnas snying du shes pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de ru bsam pa padmo ste //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku me long gi dkyil 'khor gyi nang na gnas par bsam pa de nyid zhib tu bshad pa ste /

analyzed: de ru bsam pa padmo ste //

analyzed: padmo dang aa bsam mo zhes pa'i aa de las bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi skur bsam pa ni /

original: yid ni de ltar shes par bya //
analyzed: yid ni de ltar shes par bya //

analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i bye brag bshad pa de rnams kyang sbyor ba bas tshul de ltar bsgom par bya ba bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gsum char la bstod pa yang zhar la bstan pa ste /
translated: Thus, those various explanations of the body of the Tathagata are taught to be cultivated in that way through practice, and the praise of all three bodies of the Tathagata is also incidentally taught.

original: de yi steng du aa de gnas //
analyzed: de yi steng du aa de gnas //

analyzed: zhes pa ni chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin bstan cing bstod pa'o //

original: 'bar ba'i phreng ba bzang pos 'khor //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i phreng ba bzang pos 'khor //
translated: Surrounded by an excellent garland of flames,

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /

analyzed: gtso bo rnams mang gzugs kyang 'chang //

analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku'i rang bzhin du bstod pa'o //
translated: This is a praise of the nature of the saṃbhogakāya.

original: snang ba kun kyang ston pa ste //
analyzed: snang ba kun kyang ston pa ste //
translated: All appearances are also shown,

original: chu nang zla ba 'dug pa bzhin //
analyzed: chu nang zla ba 'dug pa bzhin //

analyzed: zhes pa ni sprul pa'i sku'i rang bzhin la bstod pa'o //
translated: This is a praise of the nature of the nirmāṇakāya.

original: de nas sngags pa ro stod kyi //
analyzed: de nas sngags pa ro stod kyi //

original: zhes pa nas /
analyzed: zhes pa nas /

analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du sbyar ba sbyor ba'i stan sbyar ba las /

original: klad pa'i nang du yi ge aa shin tu dkar ba bsams la /
analyzed: klad pa'i nang du yi ge aa shin tu dkar ba bsams la /

analyzed: mig gi nang du yi ger bsams te //

analyzed: yi ge de'i 'od kyis snying ga nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku bsam pa ste /

analyzed: snang bar bsam pa dang / de rnams bsams nas kyang yi ge ra'i gnas mig gnyis su @179a * //

original: yi ge la bsams te /
analyzed: yi ge la bsams te /

analyzed: ra'i sgra ni de kho na nyid chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par ston pa la dmigs nas /
translated: one should focus on the sound ra, which teaches the reality of all phenomena to be without characteristics,🔽and contemplate all as having the nature of emptiness.

original: thams cad stong pa'i rang bzhin du bsams pa dang / aa la sogs pa'i yi ge dag bsams pa las grub par 'gyur ba dang / de'i rjes su sngags pa rnams 'chad de /

analyzed: yi ge de rnams de ltar bsams pa dang / sems yongs su sbyang ba dang / de rnams sbyar ba las grub pa thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: because one attains accomplishment through contemplating those syllables in that way, purifying the mind, and combining them.

analyzed: de sems yongs su sbyang ba'i rim pa yang thog ma nyid bdag gi lus yi ge aa la sogs pa'i sgo nas ma byung ma skyes par stong par bshigs te ;
translated: The stage of purifying the mind is as follows: First, one’s body is destroyed as empty, not arisen, and not produced through the syllable a and so on.

original: de rnams slar yi ge aa bsams te /
analyzed: de rnams slar yi ge aa bsams te /
translated: Those are again contemplated as the syllable a.

analyzed: aa de las gong ma'i rim bzhin du phyi nang gi dbang gi rdo rje dkyil 'khor dang bcas pa'i lha'i gzugs su bdag gi lus bsgyur te /

analyzed: nang gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad gong du smos pa'i tshul bzhin du bsams te /

analyzed: de nas klad pa'i nang du yi ge'i aa shin tu dkar ba bsams la mig gnyis su bsams te /
translated: Then, in the center of the head, imagine the syllable āḥ, which is very white, and imagine the two eyes.

analyzed: ra de yang chos kyi dbyings kyi yi ge shin tu dkar ba ste / de'i 'od kyis slar snying ga na /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi sku me long nang na bzhugs pa bzhin gsal bar snang bar bya'o//

analyzed: de nas de'i 'od kyis slar yang bsams na yi ge aa de shin tu gsal bar snang bar byas te /

analyzed: de ltar gsal bar brtan par gyur pa yang yi ge ra'i gnas mig gnyis su yi ge klad kor dang bcas par bsams la /
translated: In that way, when the clear appearance becomes stable, imagine the syllable ra in the location of the two eyes, together with the anusvāra.

analyzed: de'i sgra kho na nyid chos thams cad mtshan nyid dang bral ba la dmigs pas /

analyzed: yi ge aa la sogs pa ltar bsams pa thams cad stong par bsam mo //

analyzed: de ltar stong par bsam pa yang brtan par gyur nas /

original: yang bdag gi sems dbang du gyur par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang bdag gi sems dbang du gyur par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: snga ma'i rim bzhin du sbyor ba'i gnas dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi sku snying gar bsams pa dang / klad par aa bsams pa snga ma'i rim bzhin du bya'o //
translated: one should practice as before, visualizing the Bhagavān's form at the heart and the letter A at the head, as before.🔽Similarly, one should repeatedly visualize the letters, make them empty, and again visualize the Bhagavān's form and the letters A and so forth, and make them empty, in order to bring the mind under control.

original: de bzhin du de yang dang yang du yi ge la bsams nas stong par bya ba dang / slar bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs dang aa la sogs pa bsams pa dang / stong par bya ba dag sems la dbang du bya ba'i phyir lan mang du goms par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du de yang dang yang du yi ge la bsams nas stong par bya ba dang / slar bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs dang aa la sogs pa bsams pa dang / stong par bya ba dag sems la dbang du bya ba'i phyir lan mang du goms par bya ba ste /
translated: One should practice this many times.

original: de @179b bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de @179b bas na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

analyzed: de nas sngags pa ro stod kyi //
translated: Then the mantra practitioner, with upper body

analyzed: thod pa'i rim pa'i dbus su ni //

analyzed: klad mtshan 'khor gyis btab bcas pa //

analyzed: aa zhes bya ba de ltar bsams //

analyzed: zhes pa ste de nyid kyi bye brag tu gsungs pa mthong ba rgya che ba dag ste /

analyzed: shel dang zla ba bzhin du gsal //
translated: It is clear like crystal and the moon.

original: zhi ba chos kyi sku yin te //
analyzed: zhi ba chos kyi sku yin te //

analyzed: kun gyi rten zhes bya ba yin // zhes pa ste /

analyzed: bsam pa'i thabs ni gong du bshad pa'i yi ge'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the syllable explained above is as follows.

analyzed: mdor na yi ge aa shel dang zla ba lta bur dkar ba klad kor dang bcas par bsams te /

analyzed: de ni chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: That should be understood as the nature of the dharmakāya.

analyzed: de bas na /

analyzed: kun gyi rten zhes bya ba yin // zhes pa ste chos kyi sku ni thams cad kyi rten te /

translated: The blessing of the speech maṇḍala will be explained here in the chapter of the wheel of syllables.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum ka'i 'khor lo 'dir 'dus mod kyi /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid gsum ka'i 'khor lo 'dir 'dus mod kyi /
translated: Although the maṇḍalas of body, speech, and mind are all included here,

original: ngag gi 'khor lo gtso bo bas ngag gi 'khor lor byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
analyzed: ngag gi 'khor lo gtso bo bas ngag gi 'khor lor byin gyis brlabs pa ste /
translated: The wheel of speech is blessed in the wheel of speech, and so on.

original: gzhan yang med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang med pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not nonexistent.

original: de la dkyil 'khor dang po bri bar brtsams pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor dang po bri bar brtsams pa'i tshe /
translated: When one begins to draw the first mandala,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon rang gi ting nge 'dzin rnam par bshad pa gang yang rung ba la dmigs te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon rang gi ting nge 'dzin rnam par bshad pa gang yang rung ba la dmigs te /
translated: the mandala master focuses on any explanation of meditative concentration.

original: bdag dang 'khor thams cad bsrung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag dang 'khor thams cad bsrung ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to protect oneself and the entire retinue,

original: rig pa 'di lan gsum mam bdun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas par byas te /
analyzed: rig pa 'di lan gsum mam bdun nam nyi shu rtsa gcig bzlas par byas te /
translated: one should recite this awareness three, seven, or twenty-one times.

original: rig pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis rig pa de'i don rnam par grol ba'i ting nge 'dzin dmigs nas sngags bshad par mdzad pa ni /
analyzed: rig pa de bcom ldan 'das kyis rig pa de'i don rnam par grol ba'i ting nge 'dzin dmigs nas sngags bshad par mdzad pa ni /
translated: The Blessed One, having focused on the meaning of that awareness, the meditative concentration of liberation, explained the mantra.

original: de nas @180a * //
analyzed: de nas @180a * //
translated: Then the Blessed One...

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas rig pa'i rgyal mo 'byung ngo zhes pa'i bar du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa nas rig pa'i rgyal mo 'byung ngo zhes pa'i bar du gsungs pa'o //
translated: up to...the queen of awarenesses.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis thams cad srung ba'i 'khor la gzigs nas zhes pa de la thams cad srung ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis thams cad srung ba'i 'khor la gzigs nas zhes pa de la thams cad srung ba zhes pa ni /
translated: Then, the Bhagavat Vairocana, having looked at the entire retinue of protectors,

original: 'khor byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje de sems can thams cad la srung zhing skyob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor byang chub sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje de sems can thams cad la srung zhing skyob pa'i phyir ro //
