translated: in that, the entire retinue of protectors is the bodhisattva Vajrapani, because he protects and saves all sentient beings.

original: yang na gcig tu na thams cad dang ldan pa ni 'khor de dag nyid thams cad nyid dang ldan pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang na gcig tu na thams cad dang ldan pa ni 'khor de dag nyid thams cad nyid dang ldan pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Or, in another way, the entire retinue is the meaning of all of them.

original: gzigs pa rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir 'khor la gzigs pa chos nyid kyis de bzhin te /
analyzed: gzigs pa rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir 'khor la gzigs pa chos nyid kyis de bzhin te /
translated: He looks at the retinue because of two kinds of vision, as is the nature of the Dharma.

original: 'khor sems can 'dus par bskul ba dang snod du gyur tam ma gyur brtag pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor sems can 'dus par bskul ba dang snod du gyur tam ma gyur brtag pa ste /
translated: He exhorts the retinue of assembled sentient beings to investigate whether they are vessels or not.

original: 'di'i skabs su 'khor de dag la mi dgos pa phyi ma la bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su 'khor de dag la mi dgos pa phyi ma la bstan pa'o //
translated: In this context, he teaches the retinue what is not necessary for them in the future.

original: byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen po'i spyan gyis sems can thams cad kyi khams la gzigs zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid ni rtag tu rtog pa thams cad dang bral bas gzigs shing rtog pa yang mi
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen po'i spyan gyis sems can thams cad kyi khams la gzigs zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid ni rtag tu rtog pa thams cad dang bral bas gzigs shing rtog pa yang mi
translated: The line “with eyes of great love and great compassion, he looked at the element of all sentient beings” means that the Bhagavān, through nonabiding nirvāṇa, always sees and is free from all thoughts.

original: 'byung mod kyi //
analyzed: 'byung mod kyi //
translated: However, thoughts do not arise.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs thugs rje chen po'i yum dang / byams pa chen po'i dbang gis na /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs thugs rje chen po'i yum dang / byams pa chen po'i dbang gis na /
translated: Through the power of his previous aspirations, the mother of great compassion and the power of great love,

original: sems can thams cad kyi khams la gzigs pa ni /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi khams la gzigs pa ni /
translated: he looks at the element of all sentient beings.

original: ma grol ba dgrol ba dang ma smin pa smin par bya ba'i phyir rig pa bshad par dgongs so //
analyzed: ma grol ba dgrol ba dang ma smin pa smin par bya ba'i phyir rig pa bshad par dgongs so //
translated: He thinks to explain the knowledge in order to liberate those who are not liberated and to ripen those who are not ripened.

original: mi 'chi ba zhes pa'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhugs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mi 'chi ba zhes pa'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhugs zhes pa ni /
translated: The line “he rested in the meditative equipoise of the samādhi called immortality” means

original: de la mi 'chi ba ni 'chi bar 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la mi 'chi ba ni 'chi bar 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: that immortality is because there is no death.

original: de ni chos kyi sku stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni chos kyi sku stong pa nyid do //
translated: That is the empty dharmakāya.

original: de la dmigs te ting nge 'dzin 'byung bas na /
analyzed: de la dmigs te ting nge 'dzin 'byung bas na /
translated: Since the samādhi arises by observing that,

original: mi 'chi ba las 'byung zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'chi ba las 'byung zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “arising from immortality.”

original: yang na mi 'chi ba de nyid ting nge 'dzin 'di las 'byung bas na /
analyzed: yang na mi 'chi ba de nyid ting nge 'dzin 'di las 'byung bas na /
translated: Or, since immortality itself arises from this samādhi,

original: mi 'chi ba las 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: mi 'chi ba las 'byung ba ste /
translated: it is “arising from immortality.”

original: byang chub pa las chos kyi sku'i ye shes 'byung ba zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: byang chub pa las chos kyi sku'i ye shes 'byung ba zhes pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that the wisdom of the dharmakāya arises from awakening.

original: ting nge 'dzin de las mnyam par bzhugs nas rig pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de las mnyam par bzhugs nas rig pa gsungs so //
translated: Having remained in equipoise in that samādhi, he spoke the knowledge.🔽The Bhagavān said, “The queen of the three times of nonattachment arises from all the limbs.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yan lag thams cad nas dus gsum du ma chags pa'i rgyal mo 'byung zhes pa de la bcom ldan 'das kyis yan lag thams cad ces pa ni rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i sku dang / snying po byang chub pa'i sku'i yan lag thams cad nas byung ba ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yan lag thams cad nas dus gsum du ma chags pa'i rgyal mo 'byung zhes pa de la bcom ldan 'das kyis yan lag thams cad ces pa ni rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i sku dang / snying po byang chub pa'i sku'i yan lag thams cad nas byung ba ste /
translated: In that regard, the Bhagavān said, “All the limbs” means that it arises from all the limbs of the body of perfect enjoyment, the body of manifestation, and the body of awakening to the essence.

original: stong pa nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i @180b ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas zhal nas tshig tu 'byung ba'i mi rigs shes nas yan lag nas byung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnam par mi rtog pa'i @180b ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas zhal nas tshig tu 'byung ba'i mi rigs shes nas yan lag nas byung zhes pa'o //
translated: Since he abides in the samādhi of nonconceptual emptiness, it is not reasonable that it arises from the mouth as words. Therefore, it arises from the limbs.

original: de la dus gsum la ma chags pa'i stobs zhes pa ni snga ma 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus la stong pa nyid chos kyis dbyings kyis de la dmigs pa'i skye ba mthu dang ldan pa ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: de la dus gsum la ma chags pa'i stobs zhes pa ni snga ma 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi dus la stong pa nyid chos kyis dbyings kyis de la dmigs pa'i skye ba mthu dang ldan pa ni don dam pa'o //
translated: The power of non-attachment to the three times is the ultimate, the powerful arising of the objective emptiness of the realm of phenomena that focuses on that in the past, future, and present times.

original: rig pa 'di'i mthus bdud rgol ba thams cad kyis bgegs byed par mi tshugs pa ni kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'di'i mthus bdud rgol ba thams cad kyis bgegs byed par mi tshugs pa ni kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: The power of knowledge is the relative, the fact that all the māras who oppose it cannot create obstacles by the power of this knowledge.

original: rig pa zhes pa ni shes pa'i don te /
analyzed: rig pa zhes pa ni shes pa'i don te /
translated: The word knowledge means the meaning of wisdom.

original: 'di'i skabs su byang chub pa'i shes rab nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su byang chub pa'i shes rab nyid la bya'o //
translated: In this context, it should be understood as the wisdom of enlightenment.

original: rgyal mo zhes pa ni shes rab thams cad kyi nang na byang chub pa'i mchog pas na rgyal mo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyal mo zhes pa ni shes rab thams cad kyi nang na byang chub pa'i mchog pas na rgyal mo zhes bya ste /
translated: The queen is called the queen because it is the supreme among all wisdoms.

original: de bas na rig pa 'di yang byang chub nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rig pa 'di yang byang chub nyid kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin byin gyis brlabs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, this knowledge is also blessed with the nature of the wisdom of enlightenment itself.

original: rig pa de'i rang bzhin gzugs bstan par gsungs pa /
analyzed: rig pa de'i rang bzhin gzugs bstan par gsungs pa /
translated: The nature of that knowledge is taught to be the form of the deity.

original: rigs kyi bu rig pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang mi gnyis pa'i spyod yul zhes so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rig pa 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang mi gnyis pa'i spyod yul zhes so //
translated: Son of noble family, this knowledge is the domain of non-duality with the body of the Tathāgata.

original: de la ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes pa ni chos kyi sku de dang / rig pa 'di dang gnyis spyod yul gnyis su med pa ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa 'dra ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de la ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zhes pa ni chos kyi sku de dang / rig pa 'di dang gnyis spyod yul gnyis su med pa ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa 'dra ba'i phyir ro /
translated: Here, the so-called body of the Tathāgata is the dharmakāya, and this knowledge and that domain are non-dual because they are similar in observing suchness.

original: rig pa 'di'i mthu chen po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rig pa 'di'i mthu chen po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the great power of this knowledge,

original: gsungs pa 'dis byin gyis brlabs zhes pa nas sdug bsngal 'gags zhes pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa 'dis byin gyis brlabs zhes pa nas sdug bsngal 'gags zhes pa'i bar du ste /
translated: it is said from “this knowledge blesses” up to “suffering ceases.”

original: rig pa 'dis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad byin gyis brlabs pa na /
analyzed: rig pa 'dis sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad byin gyis brlabs pa na /
translated: When all buddhas and bodhisattvas are blessed by this knowledge,

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thogs pa med pa gang sdug bsngal 'gags pa thob pa zhes pa'i don te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos thogs pa med pa gang sdug bsngal 'gags pa thob pa zhes pa'i don te //
translated: those buddhas and bodhisattvas attain the unobstructed dharmas of non-abiding nirvāṇa, which is the meaning of “attaining the cessation of suffering.”

original: de la sangs rgyas dang zhes pa ni bla na med par sangs rgyas pa la mi bya ste /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas dang zhes pa ni bla na med par sangs rgyas pa la mi bya ste /
translated: Here, buddhas does not refer to those who have fully awakened to unsurpassed enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa bcur phyin pa dbang bcu thob pa'i sangs rgyas de la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa bcur phyin pa dbang bcu thob pa'i sangs rgyas de la bya'o //
translated: It refers to those buddhas who are bodhisattvas who have reached the ten grounds and attained the ten powers.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de las gzhan pa 'phags pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de las gzhan pa 'phags pa'i sa la gnas pa rnams la bya'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas refers to those who abide on the other noble grounds.

original: ma chags pa'i chos zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: ma chags pa'i chos zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The term unattached phenomena refers to the nature of non-abiding nirvana.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa med pas na ma chags pa'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa med pas na ma chags pa'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Since there are no afflictive or cognitive obscurations, it is called unattached.

original: yang ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: gang na sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa 'gags zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gang na sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa 'gags zhes pa ste /
translated: It is said, Where the aspects of suffering cease,

original: phung po'i sdug bsngal rnams mya ngan las 'das zhes pa'i chos de la med @181a * //
analyzed: phung po'i sdug bsngal rnams mya ngan las 'das zhes pa'i chos de la med @181a * //
translated: in that phenomenon called nirvana, the sufferings of the aggregates cease.

original: ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: ces pa'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of do not exist.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yi ge dkyil 'khor gyi spyod pa'i 'khor rnams la bshad par bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis yi ge dkyil 'khor gyi spyod pa'i 'khor rnams la bshad par bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One declared, I will explain to the retinue of the maṇḍala of letters.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad ces pa nas /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad ces pa nas /
translated: Then, the Bhagavat Vairocana, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi byed pa la 'jug par gnas zhes pa'i bar du'o//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi byed pa la 'jug par gnas zhes pa'i bar du'o//
translated: up to: enters into the activity of the Buddha.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la rjes su dgongs zhes pa ni phyi ma'i sems can dang ma 'ongs pa'i sems can rnams ci rtsom na yang /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la rjes su dgongs zhes pa ni phyi ma'i sems can dang ma 'ongs pa'i sems can rnams ci rtsom na yang /
translated: There, the thought of all the Tathagatas, etc. means that whatever future sentient beings and sentient beings of the future undertake,

original: dang por de bzhin gshegs pa rjes su dran par gyis shig ces lung bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dang por de bzhin gshegs pa rjes su dran par gyis shig ces lung bstan pa'o //
translated: first they should remember the Tathagata.

original: bdag nyid dang phyag na rdo rje thog ma nas ma skyes par byin gyis brlabs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bdag nyid dang phyag na rdo rje thog ma nas ma skyes par byin gyis brlabs zhes pa ni /
translated: The consecration of oneself and Vajrapani as primordially unborn, etc.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the mandala is as follows:

original: 'chad pa dang nyan pa gnyis ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhugs nas bshad cing nyan pa'i tshul te /
analyzed: 'chad pa dang nyan pa gnyis ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhugs nas bshad cing nyan pa'i tshul te /
translated: The teacher and the listener, both of them, having entered into the samadhi, explain and listen in the manner of explanation and listening.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das 'chad pa nyid dang / phyag na rdo rje nyan pa gnyis ma skyes pa'i chos stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhugs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das 'chad pa nyid dang / phyag na rdo rje nyan pa gnyis ma skyes pa'i chos stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhugs pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One teaching and Vajrapāṇi listening are both shown to be in equipoise in the meditative concentration of emptiness, the non-arisen Dharma.

original: de yang ting nge 'dzin la ma zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: de yang ting nge 'dzin la ma zhugs pa ni /
translated: Moreover, one who has not entered meditative concentration

original: spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is not a suitable recipient.

original: de bas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis kyang /
analyzed: de bas dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis kyang /
translated: Therefore, the maṇḍala master

original: dkyil 'khor dang por rtsom pa'i tshe /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor dang por rtsom pa'i tshe /
translated: at the time of beginning the first maṇḍala

original: bdag nyid kyang byin gyis brlabs /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang byin gyis brlabs /
translated: should also bless himself🔽and the vajra bestowing the supreme boon that assists him.

original: grogs byed pa'i rdo rje mchog sbyin gyis byin gyis rlabs shig ces pa de bas rang ngam slob dpon gyis stong pa nyid du byin gyis brlab po //🔽yi ge'i 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor la spyod pa'i le'u rgyas par zhes pa de la yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba zhes pa ni /
analyzed: grogs byed pa'i rdo rje mchog sbyin gyis byin gyis rlabs shig ces pa de bas rang ngam slob dpon gyis stong pa nyid du byin gyis brlab po // yi ge'i 'khor lo bskor ba zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor la spyod pa'i le'u rgyas par zhes pa de la yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba zhes pa ni /
translated: Therefore, either oneself or the master should bless emptiness.🔽The chapter on the extensive maṇḍala practice called “The Turning of the Wheel of Syllables” is as follows.

original: gcig tu ni 'khor lo bzhin du yi ges bskor ba ste /
analyzed: gcig tu ni 'khor lo bzhin du yi ges bskor ba ste /
translated: In one way, it is called “the turning of the wheel of syllables” because the maṇḍala is turned by the syllables, like a wheel.

original: yi ge aa dbus su bzhag la ka la sogs pas mtha' bskor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge aa dbus su bzhag la ka la sogs pas mtha' bskor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the letter A is placed in the middle and the rest of the letters surround it.

original: gnyis su ni 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor du yi ger bsgyur bas na yi ge'i 'khor lo bskor ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis su ni 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor du yi ger bsgyur bas na yi ge'i 'khor lo bskor ba ste /
translated: In the second sense, the wheel of letters is the wheel of the mandala, because the letters are transformed into the mandala.

original: dkyil 'khor der gzugs yi ge'i 'brur bsgyur te bkod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor der gzugs yi ge'i 'brur bsgyur te bkod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the forms of the deities are arranged in the mandala in the form of the letters.

original: spyod pa zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi las su bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: spyod pa zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi las su bya ba rnams so //
translated: The performance is the performance of the mandala rites.

original: le'u zhes pa ni de nyid kyi gzhung gi le'u'o //
analyzed: le'u zhes pa ni de nyid kyi gzhung gi le'u'o //
translated: The chapter is the chapter of the text on that mandala.

original: rgyas pa zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor der slob ma'i sems rgyud la bsod nams kyi tshogs shin tu 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor der slob ma'i sems rgyud la bsod nams kyi tshogs shin tu 'phel ba'o //
translated: The expansion is the great increase of the accumulation of merit in the mindstream of the disciples in that mandala.

original: dkyil 'khor de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de yang ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that mandala like?

original: rang bzhin bstan par gsungs pa sngags kyi sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa @181b rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi bya ba la zhugs zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin bstan par gsungs pa sngags kyi sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa @181b rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi bya ba la zhugs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is said to be the natural mandala, for those who practice the bodhisattva deeds through the door of mantra are engaged in the deeds of the buddhas.

original: de las sangs rgyas kyi bya ba ni tshe 'di dang pha rol du mngon par 'char ba dang / bde ba ma lus pa'i 'bras bu thob par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de las sangs rgyas kyi bya ba ni tshe 'di dang pha rol du mngon par 'char ba dang / bde ba ma lus pa'i 'bras bu thob par mdzad pa'o //
translated: From that, the activity of the Buddha is the manifestation in this life and the next, and the attainment of the result of all bliss.

original: de bzhin du sngags spyod pa rnams la dkyil 'khor 'di'i tshul gyis tshe 'di dang pha rol du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pas na /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags spyod pa rnams la dkyil 'khor 'di'i tshul gyis tshe 'di dang pha rol du 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'bras bu thob par byed pas na /
translated: Similarly, for those who practice mantra, through the method of this mandala, the attainment of the mundane and transcendent results in this life and the next is the activity of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bya ba la zhugs pas ni dkyil 'khor 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bya ba la zhugs pas ni dkyil 'khor 'di lta ste /
translated: Since one engages in the activity of the Buddha, this is the mandala.

original: de bshad kyis nyon cig ces pa'i don to /
analyzed: de bshad kyis nyon cig ces pa'i don to /
translated: Since it is explained like that, listen.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yi ges 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi spyod pa bshad par gnang nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yi ges 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi spyod pa bshad par gnang nas /
translated: Having granted permission to explain the mandala conduct of the wheel of syllables turned by the Bhagavān,

original: phyag na rdo rje des shin tu mgu nas bcom ldan 'das la yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa yang gcig tu na dkyil 'khor 'di'i nang nas bcom ldan 'das rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yon tan 'byung ba rnams kyi sgo nas bstod pa'i phyir gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje des shin tu mgu nas bcom ldan 'das la yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa yang gcig tu na dkyil 'khor 'di'i nang nas bcom ldan 'das rgyu dang 'bras bu'i yon tan 'byung ba rnams kyi sgo nas bstod pa'i phyir gsungs pa'o //
translated: Vajrapāṇi, being very pleased, praises the Bhagavān with his qualities. In one way, it is said in order to praise the Bhagavān from the perspective of the qualities of cause and effect that arise within this maṇḍala.

original: de nas phyag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das la 'dis mngon par bstod do zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das la 'dis mngon par bstod do zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi praises the Bhagavān with this.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir phyag 'tshal te /
translated: There, in order to generate respect for the Bhagavān, he prostrates.

original: rdo rje'i tshul du bab ces pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshul du bab ces pa ste /
translated: He says, Falling in the vajra way.

original: rdo rje'i tshul du babs pa ni g-yeng zhing 'grogs pa med par brtan por babs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshul du babs pa ni g-yeng zhing 'grogs pa med par brtan por babs pa'o //
translated: Falling in the vajra way means falling firmly without distraction or companionship.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni yon tan rnam lnga'i sgo nas bstod de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni yon tan rnam lnga'i sgo nas bstod de /
translated: Bhagavān is praised from the perspective of five qualities.

original: byang chub sems kyi sgo nas bstod pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i spyod pa'i sgo nas bstod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de ma thag pa'i lam gyi sgo nas bstod pa dang / kun du sangs rgyas pa'i yon tan dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi sgo nas bstod pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i spyod pa'i sgo nas bstod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i de ma thag pa'i lam gyi sgo nas bstod pa dang / kun du sangs rgyas pa'i yon tan dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa ste /
translated: The praise in terms of the enlightenment mind, the praise in terms of the conduct of cause and effect, the praise in terms of the Tathagata's immediate path, and the praise in terms of the qualities of universal enlightenment and the qualities of nirvana.

original: yon tan gyi go rims kyang 'di ltar rigs na /
analyzed: yon tan gyi go rims kyang 'di ltar rigs na /
translated: If the order of the qualities is like this,

original: tshigs bcad la mi bde ba'i phyir ltag 'og 'brel par gsungs so //
analyzed: tshigs bcad la mi bde ba'i phyir ltag 'og 'brel par gsungs so //
translated: because of the inconvenience of the verses, they are taught in reverse order.

original: de la phyag 'tshal byang chub sems khyod la //
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal byang chub sems khyod la //
translated: To you, O enlightenment mind, I pay homage.

original: zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po yan chad la bya mod kyi /
analyzed: zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po yan chad la bya mod kyi /
translated: Although the Bodhisattva refers to those on the first Bodhisattva stage and above,

original: 'di'i skabs su sa dang po la sogs pa rnams dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo nas bstod zin pas na de la mi bya'i 'dir rtsol ba'i byang chub mos pa spyod pa'i sa la bya ste /
analyzed: 'di'i skabs su sa dang po la sogs pa rnams dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo nas bstod zin pas na de la mi bya'i 'dir rtsol ba'i byang chub mos pa spyod pa'i sa la bya ste /
translated: in this context, since the first stage and so forth have already been praised in terms of the perfections, it is not those that are referred to here, but rather the striving Bodhisattva on the stage of action from belief.

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyu yin pas na rgyu de las de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'bras bu'i ming btags te /
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyu yin pas na rgyu de las de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'bras bu'i ming btags te /
translated: Moreover, since it is the cause of the Tathagata, the name of the result, the Tathagata, is given to the cause.

original: byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba khyod la phyag 'tshal lo zhes @182a * //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba khyod la phyag 'tshal lo zhes @182a * //
translated: Homage to you, source of the Thought of Enlightenment!

original: so ; / byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba khyod la phyag kyang 'tshal zhes pa ni /
analyzed: so ; / byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba khyod la phyag kyang 'tshal zhes pa ni /
translated: Homage to you, source of the Thought of Enlightenment!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de ma thag lam gyi yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i de ma thag lam gyi yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa ste /
translated: This is praise in terms of the qualities of the Tathagata's path of immediately preceding the goal.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu las 'das pas na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu las 'das pas na /
translated: Since he has gone beyond the ten Bodhisattva stages,

original: snying po byang chub ma thob kyi bar du de ma thag pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: snying po byang chub ma thob kyi bar du de ma thag pa'i lam ste /
translated: the path of immediately preceding the goal is until he attains the essence of enlightenment.

original: de la byang chub 'byung bas na /
analyzed: de la byang chub 'byung bas na /
translated: Since enlightenment arises from that,

original: byang chub 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: it is called the source of enlightenment.

original: spyod pa'i gzugs zhes pa ni rgyu'i spyod pa dang 'bras bu'i spyod pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: spyod pa'i gzugs zhes pa ni rgyu'i spyod pa dang 'bras bu'i spyod pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The form of conduct is the two kinds of conduct, the causal and the resultant.

original: 'bras bu'i spyod pa ni lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi 'khor lo spyod pas 'jig rten gsum du khyab par ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i spyod pa ni lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi 'khor lo spyod pas 'jig rten gsum du khyab par ston pa'o //
translated: The resultant conduct is the display of the three wheels of body, speech, and mind, which pervade the three worlds with conduct.

original: rgyu'i spyod pa'i gzugs ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu'i spyod pa'i gzugs ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams so //
translated: The causal form of conduct is the levels and the perfections.

original: thog mar mdzad pa la sogs pa la phyag 'tshal zhes pa ni /
analyzed: thog mar mdzad pa la sogs pa la phyag 'tshal zhes pa ni /
translated: The homage at the beginning and so forth is as follows.

original: kun du sangs rgyas pa'i yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa ste /
analyzed: kun du sangs rgyas pa'i yon tan gyi sgo nas bstod pa ste /
translated: It is a praise from the perspective of the qualities of complete buddhahood.

original: chos rnams dang po nas ji lta ba bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las bral pa stong pa nyid pas na de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams dang po nas ji lta ba bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa las bral pa stong pa nyid pas na de la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'o //
translated: Since phenomena are empty from the beginning, free from the apprehended and the apprehender, just as they are, homage is paid to that.

original: stong nyid la 'dug phyag 'tshal te //
analyzed: stong nyid la 'dug phyag 'tshal te //
translated: Homage to emptiness,

original: zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyi sgo nas bstod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyi sgo nas bstod pa ste /
translated: is a praise from the perspective of the nature of nirvana.

original: chos thams cad ma byung ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ma byung ma skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la phyag 'tshal lo zhes pa'o //
translated: Homage is paid to the nonabiding nirvana, the essence of all phenomena that is unarisen and unborn.

original: de nas phyag na rdo rjes dkyil 'khor de bshad par gsol zhes pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de nas phyag na rdo rjes dkyil 'khor de bshad par gsol zhes pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Then, in order to request Vajrapani to explain that mandala, it says:

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa nas bshad du gsol zhes pa'i bar du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to zhes pa nas bshad du gsol zhes pa'i bar du gsungs pa ste /
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi said to the Lord, Please explain the mandala procedure.

original: de la bdag gis rig nas zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi tshul bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad de zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la bdag gis rig nas zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor gyi tshul bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad de zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Here, I understand means that the Lord has explained the mandala procedure.

original: de la phyag na rdo rje thob pa'i chos dang ldan pa yin pas na /
analyzed: de la phyag na rdo rje thob pa'i chos dang ldan pa yin pas na /
translated: There, since Vajrapāṇi possesses the Dharma of attainment,

original: bcom ldan 'das des lugs kyi chos bshad pa de thos nas sems can gyi don bya ba dang sngags tshul rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa de ni mi rigs so zhes so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das des lugs kyi chos bshad pa de thos nas sems can gyi don bya ba dang sngags tshul rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa de ni mi rigs so zhes so //
translated: having heard that Dharma of procedure explained by that Lord, it is not right to accomplish the benefit of sentient beings and the mantra method.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thob pa'i chos nyid la gnas pas lugs kyi chos mnyan te /
analyzed: thob pa'i chos nyid la gnas pas lugs kyi chos mnyan te /
translated: Because one who abides in the Dharma of attainment should not listen to the Dharma of procedure,

original: sems can gyi don bya ba la sogs pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba la sogs pa mi rigs so //
translated: and it is not right to accomplish the benefit of sentient beings and so forth.

original: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gcig tu na bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad pa gces shing btsun par bstod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gcig tu na bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bshad pa gces shing btsun par bstod pa'i phyir te /
translated: In one sense, it is to praise the Dharma explained by the Lord as precious and venerable.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos de bshad pas na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos de bshad pas na /
translated: Because the Lord explained that Dharma,🔽the benefit of sentient beings and the mantra method will be accomplished.

original: phyag na rdo rje lta bu thob pa dang ldan pas kyang thos nas yon tan gyi bye brag thob par 'gyur na @182b gzhan lta ci smos zhes 'jig rten gyis shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje lta bu thob pa dang ldan pas kyang thos nas yon tan gyi bye brag thob par 'gyur na @182b gzhan lta ci smos zhes 'jig rten gyis shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in order to make the world understand that even those who have attained the state of Vajrapani will obtain specific qualities by listening to the Dharma, let alone others.

original: yang gcig tu na phyag na rdo rje thob pa'i chos dang ldan mod kyi /🔽lugs kyi chos rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das las mnyan te /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na phyag na rdo rje thob pa'i chos dang ldan mod kyi / lugs kyi chos rnams kyang bcom ldan 'das las mnyan te /
translated: Moreover, even though Vajrapani possesses the Dharma of attainment,🔽he still listens to the Dharma from the Blessed One in order to benefit sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don mdzad par gyur na yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: sems can gyi don mdzad par gyur na yang nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in this.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas na /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pas na /
translated: Then, since the Blessed One is in non-abiding nirvana,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa la zhugs pa las chos gsungs pa'i tshig de 'byung ba mi rigs te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa la zhugs pa las chos gsungs pa'i tshig de 'byung ba mi rigs te /
translated: it is not reasonable for the words of the Dharma to arise from one who has entered non-conceptuality.

original: yang na ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshig nyams par 'gyur ro zhes pa de 'dra ba'i klan kar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i tshig nyams par 'gyur ro zhes pa de 'dra ba'i klan kar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Or else, the words of non-conceptuality would be impaired. In order to avoid such criticism,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzogs longs spyod pa dang sprul pa'i skus chos kyang bshad la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis rdzogs longs spyod pa dang sprul pa'i skus chos kyang bshad la /
translated: the Blessed One teaches the Dharma with his enjoyment body and emanation body.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin las kyang nyams pa med par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa de ni dang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ting nge 'dzin las kyang nyams pa med par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa de ni dang po'o //
translated: The first is stated in order to demonstrate that there is no degeneration from the nonconceptual concentration.

original: 'jig rten gyis zhes pa nas las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis zhes pa nas las kyi rnam par smin pa zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The second is from “the world” up to “the maturation of karma.”

original: de la dang po'i 'jig rten pa chos bstan pas ni mi rtog pa'i tshul las chos bshad pa mi 'byung ba ma yin par bstan te /
analyzed: de la dang po'i 'jig rten pa chos bstan pas ni mi rtog pa'i tshul las chos bshad pa mi 'byung ba ma yin par bstan te /
translated: Among them, the first, the teaching of the Dharma to the worldly, demonstrates that the teaching of the Dharma does not occur from the mode of nonconceptuality.

original: de la thog ma'i 'jig rten pa dang zhes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te dag pa dang ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: de la thog ma'i 'jig rten pa dang zhes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te dag pa dang ma dag pa'o //
translated: Here, the worldly at the beginning is twofold: pure and impure.

original: de la dag pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po can rnams te /
analyzed: de la dag pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po can rnams te /
translated: Among them, the pure are those who possess the first bodhisattva stage.

original: de rnams sngar byung nas phyis mngon par chos bshad pa mi 'byung ba ma yin par bstan pa ste /🔽de la thog ma'i 'jig rten sangs rgyas pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: de rnams sngar byung nas phyis mngon par chos bshad pa mi 'byung ba ma yin par bstan pa ste / de la thog ma'i 'jig rten sangs rgyas pa'i phyir na /
translated: It is taught that after they arise, the teaching of the Dharma does not occur later.🔽Here, the worldly at the beginning are the buddhas.

original: de rnams snga ma'i 'jig rten pa //
analyzed: de rnams snga ma'i 'jig rten pa //
translated: Therefore, they are the worldly at the beginning.

original: zhes pa'o // de ma thag pa'i dngos po 'jig rten pa ni bskal pa chen pos bshig pa'i 'og tu dang po 'jig rten byung ba'i tshe tshangs pa dang / brgya byin la sogs pa dang / dang po nyid du 'byung bas na dang po 'jig rten pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de ma thag pa'i dngos po 'jig rten pa ni bskal pa chen pos bshig pa'i 'og tu dang po 'jig rten byung ba'i tshe tshangs pa dang / brgya byin la sogs pa dang / dang po nyid du 'byung bas na dang po 'jig rten pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Since Brahma, Indra, and so on arise first, they are called the first mundane entities.

original: de dag la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnam pa gsum du bshad pas na /
analyzed: de dag la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos rnam pa gsum du bshad pas na /
translated: Since the Bhagavat explained the three dharmas to them,

original: de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'jig rten gyi mgon po zhes bsgrags so ;
analyzed: de dag gis bcom ldan 'das la 'jig rten gyi mgon po zhes bsgrags so ;
translated: they proclaimed the Bhagavat as the protector of the world.

original: / de la chos rnam pa gsum bshad pa de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: / de la chos rnam pa gsum bshad pa de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three dharmas that he explained?

original: mtshungs pa med pa'i chos dang thog ma nas zhi ba dang bla na med pa'i chos so //
analyzed: mtshungs pa med pa'i chos dang thog ma nas zhi ba dang bla na med pa'i chos so //
translated: They are the incomparable dharma, the peaceful dharma from the beginning, and the unsurpassed dharma.

original: de rnams kyang 'jug pa dang sbyor ba dang 'bras bu'i bye brag tu blta ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyang 'jug pa dang sbyor ba dang 'bras bu'i bye brag tu blta ste /
translated: Those should be viewed in terms of their entry, application, and result.

original: de la mtshungs pa med ces pa ni bla na med par 'jug pa'i chos te /
analyzed: de la mtshungs pa med ces pa ni bla na med par 'jug pa'i chos te /
translated: The incomparable dharma is the entry to the unsurpassed dharma.

original: @183a * // gang mtshan ma la gnas she na /
analyzed: @183a * // gang mtshan ma la gnas she na /
translated: What is it to abide in signs?

original: bka' stsal pa dge ba bcu dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: bka' stsal pa dge ba bcu dang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: He replied, “The ten virtues and the virtuous dharmas such as generosity.”

original: de yang 'jig rten pa phyi rol mu stegs kyi chos dang mi mtshungs pas na mtshungs pa med pa'i phyar ro //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten pa phyi rol mu stegs kyi chos dang mi mtshungs pas na mtshungs pa med pa'i phyar ro //
translated: And since those are not the same as the non-Buddhist, tīrthika dharmas of the world, they are “unequaled.”

original: thog ma nas zhi zhes pa ni sangs rgyas par spyod pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma nas zhi zhes pa ni sangs rgyas par spyod pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: “Peace from the beginning” is the stage of conduct in the Buddha Vehicle.

original: chos thams cad rgyu rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir na thog ma nas zhi ba'o zhes par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rgyu rkyen gyis bskyed pa'i phyir na thog ma nas zhi ba'o zhes par bstan pa'o //
translated: Since all dharmas are produced by causes and conditions, it is taught that they are “peace from the beginning.”

original: de la bla na med pa zhes pa ni 'jug pa dang sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de la bla na med pa zhes pa ni 'jug pa dang sbyor ba'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: “Unsurpassed” is the result of engagement and application.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i sa bstan pa'o //
translated: It is the stage of nonabiding nirvāṇa.

original: de ltar chos bstan cing 'chad mod kyi rnam par mi rtog pa las nyams pa med par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa de ltar byin gyis brlabs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar chos bstan cing 'chad mod kyi rnam par mi rtog pa las nyams pa med par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa de ltar byin gyis brlabs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Although the Dharma is taught and explained in that way, it is said that there is no degeneration from nonconceptuality.

original: de la de ltar byin gyis brlabs zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la de ltar byin gyis brlabs zhes pa ni /
translated: “Thus blessed” means

original: byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po bsam pa yongs su dag pa la sogs pa ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyi rlabs kyis 'od la sogs pas bskul ba de lta bus byin gyis brlabs nas snying po byang chub na bzhugs pa'i sku mthong bar bstan
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kun du bzang po bsam pa yongs su dag pa la sogs pa ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis byin gyi rlabs kyis 'od la sogs pas bskul ba de lta bus byin gyis brlabs nas snying po byang chub na bzhugs pa'i sku mthong bar bstan
translated: The bodhisattvas Samantabhadra, Pure Intention, and so on, were blessed by the Lord in such a way that they were urged by light and so on, and then they revealed the body that was present in the heart of enlightenment.

original: to // de dag gi snying po byang chub kyi sku mthong ba de ci lta bur mthong zhe na /
analyzed: to // de dag gi snying po byang chub kyi sku mthong ba de ci lta bur mthong zhe na /
translated: What was the vision of the body in the heart of enlightenment like?

original: nam mkha' lta bur spros pa med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bur spros pa med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It was like space, free from conceptual elaboration, and so on.

original: nam mkha' gzhan zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od dang dri ma med pa stod pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' gzhan zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od dang dri ma med pa stod pa nyid kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Space is other than that, because it is the nature of the intrinsic light and the absence of defilement.

original: spros pa med pa zhes pa na ning gi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: spros pa med pa zhes pa na ning gi yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Free from conceptual elaboration means that it is free from all the conceptual thoughts of the mental consciousness.

original: spyod pa dang mi gnyis par sbyor ba zhes pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyis 'khor lo spyod pa dang / snying po byang chub kyi sku mi gnyis par sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: spyod pa dang mi gnyis par sbyor ba zhes pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid gsum gyis 'khor lo spyod pa dang / snying po byang chub kyi sku mi gnyis par sbyor ba ste /
translated: The phrase “the performance of conduct without duality” means that the performance of conduct with the body, speech, and mind is without duality, and that the performance of conduct with the body of enlightenment at the site of enlightenment is without duality.

original: de nyid rang bzhin dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid rang bzhin dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because those two are inseparable by nature.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa lta bu zhes pa ni /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa lta bu zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase “like the ripening of karma” means

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa dang 'dra zhes pa rnam par smin pa nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa dang 'dra zhes pa rnam par smin pa nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: that it is not the ripening of karma itself, but

original: de dang 'dra ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba bstan pa'o //
translated: a teaching that is similar to that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems dad pa'i sems can ni las kyi rnam par smin pa la brten te /
analyzed: sems dad pa'i sems can ni las kyi rnam par smin pa la brten te /
translated: Faithful sentient beings, in dependence upon the ripening of karma,

original: de nyid zad par 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: de nyid zad par 'gyur gyis /
translated: exhaust that very [karma].

original: bcom ldan 'das ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: The Blessed One is the result that is the natural outflow of the great accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: de zad par mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de zad par mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: That [result] is not exhausted.

original: snying po byang chub kyi sku ste bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen @183b po'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu bas na rnam par smin pa lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snying po byang chub kyi sku ste bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen @183b po'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu bas na rnam par smin pa lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: The body of enlightenment, the essence, is the result that is in accordance with the cause of the great accumulations of merit and wisdom. Therefore, it is called “like a fully ripened result.”

original: yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag por yi ge aa bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge 'khor lo bskor ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi bdag por yi ge aa bzhag pa ste /
translated: The letter A is placed as the lord of the maṇḍala of the wheel of letters.

original: aa de'i yon tan dang brjod pa dang bcas par gsungs pa /
analyzed: aa de'i yon tan dang brjod pa dang bcas par gsungs pa /
translated: The qualities and expressions of that A are taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku thams cad ces pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku thams cad ces pa ni /
translated: “The body of all tathāgatas” is from there.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po 'di la nan tan du bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po 'di la nan tan du bya'o zhes pa'i bar du ste /
translated: “This essence of the tathāgatas should be practiced” is up to there.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yan lag thams cad nas zhes pa ni yi ge aa ste /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yan lag thams cad nas zhes pa ni yi ge aa ste /
translated: “All the limbs of all tathāgatas” is the letter A.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lus kyi 'khor lo sku thams cad nas byung ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lus kyi 'khor lo sku thams cad nas byung ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “arising from all the bodies of the body wheel of the tathāgatas” is that.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pas zhes pa de dag ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pas zhes pa de dag ni /
translated: “Mundane and supramundane” is that.

original: yi ge aa'i mthu chen po bstan pa ste /
analyzed: yi ge aa'i mthu chen po bstan pa ste /
translated: Those are the teachings on the great power of the letter A.

original: de 'jig rten pa zhes pa ni mu stegs kyi drang srong la sogs pa dang / phyogs gcig stong par lta ba rnams so //
analyzed: de 'jig rten pa zhes pa ni mu stegs kyi drang srong la sogs pa dang / phyogs gcig stong par lta ba rnams so //
translated: The phrase mundane refers to the sages of the tīrthikas and so on, and those who view emptiness as a one-sided position.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhes byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhes byang chub sems dpa' rnams la bya ste /
translated: The phrase supramundane refers to the bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos dag ni 'og nas 'byung bas na 'dir ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: nyan thos dag ni 'og nas 'byung bas na 'dir ni ma gtogs so //
translated: The śrāvakas are not included here because they will be discussed below.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag kyang rang gi rnam par grol ba phyogs gcig gi sgo stong pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag kyang rang gi rnam par grol ba phyogs gcig gi sgo stong pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: The śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas also abide in the emptiness that is the door of one-sided liberation.

original: de rnams kyang sngags bsgrub pa'i 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sgor 'jug pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang sngags bsgrub pa'i 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sgor 'jug pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: They also have two types of entry into mantra and entry into the door of meditative concentration.

original: de gnyis ka'i yang srog dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i yang srog dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: Both of those are like the life force.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag thams cad kyang don dam pa yang la la ni ma nor la /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang don dam pa yang la la ni ma nor la /
translated: All of them are based on the meaning of ultimate emptiness, but some are not unmistaken,

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i stong pa la la ni phyogs mtshams stong par lta ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i stong pa la la ni phyogs mtshams stong par lta ba ste /
translated: and some view emptiness as a one-sided emptiness.

original: spyir thams cad stong pa'i don la brten pas na /
analyzed: spyir thams cad stong pa'i don la brten pas na /
translated: In general, all of them are based on the meaning of emptiness.

original: yi ge aa'i don ma skyes pa'i chos nyid de dag thams cad kyi srog lta bu'o //
analyzed: yi ge aa'i don ma skyes pa'i chos nyid de dag thams cad kyi srog lta bu'o //
translated: The meaning of the letter A is the unborn reality, which is the life-force of all of them.

original: kun rdzob tu gang yang yig 'bru la brten pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu gang yang yig 'bru la brten pa'o //
translated: All of them are based on the letters in the relative sense.

original: chos thams cad aa las gyur pas na srog lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad aa las gyur pas na srog lta bu'o //
translated: Since all phenomena arise from A, it is like their life-force.

original: de la bsam gtan zhes pa ni sbyor ba ste sems pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan zhes pa ni sbyor ba ste sems pa'o //
translated: Here, “meditation” is the application, the intention.

original: bsam gtan byas zhes pa ni gang bsam pa de'i 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan byas zhes pa ni gang bsam pa de'i 'bras bu ste /
translated: “Having meditated” is the result of that intention.

original: de ni bsam gtan gyi sgo nas 'jug pa'o//
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan gyi sgo nas 'jug pa'o//
translated: This is the entry by way of meditation.

original: sgo sgrub pa ni rab dang 'bring dang tha ma la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sgo sgrub pa ni rab dang 'bring dang tha ma la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Accomplishment” is the entry into the superior, middling, and inferior, and so on.

original: de la bsgrub pa'i phyir 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de la bsgrub pa'i phyir 'jug pa ste /
translated: In order to accomplish that, there is the entry.

original: de ni sngags bsgrub pa'i sgor zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sngags bsgrub pa'i sgor zhugs pa'o //
translated: This is the entry into the door of mantra accomplishment.

original: yig 'bru rnams kyang kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sgo nas srog la sogs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: yig 'bru rnams kyang kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sgo nas srog la sogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The letters also become the life-force, and so on, by way of the relative and ultimate.

original: de la / yi ge rnams kyi tsher 'gyur ba //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la / yi ge rnams kyi tsher 'gyur ba // zhes pa ni /
translated: The life of the letters

original: byang chub @184a * //
analyzed: byang chub @184a * //
translated: is the enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: kyi sgo nas yi ge de rnams la brten pa'i phyir tsher gyur te /
analyzed: kyi sgo nas yi ge de rnams la brten pa'i phyir tsher gyur te /
translated: Since those letters are based on the door of enlightenment, they become the life.

original: aa zhes pa'i don ni ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: aa zhes pa'i don ni ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the letter A is non-arising.

original: de bzhin du yi ge ka zhes bya ba'i don dngos po thams cad dang bral ba ste ma skyes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge ka zhes bya ba'i don dngos po thams cad dang bral ba ste ma skyes pa'i don to //
translated: Similarly, the meaning of the letter Ka is the absence of all things, the meaning of non-arising.

original: de bas na yi ge ka byang chub kyi sa bon gyi tshe yang aa la rag lus pa'i phyir srog ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yi ge ka byang chub kyi sa bon gyi tshe yang aa la rag lus pa'i phyir srog ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the letter Ka is called life-force because it depends on A when it is the seed of enlightenment.

original: de bzhin du yi ge lhag ma rnams kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge lhag ma rnams kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: The remaining letters should be understood in the same way.

original: de la yi ge rnams kyi srog ces pa ni spyod pa'i sgo nas yig 'bru rnams de la rtogs pas na /
analyzed: de la yi ge rnams kyi srog ces pa ni spyod pa'i sgo nas yig 'bru rnams de la rtogs pas na /
translated: Here, the life-force of the letters is the door of activity, because the letters are realized in that.

original: de bas na srog ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na srog ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called life-force.

original: skyabs su 'gyur zhes pa ni kun du sangs rgyas pa'i sgo nas yi ge rnams kyis brten pas na skyabs so//
analyzed: skyabs su 'gyur zhes pa ni kun du sangs rgyas pa'i sgo nas yi ge rnams kyis brten pas na skyabs so//
translated: It is a refuge means that the letters are supported by it through complete enlightenment, so it is a refuge.

original: 'byung ngo zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo nas yi ge rnams 'byung ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'byung ngo zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo nas yi ge rnams 'byung ba'i don to //
translated: It arises means that the letters arise in the sense of nirvana.

original: rigs kyi bu 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sku 'khor lo thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs zhes pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sku 'khor lo thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Son of noble family, this is the consecration of all the tathāgatas means the consecration of all the buddha bodies.

original: sngags kyi sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi bya ba zhugs pa zhes pa ni yi ge aa de'i mthu chen po bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi sgo nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi bya ba zhugs pa zhes pa ni yi ge aa de'i mthu chen po bstan pa ste /
translated: Those who practice the bodhisattva deeds through the gateway of mantra engage in the activities of the buddhas means the teaching of the great power of that letter A.

original: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du 'byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du 'byung ba'i tshe /
translated: When a buddha appears in the world,

original: chos rnam pa gnyis bstan pa ni sangs rgyas kyi bya ba ste /
analyzed: chos rnam pa gnyis bstan pa ni sangs rgyas kyi bya ba ste /
translated: he teaches two kinds of Dharma, which are the activities of the buddhas.

original: gnyis pa ni bsam pa dag pa rnams la thob pa'i chos bstan pa dang / bsam pa ma dag pa rnams la lugs kyi chos bstan to //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni bsam pa dag pa rnams la thob pa'i chos bstan pa dang / bsam pa ma dag pa rnams la lugs kyi chos bstan to //
translated: The second is teaching the Dharma of attainment to those with pure intention and teaching the Dharma of convention to those with impure intention.

original: de bzhin du yi ge aa yang chos de gnyis ka ston pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du yi ge aa yang chos de gnyis ka ston pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: In the same way, the letter A is the cause that teaches both of those Dharmas.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi bya ba la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi bya ba la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it engages in the activities of the buddhas.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: thob pa'i chos rnams kyang yi ge aa de'i don ma skyes pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: thob pa'i chos rnams kyang yi ge aa de'i don ma skyes pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The Dharma of attainment also arises from the meaning of that letter A, which is non-arising.

original: lugs kyi chos rnams kyang yig 'bru'i sgo nas bshad do //
analyzed: lugs kyi chos rnams kyang yig 'bru'i sgo nas bshad do //
translated: The Dharma of the system is also explained from the perspective of the letters.

original: chos thams cad yi ge aa las ma gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad yi ge aa las ma gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is nothing that is not included in the letter A.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byed par ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byed par ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is it known that it performs the activities of the Buddha?

original: gsungs pa aa zhes bya ba'i sgo nas chos thams cad 'byung zhes so /
analyzed: gsungs pa aa zhes bya ba'i sgo nas chos thams cad 'byung zhes so /
translated: It is said, “From the door of the letter A, all dharmas arise.”

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: yi ge aa zhes bya bas rgyu byas pa na /
analyzed: yi ge aa zhes bya bas rgyu byas pa na /
translated: When the letter A is used as the cause,

original: thob pa'i chos dang lugs kyi chos thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa'i chos dang lugs kyi chos thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: all dharmas of attainment and the Dharma of the system arise.

original: de ltar yi ge aa zhes bya ba de sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byed cing chos thams cad 'byung ba'i sgo yin pas na /
analyzed: de ltar yi ge aa zhes bya ba de sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byed cing chos thams cad 'byung ba'i sgo yin pas na /
translated: Thus, since that letter A performs the activities of the Buddha and is the door for the arising of all dharmas,

original: yi ge aa de sngags brjod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs par blta'o zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: yi ge aa de sngags brjod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs par blta'o zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
translated: the bodhisattvas who recite the mantra should view that letter A as the Tathāgata.

original: de @184b la de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: de @184b la de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar 'dod pas /
translated: Therefore, one who wishes to see the Tathāgata🔽should cultivate the essence of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po la mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i yi ge aa zhes pa'i don ni snying po byang chub nyid kyi snying po ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po la mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i yi ge aa zhes pa'i don ni snying po byang chub nyid kyi snying po ste /
translated: The meaning of the syllable “a” is the essence of enlightenment, the essence of the Tathāgata,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is not different from the nature of the Tathāgata.

original: de ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: de ni don dam pa'o //
translated: This is the ultimate truth.

original: kun rdzob tu na aa zhes bya ba'i yi ge'i 'bru de bsgoms na /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu na aa zhes bya ba'i yi ge'i 'bru de bsgoms na /
translated: In the relative truth, when one meditates on the syllable “a,”

original: de'i mthus de bzhin gshegs pa grangs med pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mthus de bzhin gshegs pa grangs med pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: through the power of that, countless tathāgatas arise.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mchod par 'dod pas kyang yi ge 'di bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mchod par 'dod pas kyang yi ge 'di bsgom par bya ste /
translated: One who wishes to make offerings to the Tathāgata should also meditate on this syllable.

original: mchod pa yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ba ni nan tan gyis mchod pa dang zang zing gi mchod pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ba ni nan tan gyis mchod pa dang zang zing gi mchod pa'o //
translated: Offerings should be understood as twofold: offerings of practice and material offerings.

original: de la nan tan gyis mchod pa ni /
analyzed: de la nan tan gyis mchod pa ni /
translated: Among them, the offering of practice

original: yi ge aa de nyid kyi don la bsgom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ge aa de nyid kyi don la bsgom par 'gyur ro //
translated: is the meditation on the meaning of that very syllable “a.”

original: zang zing gis mchod pa ni yi ge aa de bsgom pa'i mthus na /
analyzed: zang zing gis mchod pa ni yi ge aa de bsgom pa'i mthus na /
translated: The material offering is the offering of the letter A.🔽

original: mchod pa'i sprin rgya chen po nam mkha' gang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchod pa'i sprin rgya chen po nam mkha' gang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The material offering is the great cloud of offering filling the sky through the power of meditating on the letter A.🔽One who wishes to manifest the thought of enlightenment should meditate on the meaning of the letter A.

original: byang chub kyi sems mngon du byed 'dod pas zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po yan chad kyi sems la bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems mngon du byed 'dod pas zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po yan chad kyi sems la bya ste /
translated: The thought of enlightenment refers to the thought of the first stage of a Bodhisattva and above.

original: de mngon par byed 'dod pas yi ge aa'i don mngon par bsgrub par byos shig ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: de mngon par byed 'dod pas yi ge aa'i don mngon par bsgrub par byos shig ces pa'i don to //
translated: One who wishes to manifest that should meditate on the meaning of the letter A.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub kyi sems kyang ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyang ma skyes pa'o //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is also unproduced.

original: yi ge aa'i don kyang ma skyes pas mtshungs pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: yi ge aa'i don kyang ma skyes pas mtshungs pa'i phyir ro//
translated: The meaning of the letter A is also unproduced, because of the similarity.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyang lhan cig tu gnas par 'dod pas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyang lhan cig tu gnas par 'dod pas zhes pa ni /
translated: One who wishes to abide together with the thought of enlightenment should meditate on the meaning of the letter A.

original: de ltar 'dod pa yi ge aa'i don la sgoms shig ces pa'i don te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa yi ge aa'i don la sgoms shig ces pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that one who wishes to do that should meditate on the meaning of the letter A.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang ma skyes pa'i don la dmigs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang ma skyes pa'i don la dmigs /
translated: The Bodhisattvas also focus on the meaning of the unproduced.

original: yi ge aa yang ma skyes pa'i don la dmigs pas na /
analyzed: yi ge aa yang ma skyes pa'i don la dmigs pas na /
translated: The letter A also focuses on the meaning of non-arising.

original: spyod yul mthun pas lhan cig tu skyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyod yul mthun pas lhan cig tu skyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, they are co-emergent in terms of having a common domain.

original: de yan chad ni bsam gtan gyi sgo nas bsgom pa dang / aa nyid sngags kyi sgo nas bsgrub pa la zhugs pa gnyis ka thun mong ba'i yon tan no //
analyzed: de yan chad ni bsam gtan gyi sgo nas bsgom pa dang / aa nyid sngags kyi sgo nas bsgrub pa la zhugs pa gnyis ka thun mong ba'i yon tan no //
translated: Up to this point, the qualities are common to both those who engage in meditation through concentration and those who practice through the mantra of A.

original: grub pa mngon par 'dod ces pa ni sngags kyi sgo nas zhugs na /
analyzed: grub pa mngon par 'dod ces pa ni sngags kyi sgo nas zhugs na /
translated: As for desiring accomplishment, if one enters through the mantra approach,

original: grub pa rab 'bring rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: grub pa rab 'bring rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: there are three types of accomplishment: highest, middling, and least.

original: de rnams ni yan lag tu smos pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de rnams ni yan lag tu smos pa'i tshig ste /
translated: These are the terms mentioned as branches.

original: mdor na thams cad mkhyen pa grub par 'dod pas 'di sgoms shig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: mdor na thams cad mkhyen pa grub par 'dod pas 'di sgoms shig ces gsungs so //
translated: In brief, it is taught: Meditate on this, desiring the accomplishment of omniscience.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor bri ba'i cho ga rnam pa gsum gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor bri ba'i cho ga rnam pa gsum gsungs pa /
translated: Next, the three types of mandala drawing rituals are taught.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snying rje chen po 'byung ba las gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor @185a * //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis snying rje chen po 'byung ba las gyur pa'i dkyil 'khor @185a * //
translated: Then, the Blessed One taught the king of mandalas arisen from the source of great compassion,

original: gyi rgyal po dgod pa dang / lha'i gnas gtan la dbab pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gyi rgyal po dgod pa dang / lha'i gnas gtan la dbab pa zhes pa ni /
translated: called Arranging the Abodes of the Deities.

original: de la snying rje chen po 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes dngos su ni lus kyi 'khor lo'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i dkyil 'khor 'di dang / bdag rang gi dkyil 'khor la yang ming du gdags so //
analyzed: de la snying rje chen po 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes dngos su ni lus kyi 'khor lo'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i dkyil 'khor 'di dang / bdag rang gi dkyil 'khor la yang ming du gdags so //
translated: In this regard, the mandala of the consecration of the body cakra is actually called “arisen from great compassion, ” and also my own mandala is designated by that name.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'khor lo rnam pa gsum po yang snying rje chen po 'byung ba las gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor lo rnam pa gsum po yang snying rje chen po 'byung ba las gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the three cakras are also arisen from great compassion.

original: de la bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi mthur gyur cing rgyur bya'o //
analyzed: de la bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi mthur gyur cing rgyur bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the activity is to be made into the power of the mandala and the cause.

original: lha'i gnas gtan la dbab ces pa ni /
analyzed: lha'i gnas gtan la dbab ces pa ni /
translated: The determination of the abode of the deities is🔽the determination of the abode of the deities in the outer and inner🔽ornaments, and the emanation into sameness in samādhi is the

original: dbung mtha' dang mchog rgyan du lha'i bzhugs pa'i gnas nges par bya ba dang / ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par sprul zhes bya ba ni gang ting nge 'dzin du zhugs nas bsrung ba'i rig pa dang sngags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbung mtha' dang mchog rgyan du lha'i bzhugs pa'i gnas nges par bya ba dang / ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par sprul zhes bya ba ni gang ting nge 'dzin du zhugs nas bsrung ba'i rig pa dang sngags la sogs pa'o //
translated: protection awareness and mantra, etc.🔽The conduct of mantra is the conduct of action at the time of

original: sngags kyi spyod pa zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i tshe las su spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa'i tshe las su spyod pa rnams so //
translated: entering the mandala.

original: bsam pa'i cho ga bya ba ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa na /
analyzed: bsam pa'i cho ga bya ba ni dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa na /
translated: The ritual of the thought is the entry into the mandala.

original: slob mas byang chub kyi sems su bsam pa dang / slob dpon rang gi ting nge 'dzin du gnas pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: slob mas byang chub kyi sems su bsam pa dang / slob dpon rang gi ting nge 'dzin du gnas pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said that the thought of the disciple is the Thought of Enlightenment, and the thought of the master is the abiding in his own samadhi, and so on.

original: de la re re zhing bshad pa ni 'di man chad nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la re re zhing bshad pa ni 'di man chad nas 'byung ngo //
translated: The explanation of each of these will come later.

original: de la dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal por rnam par bkod ces pa ni /
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor gyi rgyal por rnam par bkod ces pa ni /
translated: Therein, arrayed in the king of mandalas means🔽that the master, abiding in the door of omniscience, the syllable A, and so on, up to the nature of the Tathagata, the emptiness of his own form,

original: don bshad pa'i gsungs pa de la slob dpon gyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgo aa zhes pa la gnas te zhes pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rang gi gzugs zhes pa'i bar du'o //🔽de dkyil 'khor gyi thig bri ba'i tshe /
analyzed: don bshad pa'i gsungs pa de la slob dpon gyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgo aa zhes pa la gnas te zhes pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid kyi rang gi gzugs zhes pa'i bar du'o // de dkyil 'khor gyi thig bri ba'i tshe /
translated: explains the meaning of the mantra.🔽 When the master draws the lines of the mandala,

original: dkyil 'khor gyis nam bu re re zhing yang /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyis nam bu re re zhing yang /
translated: he should draw each line of the mandala

original: slob dpon gyis ting nge 'dzin re res gsungs te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ting nge 'dzin re res gsungs te /
translated: with each samadhi.

original: phyi rol gyi rim pa'i dkyil 'khor la byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las skyes pa rnams bzhugs pas na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rim pa'i dkyil 'khor la byang chub sems dpa' 'jam dpal la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las skyes pa rnams bzhugs pas na /
translated: In the outer surrounding mandala, the bodhisattvas Manjushri and so forth, who are born from the perfections, reside.

original: thig bri ba'i slob dpon gyis ting nge 'dzin kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu'i gnas kyi snying po yi ge aa la gnas te dkyil 'khor gyi skud pa drongs shig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: thig bri ba'i slob dpon gyis ting nge 'dzin kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgyu'i gnas kyi snying po yi ge aa la gnas te dkyil 'khor gyi skud pa drongs shig ces gsungs so //
translated: The master who draws the lines, abiding in the essence of the seed syllable A, the abode of the cause of omniscience, should say, “Pull the line of the mandala.”

original: de la dang po thig bri ba'i tshe dang por nam mkha'i thig bri bar gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de la dang po thig bri ba'i tshe dang por nam mkha'i thig bri bar gsungs pa la /
translated: When first drawing the lines, it is said that first the line of space is drawn.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag 'tshal nas zhes pa nas byang phyogs su bltas te thig skud drongs shig ces pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la phyag 'tshal nas zhes pa nas byang phyogs su bltas te thig skud drongs shig ces pa'i bar du'o //
translated: From “Homage to all the buddhas” up to “Look to the north and pull the line.”

original: de nas sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi thig bri ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi thig bri ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Then, in order to draw the line of the earth mandala, it is said:

original: @185b nub phyogs su ltos la thig skud drongs shig ces so //
analyzed: @185b nub phyogs su ltos la thig skud drongs shig ces so //
translated: “Look to the west and pull the line.”

original: lhag ma rnams 'dir ma gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams 'dir ma gsungs pa ni /
translated: The rest is not mentioned here.

original: snying rje chen po'i dkyil 'khor du thig bri ba zhib tu bshad zin pas /
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i dkyil 'khor du thig bri ba zhib tu bshad zin pas /
translated: The drawing of the lines in the maṇḍala of great compassion has been explained in detail.

original: 'di'i lhag ma ni de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i lhag ma ni de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The rest of this should be understood as similar to that.

original: de nas snyid po'i dkyil 'khor thig bri ba'i slob dpon ting nge 'dzin bshad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nas snyid po'i dkyil 'khor thig bri ba'i slob dpon ting nge 'dzin bshad par gsungs pa /
translated: Next, the master of drawing the lines in the maṇḍala of the essence is said to explain the samādhi.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje zhes pa nas /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje zhes pa nas /
translated: From “Vajrasattva Vajrapāṇi” up to

original: snying po'i dkyil 'khor brtag par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: snying po'i dkyil 'khor brtag par bya'o zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: “one should examine the maṇḍala of the essence.”

original: de'i slob dpon gyi ting nge 'dzin ni byang chub pa'i sa bon yi ge aas bskyed pa'i rdo rje sems dpar slob dpon bdag byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: de'i slob dpon gyi ting nge 'dzin ni byang chub pa'i sa bon yi ge aas bskyed pa'i rdo rje sems dpar slob dpon bdag byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: The samādhi of that master is the master’s self-consecration as Vajrasattva generated by the seed syllable oṃ.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' la yang las kyi rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bzhin du 'dren pa yang yod de /
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' la yang las kyi rdo rje sems dpa' la sogs pa bzhin du 'dren pa yang yod de /
translated: Also, in the case of Vajrasattva, there is a guide, like the activity Vajrasattva, and so on.

original: de'i skabs su gzhan la mi bya'i rdo rje sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje la bya'o //
analyzed: de'i skabs su gzhan la mi bya'i rdo rje sems dpa' phyag na rdo rje la bya'o //
translated: In that context, it is not done for others but for Vajrasattva Vajrapāṇi.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor bar ma'i snam bu'i thig bri ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsungs pa de bzhin du gnyis pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa nas snying po nyid kyi gzugs zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor bar ma'i snam bu'i thig bri ba'i ting nge 'dzin gsungs pa de bzhin du gnyis pa'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa nas snying po nyid kyi gzugs zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Then, the concentration of drawing the lines of the middle band of the mandala is taught, and similarly, from “the second mandala” up to “the form of the essence itself.”

original: de la dkyil 'khor snam bu bar ma'i nang na rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis bzhugs te /
analyzed: de la dkyil 'khor snam bu bar ma'i nang na rdzogs longs spyod pa'i sku dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis bzhugs te /
translated: In that, the enjoyment body and the emanation body of the two reside in the middle band of the mandala.

original: dkyil 'khor de'i thig bri ba'i tshe yang sku de gnyis kyi rgyu'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bzhi'i slob dpon gyi byin gyis rlabs te slob dpon gyi ting nge 'dzin de rnams dmigs nas bya'o zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor de'i thig bri ba'i tshe yang sku de gnyis kyi rgyu'i ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bzhi'i slob dpon gyi byin gyis rlabs te slob dpon gyi ting nge 'dzin de rnams dmigs nas bya'o zhes pa'i don te /
translated: When the lines of that mandala are drawn, the master’s consecration of the four aspects of the causal concentration of those two bodies is done by visualizing those concentrations of the master.

original: de la dang po ni zhi ba'i zhes bya ba byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni zhi ba'i zhes bya ba byang chub pa'o //
translated: The first is the consecration of peace.

original: gnyis zhes pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis zhes pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: The second is the consecration of activity.

original: stong pa'i gzugs zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa'i gzugs zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The form of emptiness is the consecration of nirvāṇa.

original: lhag ma ni gnas gtan la phab par bya'o zhes pa ni de'i rgyud nas bshad pa 'di man chad du 'byung ste /
analyzed: lhag ma ni gnas gtan la phab par bya'o zhes pa ni de'i rgyud nas bshad pa 'di man chad du 'byung ste /
translated: This is explained in the Tantra from here on.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das lha'i gzugs su rtag go zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das lha'i gzugs su rtag go zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Then the Blessed One is always in the form of the deity.

original: de la snam bu gcig las kyang gsum du bgos te sum char bskor bar bya /
analyzed: de la snam bu gcig las kyang gsum du bgos te sum char bskor bar bya /
translated: There, from one cloth, divide into three and encircle one third.

original: sum gnyis lha'i gzugs su bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sum gnyis lha'i gzugs su bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Two thirds should be made into the form of the deity.

original: thig drangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa mngon du bya'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: thig drangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa mngon du bya'o zhes pa ni /
translated: Having drawn the lines, manifest the conduct of the Tathagata.

original: de ltar lha'i gnas dang bskor sa dgod pa nyid kyi tshom bu mi bya bar thig btab ste bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lha'i gnas dang bskor sa dgod pa nyid kyi tshom bu mi bya bar thig btab ste bya'o //
translated: Thus, without making the heaps of the site and the circumambulation path itself, one should make them by drawing lines.

original: de nyid kyi tshe na yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa stong pa nyid la dmigs zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe na yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa stong pa nyid la dmigs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: At that very time, one should focus on the emptiness that is the conduct of the Tathagata.

original: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi tshon rtsi rnams byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: de nas dkyil 'khor gyi tshon rtsi rnams byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga gsungs pa yang /
translated: Then, the ritual for consecrating the colors of the mandala is also stated.

original: bcom @186a * //
analyzed: bcom @186a * //
translated: The Blessed One is always in the form of the deity.

original: ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad du bdag nyid byin gyis brlab po zhes pa nas /
analyzed: ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad du bdag nyid byin gyis brlab po zhes pa nas /
translated: I consecrate myself as the transcendent conqueror Vairochana.🔽

original: bdud kyi sde gnod pa thams cad bsdigs pa zhes pa'i bar du /
analyzed: bdud kyi sde gnod pa thams cad bsdigs pa zhes pa'i bar du /
translated: One should consecrate oneself as the Blessed Vairocana, from the beginning up to all the hosts of Mara are frightened.
